";s:3:"faq";s:3782:"<p>For all frequently asked questions, and their answers, check the <a href="https://www.monsterinsights.com/docs/" rel="nofollow">MonsterInsights Knowledge base</a>.</p>

<h4>Why use Google Analytics vs WordPress stats?</h4>
<p>
<p>Native WordPress stats plugin will always slow down your website because they rely on your WordPress hosting server. Most of them do not provide accurate WordPress analytics either.</p>
<p>Some WordPress stats plugin use third-party servers to mitigate this issue, but they all lack powerful features that Google Analytics can offer.</p>
<p>Google Analytics is the #1 analytics solution in the world. It comes with all the powerful features that you can ever ask for. MonsterInsights makes it easy for you to use all advanced Google Analytics features in WordPress.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I use MonsterInsights together with another Google Analytics plugin?</h4>
<p>
<p>No. You should only use one Google Analytics plugin on your WordPress site. If you use multiple Google Analytics plugins, then you will compromise your data integrity. It will skew your data and you might see inflated stats.</p>
<p>We recommend uninstalling other Google Analytics plugins before you install MonsterInsights.</p>
</p>
<h4>Why does MonsterInsights load Google Analytics in WordPress header section?</h4>
<p>
<p>Some people believe that loading Google Analytics in WordPress header will slow down your website. That&#8217;s a myth. Google Analytics loads asynchronously which means that it does not impact your website speed at all.</p>
<p>MonsterInsights load Google Analytics code in WordPress header because it makes sure that you have the most accurate tracking.</p>
</p>
<h4>How does MonsterInsights help with Google Analytics GDPR compliance?</h4>
<p>
<p>MonsterInsights helps make Google Analytics GDPR compliance easier for business owners.</p>
<p>Our EU compliance addon allows you to:</p>
<ul>
<li>Anonymyze IP in Google Analytics</li>
<li>Disable the Demographics and Interest Reports for Remarketing and Advertising</li>
<li>Disable UserID and author name tracking</li>
<li>Enable the ga() compatibility mode</li>
<li>Integrate with Cookie Notice and CookieBot plugins to collect user consent before tracking</li>
<li>Integrate with Google AMP Consent Box before enable tracking</li>
<li>Integrate with Google Analytic&#8217;s Chrome browser opt-out extension and built-in cookie opt-out system</li>
<li>Offer Easy Opt Out link for Google Analytics tracking</li>
</ul>
<p>While no single plugin can guarantee 100% GDPR compliance in WordPress, MonsterInsights goes to great length in helping business owners with Google Analytics GDPR compliance.</p>
<p>For more details, see: <a href="https://www.monsterinsights.com/gdpr-and-monsterinsights-everything-you-need-to-know/" rel="friend nofollow">GDPR and MonsterInsights &#8211; Everything You Need to Know</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Which eCommerce plugins are compatible with MonsterInsights Enhanced Ecommerce Tracking feature?</h4>
<p>
<p>If you are looking to enable Google Analytics Ecommerce tracking in WordPress, then MonsterInsights is the best solution to do that.</p>
<p>MonsterInsights Enhanced Ecommerce Tracking works with both WooCommerce and Easy Digital Downloads.</p>
<p>With just 1-click, you can enable Google Analytics Enhanced Ecommerce Tracking for WooCommerce and see useful WooCommerce analytics report right inside your WordPress dashboard.</p>
</p>
<h4>Does MonsterInsights work on WordPress multisite?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes. MonsterInsights offers the most comprehensive Google Analytics solution for WordPress multi-site.</p>
<p>It comes with advanced permission control, sample rate control, and other options that you need to properly enable Google Analytics on WordPress multisite.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:35943:"<h4>7.3.0: October 30, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: We&#8217;ve added new custom link attribution, so now you can easily set custom link categories, actions, and labels, which MonsterInsights will use with precedence over our comprehensive automatic link detection, and is compatible with our AMP addon. For usage instructions, see our documentation on <a href="https://www.monsterinsights.com/docs/custom-link-attribution/" rel="nofollow">custom link attribution</a>.</li>
<li>Tweak: Better error handling for reports.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where on MonsterInsights pages, the dropdowns on the WP admin menu might not work.</li>
<li>Fixed: Compatibility for Writee theme, YouTube by EmbedPlus plugin, Blog Time plugin, MaterialWP plugin and Swifty Image Widget plugin.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where on a network install of multisite, all sites might not de-authenticate on removal.</li>
<li>Fixed: Compatibility issue with Microsoft Edge and IE browsers where the table on overview report might overflow.</li>
<li>Fixed: On certain browsers when the browser screen width is small the graph tooltips might have appeared off-center.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.2.0: September 19, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: Sites with large traffic will see numbers larger than 1 million abbreviated so the numbers will no longer overflow out of the report container boxes.</li>
<li>Tweak: We&#8217;ve clarified the download tracking setting to point out that externally hosted downloads are now tracked as downloads, not external links.</li>
<li>Tweak: Compatibility for the Fix WP Tables and Magee Shortcodes</li>
<li>Fixed: We&#8217;ve fixed issues where sites that were recreated/migrated sometimes could not re-authenticate with MonsterInsights.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.1.0: August 8, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Comprehensive review of the plugin to ensure styles are correct when utilizing a right to left language.</li>
<li>Tweak: Compatibility for the WP Media Folder plugin, TagDiv Composer plugin, Ali Dropship plugin, Affiliate Boxes plugin, Impreza theme, GT3 Photo &amp; Video Gallery plugin, WP Booklist plugin, Houzez theme, Prowess theme, and Add Social Share plugin.</li>
<li>Tweak: Standardized capitalization and spelling of various strings.</li>
<li>Tweak: External download links will not be marked as downloads.</li>
<li>Tweak: Updated SweetAlert2 to the latest version.</li>
<li>Tweak: Tweaked error messages returned on the reports page to include more details and be more specific whenever possible.</li>
<li>Tweak: Documentation links will always open in a new tab now to ensure you don&#8217;t lose your place.</li>
<li>Fixed: Condition which caused the network UA code to not properly fallback in some instances.</li>
<li>Fixed: Some plugin links to our documentation have been corrected</li>
<li>Fixed: Sometimes error strings might be over-escaped. We&#8217;ve corrected some cases of this.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.0.9: June 26, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: The link to support for Lite now goes directly to the Lite support form.</li>
<li>Tweak: Compatibility fixes for the Newspaper theme and the WordPress Book List plugin.</li>
<li>Tweak: Sweetalert2, used for notices in core, now uses the newer 7.x release, which has a slightly better layout and fixes some bugs.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.0.8: June 19, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: Fixes some links to our documentation site.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.0.7: June 7, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: Compatibility with Selz plugin.</li>
<li>Tweak: Issue where some settings would remain hidden inadvertently.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where some lite users would see an error regarding a license key.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.0.6: May 14, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: Better handling of link tracking for links embedded as anchor tags inside of an SVG image.</li>
<li>Tweak: Link tracking has been updated to enforce more strict type checks on variables.</li>
<li>Tweak: Plugin conflict notice has been updated to use the actual name of the plugin.</li>
<li>Tweak: Compatibility fixes for users of the Ken, Vitrine, Artisian Nayma,Grand News, Tie and Church Suite Themes along with the WooCommerce bolder product alerts, Selz eCommerce and Artisian Pages plugin.</li>
<li>Tweak: Fixed &#8220;you you&#8221; typo on the Reports page notice.</li>
<li>Tweak: On the overview report the indicator icon colors for bounce rate have been flipped to more accurately describe the impact (ie green = bounce rate going down = good).</li>
<li>Fixed: Undefined $tracking variable error.</li>
<li>Fixed: Better type checking before converting number strings to human readable dates on reports.</li>
<li>Fixed: If GA didn&#8217;t load and link tracking was enabled, an undefined Javascript error could occur if the fallback object didn&#8217;t get set (edgecase).</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.0.5: April 9, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Introduced a system (behind-the-scenes) that automatically attempts to correct for improperly set timezones in the WordPress settings panel, server timezone settings and/or GA profile timezones. This should eliminate issues with timezones on Lite user accounts, as well as allow for more accurate date reporting.</li>
<li>New: Introduced a system (behind-the-scenes) to allow for deauthentication of profiles set on websites whose profiles were migrated (for example from a staging site to a production site)</li>
<li>Tweak: Made clientID retrieval more efficient.</li>
<li>Fixed: Several translation/textdomain and typo fixes.</li>
<li>Fixed: Undefined $num in the overview report.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.0.4: March 7, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: We&#8217;ve added links to the pages listed in the top pages part of the Overview report to make it easier to see which page each title belongs to.</li>
<li>New: We&#8217;ve added the UA code to the account selector to make it easier to determine which property to use.</li>
<li>New: Better compatibility with IE11.</li>
<li>New: The links to view more reporting data now default to the currently selected daterange when you go to analytics.google.com</li>
<li>Fixed: We&#8217;ve corrected some missing closing li tags on the overview report.</li>
<li>Fixed: We fixed an issue where get_current_screen might be undefined on some pages.</li>
<li>Fixed: We fixed an issue where some improperly configured servers might resolve symlinks that are not supposed to be resolved, leading to issues with loading asset files MonsterInsights uses.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.0.3: February 28, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: We added support for tracking download files that have a cache busting variable on the URL.</li>
<li>New: We added support for the new UserID mode used in our AMP addon.</li>
<li>Tweak: We fixed a bug with the notices class, and drastically cut back on the number of them.</li>
<li>Fixed: We fixed a bug with our Facebook Instant Articles addon that prevented some users from being tracked for downloads.</li>
<li>Fixed: We fixed a bug in the usage tracking for some types of installs.</li>
<li>Fixed: We&#8217;ve allowed the disabling of tracking for admininistrator role users on single sites.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.0.2: February 27, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Fixed a bug with the analytics.js output where a UA code wasn&#8217;t entered, the $reason variable could be undefined.</li>
<li>Fixed: Fixed an issue where a notice might not be dismissable and we&#8217;ve also removed several of them.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.0.1: February 26, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Support for the updated version of MonsterInsights AMP plugin which switches from using a custom REST endpoint to using the now built in Google AMP ClientID synching feature. If you&#8217;re using the AMP addon, you&#8217;ll want to also update that addon as well.</li>
<li>New: The __gaTracker and disable tracking functions will always be defined, even when we&#8217;re not tracking users (for example if viewing a preview, or if a logged-in administrator) to allow sites to not have to worry about breakage when variable exist checking isn&#8217;t done. </li>
<li>New: We now output a notice in the console and output the GA code (though do not run it) when we&#8217;re not tracking someone. This makes it easier to verify the Google code is indeed outputting, and also makes it more clear as to why a particular user isn&#8217;t being tracked. Note, when testing Google Analytics code, always do it logged out, ideally in the private browsing/incognito mode of your web browser. We&#8217;re going to keep working on improving the frontend system to simplify it and add new features for both Lite and Pro users now that we&#8217;ve jettisoned ga.js support in MonsterInsights 7.0. You&#8217;ll see updates through the year that add new tracking features, particularly ones that we&#8217;re tweaking in order to expand and refine our built-in reporting.</li>
<li>New: We added a &#8220;have a MonsterInsights license&#8221; link on the settings panel, to make it clearer the procedure for the quick and easy upgrade from MonsterInsights Lite to MonsterInsights Pro.</li>
<li>Tweak: We removed the phrase referencing the dashboard (removed in MonsterInsights 7.0) from the permissions settings.</li>
<li>Fixed: Due to us forgetting to include our jQuery shim for disable() in the Lite, some users were unable to use the 10/25/50 expand feature on the reports page.</li>
<li>Fixed: An accidental use of the PHP function date instead of the one called time meant that some users were unable to see updated reporting data each day in the Lite version.</li>
<li>Fixed: In sitei() in the api-auth class, we used mb_strimwidth to trim the final string to 30 characters. While this is a great PHP function, not all servers have the mbstring (Multibyte String) PHP extension installed, from which all mb_* functions are provided, despite it being a &#8220;required&#8221; PHP extension to use WordPress core. This caused some servers to be unable to authenticate and thus get our amazing new reports (sad face). This usage has been replaced with a standard substr use, thus allowing for compatibility with all servers.</li>
</ul>
<h4>7.0.0: February 20, 2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Completely revamped reports with a new UI.</li>
<li>New: Ability to oAuth at the network level, and have that oAuth apply as the default to all subsites (can still override at a subsite level).</li>
<li>New: Ability to enter a license key at the network level, and have that oAuth apply as the default to all subsites (can still override at a subsite level).</li>
<li>New: Completely new oAuth flow, that handles more errors and allows for future growth. Importantly, your existing sites will continue to track (the UA code is manually moved in the upgrade process), but you will need to re-authenticate (a quicker, and even easier process in 7.0) to enable our all new reporting area. New permissions requested to allow for significantly expanded reporting (and some upcoming reports).</li>
<li>New: Ability to see the site traffic graphs in both pageviews and sessions.</li>
<li>New: You can now choose between Last 30 days, Last 7 days, or any date range of your choosing if you&#8217;re a paid MonsterInsights user!</li>
<li>New: Compare site traffic to the previous period.</li>
<li>New: Completely revamped overview report. You&#8217;ll find lots of new data has been added. Also, all of that data changes as you use change the date ranges (a Pro exclusive feature).</li>
<li>New: A brand new eCommerce report for Pro users</li>
<li>New: A brand new Search Console/Queries report for paid MonsterInsights users. This allows you to see which terms you are ranking for on Google and how Google searches are driving your site traffic, along with clickthrough rates.</li>
<li>New: A brand new Publishers report for Plus level users allowing you to see breakdown of important site metrics.</li>
<li>New: A lot of behind the scenes work enabling more reports to be added in the future. Stay on the lookout as we start significantly expanding the breadth and depth of reporting this year.</li>
<li>New: A revised general settings panel which is significantly faster to load.</li>
<li>New: Significant performance improvements. We completely top-to-bottom audited MonsterInsights. It&#8217;s now 286% faster in the admin and 161% faster in the frontend.</li>
<li>New: Completely new internal notification handling has been implemented. This should make it clearer if you need to address anything, and if so make it less tedious to figure out exactly what.</li>
<li>Tweak: We&#8217;ve changed the verbage for what users see if they are logged in as a site administrator on the frontend to make it more clear MonsterInsights doesn&#8217;t track site administrators to prevent them from skewing their own Google Analytics data (particularly demographics data) and to encourage them to use the Incognito Mode/Private browsing mode of their web browser (or log out) if they want to view the Google Analytics code.</li>
<li>Tweak: The URL used for the measurement protocol calls has been updated per Google guidance.</li>
<li>Tweak: We&#8217;ve discovered some strings that weren&#8217;t translatable, and fixed that.</li>
<li>Tweak: Based on your feedback, we&#8217;ve clarified the titles and descriptions used in some of the settings to make it more clear as to what they do.</li>
<li>Tweak: When first adding a license key, in rare cases sometimes the addons permissions didn&#8217;t sync. While extremely rare, and while MonsterInsights would automatically fix itself within 6 hours, we&#8217;ve added a system that eliminates this from happening, and made sure that there&#8217;s also a way to fix this manually if this need arises.</li>
<li>Tweak: The countries map has been changed to a countries list (sorted). This means we can remove jVectorMap which had some issues in mapping, and also make it easier for you to see your top countries data.</li>
<li>Removed: Support for the long deprecated ga.js tracking has been removed. We&#8217;ve had dismissable (and then later non-dismissable) persistent admin notices for over a year now, and it&#8217;s time to remove support for these finally. Analytics.js tracking is far more accurate than ga.js tracking. Users of ga.js were not able to take advantage of new MonsterInsights features and Google Analytics features that relied on analytics.js, including our out-of-the-box Javascript based events tracking system, and many other features (like enhanced eCommerce tracking in our eCommerce addon). Google themselves deprecated ga.js over 5 years ago. On update, we&#8217;ll automatically move those using ga.js to analytics.js. This switch requires no changes on behalf of the site owner.</li>
<li>Removed: Support for the long deprecated PHP events tracking has been removed. We&#8217;ve had dismissable (and then later non-dismissable) persistent admin notices for over a year now offering a 1 click update. The PHP events tracking, a stayover from the Yoast years, caused a lot of issues and couldn&#8217;t track everything on a page. It could only track things in specific WordPress areas like the_content and widgets, but couldn&#8217;t track anything outside of that, or things that were added to the DOM after WordPress rendered the page. Our JS events tracking system can track all-the-things on all parts of a page, and is far more accurate and easier for us to maintain. Maintaining a gigantic PHP regex-based system took a lot of our development time up, and based on our opt-in tracking data, almost no one uses it anymore (which is good, because JS tracking is so much better). Users still using it will be automatically switched to JS events tracking on update (which requires no changes to switch to using it).</li>
<li>Removed: Many deprecated filters from the Yoast era have been removed. After maintaining backwards compatibility for over a year now, and also issuing a notice every time those deprecated filters were used, it&#8217;s time to pull the plug on these to allow our tracking system to be able to be simplified in the future. We have a complete document in our documentation for the 6.0 release that details exactly how to update for each of these filters.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.2.6: November 17, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: Compatibility with WordPress 4.9.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.2.5: NOT ISSUED</h4>
<ul>
<li>Skipped release version.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.2.4: October 6, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: Adjusted how the optin tracking is sent to us.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.2.3: September 9, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: Added a notice for new users of MonsterInsights about when the reports will begin populating.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.2.2: August 16, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: Adjusted order of setup/config notices</li>
<li>Fixed: Fixed an issue with the sanitation of number fields. Solves an issue with the Google Optimize extension.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.2.1: August 9, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: MonsterInsights now has the ability to automatically update itself and it&#8217;s addons. You can set MonsterInsights to automatically update minor versions only or all new versions inside the MonsterInsights settings panel in Tracking -&gt; Permissions.</li>
<li>Tweak: Introduce scrollbars on GA auth screen for users with many Google accounts</li>
<li>Tweak: Added notice to users still on deprecated GA.js tracking and PHP-based events tracking.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue with notices having multiple icons has been resolved.</li>
<li>Fixed: Facebook Instant Articles can now properly handle the Automattic Facebook plugin transformation changes (requires FB IA addon version 1.0.1 or newer)</li>
<li>Fixed: Conflict with wp_head output for some themes.</li>
<li>Fixed: Correct level for Forms and Google Optimize addons.</li>
<li>Fixed: License key errors will no longer show to lite users.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.2.0: June 6, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Form Tracking addon</li>
<li>New: Google Optimize addon</li>
<li>New: Facebook Instant Articles addon</li>
<li>New: Telephone link tracking</li>
<li>New: Functions for supporting enhanced eCommerce tracking in the eCommerce addon</li>
<li>New: Measurement protocol functions</li>
<li>New: Tweaks for the settings pages to get ready for a speed improvement release upcoming along with some coming soon addons.</li>
<li>Tweaks: Spelling corrections.</li>
<li>Fixed: Internet Explorer tracking fix.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue with initialization of settings on certain installs.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.1.11: May 31, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: Renamed the tools tab for settings import/export</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue with saving of manual UA codes</li>
<li>Fixed: Fixed a couple display issues in the admin</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue for undefined index when the settings array hasn&#8217;t been initialized.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.1.10, May 18, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Performance improvement in tracking.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.1.9, May 15, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Plugin has been tested for compatibility with WordPress 4.8-beta1. We&#8217;ll continue to test through the beta and release candidates, but MonsterInsights is 4.8 ready as-is.</li>
<li>Tweak: Deleting lite plugin will no longer delete license key of installed pro version.</li>
<li>Fixed: Import/export settings page has been fixed so that on sites with a ton of plugins installed that make lots of admin bar items, the admin bar will have relative positioning now to allow it to be scrollable.</li>
<li>Fixed: Users with more than 1 property for the same domain name can now use any of the views for those properties.</li>
<li>Fixed: For Pro users, sometimes all available addons for your license level didn&#8217;t show, requiring you to download them from our site. This has been corrected.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.1.8, May 11, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Functions needed to support future features including enhanced eCommerce</li>
<li>Fixed: Compatibility with Firefox for link tracking.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue saving certain fields.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.1.7, April 10, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Changes needed to support new addons, including the Google AMP addon, available as of today.</li>
<li>Tweak: Comments for frontend are minification-safe.</li>
<li>Tweak: GA notice is now hidden when debug mode is on.</li>
<li>Tweak: All settings now use the Settings API framework, including all addons.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.1.6, March 29, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Select2 filter for the Google oAuth list of profiles, to make it easier to find your Google property by fully supporting search by URL.</li>
<li>Tweak: Inbound-as-external now is prioritized before downloads in tracking preference order.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.1.5, March 24, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Added some functions to prepare for upcoming new addon (Google AMP) and updates (eCommerce, Performance, Dimensions).</li>
<li>Tweak: JS events tracking for click events.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.1.4, March 23, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: JS events tracking for click events.</li>
<li>Fixed: Edge case where JS events tracking won&#8217;t turn on if the main tracking setting was disabled (such as faulty import).</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.1.1 &#8211; 6.1.3 (depending on which version of MI you have), March 22, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: (pro users) Issue with JS events throwing an error for array on non-set settings.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.1.0, March 22, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Campaign URL building tool with shortlink capability.</li>
<li>New: Settings import/export tool.</li>
<li>New: Experimental (beta) hash tracking for single-page style themes. Note, as the description for the setting says, this feature is a beta feature, and can be tweaked or removed in upcoming versions.</li>
<li>New: Manual default subsite UA&#8217;s can now be set from the network settings panel for MonsterInsights.</li>
<li>New: Optout of GA tracking is now enabled per Google standard. See https://github.com/awesomemotive/google-analytics-for-wordpress/issues/488 for more information.</li>
<li>Tweak: Notices about JS conflicts now include the JS error when possible.</li>
<li>Tweak: Some tweaking to when the &#8220;Connection error with Google&#8221; error is displayed during oAuth.</li>
<li>Tweak: Notice now shown when too early to display statistics from Google.</li>
<li>Tweak: Inbound as outbound links may now have a period in them.</li>
<li>Tweak: Removed duplicate option checking on frontend.</li>
<li>Tweak: oAuth dialog now only programically closes when the select profile view is shown or when a new one is opened.</li>
<li>Tweak: Mailto links are now handled as an externally opening link, allowing to bypass issues with the Safari browser not following standards.</li>
<li>Tweak: WP-Admin Login page tracking has been removed.</li>
<li>Tweak: More countries now shown in the country map in the overview report.</li>
<li>Tweak: License key field is no longer shown on lite installs.</li>
<li>Tweak: Frontend JS file has been refactored to make it more unit testable.</li>
<li>Fixed: Download events now correctly include data in all cases not just some.</li>
<li>Fixed: A syntax error involving the manual UA code input has been resolved that could have affected some users under a rare circumstance.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.16, March 7, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Issues related to link tracking.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.15, March 7, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Issue with translation string numbering in the disabled user group frontend template.</li>
<li>Fixed: Resolved issue that caused issue with lightbox-style redirects.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where admin pages had JS issues from mis-ordered JS files.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.14, March 1, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: Allow for invalid license to be removed if debug turned on.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issues with internal links being tracked as internal-as-outbound</li>
<li>Fixed: Issues with tracking of downloads</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where optin tracking would opt-out on settings panel save</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.13, February 28, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: Better detection of issues with authentication due to an outdate WP version.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where JS tracking inadvertantly turned on debug mode due to a bad string to boolean conversion.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.12, February 27, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: The JS events tracking has been moved to a new JS file instead of inline. This will offer the same performance as inlining under HTTP/2, but with the benefit of better cache bursting.</li>
<li>New: Expanded admin adblock detection.</li>
<li>Tweak: Select2 is now bundled as Select300 in MonsterInsights. We&#8217;re pulling down the latest copy of Selct2 and then on-the-fly renaming it. This should end any conflicts between our select2 boxes and other plugins/themes.</li>
<li>Tweak: We&#8217;ve implemented better error detection on the authentication flow. Some users may have previously seen &#8220;No profile errors&#8221;, due to issues with their server setup will now see more accurate errors.</li>
<li>Tweak: For servers that use PHP Object caching, the cache will now be flushed during the uninstall routines. This should solve a very rare uninstall error.</li>
<li>Fixed: A &#8220;Invalid UA code&#8221; error was displayed whenever someone used oAuth2 and then saved the settings panel, despite having a valid UA code.</li>
<li>Fixed: An issue with the lazyloading of the Google Client for frontend use has been fixed.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.11, February 24, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Notice: Version numbers 6.0.5 &#8211; 6.0.10 were not used, as we&#8217;re synching the version numbers of the Lite and Pro versions of our plugin. You didn&#8217;t miss any updates.</li>
<li>Notice: As of this release, we no longer backport changes to the old <code>yst_ga</code> option. If you need to access MonsterInsights&#8217;s settings programically, please use our helper functions. Do not directly access a option.</li>
<li>New: Redesigned authentication dropdown that shows the site urls to make it easier to find a profile when the users have many accounts.</li>
<li>New: Tracking is now enabled for the WordPress admin login page (wp-login.php).</li>
<li>Tweak: The Google class in the admin now only checks for blocking when the reauth is attempted. Expect to save a ton of external calls in the admin, and maybe a performance boost.</li>
<li>Tweak: The GA client object is now lazyloaded on the frontend, so it&#8217;s loaded only when something (like another plugin) attempts to use it. In plain English, this will make a alot of sites load times significantly improve.</li>
<li>Tweak: The analytics.js output has been tweaked to be slightly more asthetically pleasing (its aligned correctly). We realize no one probably cares but we look at this code for every user we support, so it help us. </li>
<li>Tweak: The config expired notice has been updated to reflect that it can also be shown if the server is blocking MonsterInsights&#8217;s ability to connect to Google Analytics.</li>
<li>Tweak: The cron jobs for opt-in tracking and statistics have been combined into a single cron.</li>
<li>Tweak: Various performance improvements in the frontend output class.</li>
<li>Tweak: A notice is now shown when MonsterInsights rejects a manual UA code from being saved for being an invalid format.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where the plugin TweetShare would prevent users from being able to see their properties in the authentication dropdown.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where the manual UA code might not be ported as we were backporting changes to the monsterinsights_settings option to the yst_ga option for backwards compatibility. This lead to a situation where the new settings would override the old ones before the routine to fix the manual UA code issue had run.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where a fatal error from a reference to a class called &#8220;Yoast_Frontend_GA&#8221; which our plugin doesn&#8217;t have or use, would be shown caused by the previous Yoast usage of object caching via an autoloader. This is solved by doing a 1 time object cache flush on upgrade.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where if you had more than 1000 profiles on your Google account, not all would be shown.</li>
<li>Fixed: App analytics properties are now excluded from the dropdown of properties you can authenticate to.</li>
<li>Fixed: The readme suggested a filter to use for filtering the UA to use, but the filter name was typo&#8217;d. This has been fixed.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where the tracking cron would add a new unique cron each day.</li>
<li>Fixed: We implemented a routine to cleanup those extra crons as well as the old yoast one we no longer use.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where the .org theme Schema would prevent users from being able to see their properties in the authentication dropdown.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue where JS based events tracking might not correctly track a mailto: link.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.4, February 20, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: monsterinsights_delete_options now checks to ensure an array is passed in</li>
<li>Tweak: The reporting class now has many more object property checks.</li>
<li>Fixed: In install if WP version not supported or if MI Pro was active, the plugin attempted to call a property of the plugin object which didn&#8217;t exist.</li>
<li>Fixed: In the deactivate/uninstall routines, MI attempted to use a method of a class object which might not exist, as it might not be the active instance. Better instance handling has been added as well as many more exists checks have been added througought the plugin.</li>
<li>Fixed: Conflicting loads when both MI Pro and Lite are installed. Note, you should only have Pro installed if you want to use it. That being said, we&#8217;ve done extensive testing to ensure we&#8217;ve handled all of the edge cases surrounding this. This could also lead to issues where it would be impossible to remove Lite and/or Pro from a site if both were installed.</li>
<li>Fixed: Conflicts with the Pinnacle theme, which loads it&#8217;s CSS file (with overrides to literally all select2 inputs not just the ones it adds) across the entire admin. This lead to an issue where in the Google Auth, a user might not have been able to see (or could appear with wacky styling) the dropdown of profiles to select. If you cannot see this dropdown after authenticating, let us know as its most likely a simple plugin or theme conflict on CSS styling.</li>
<li>Fixed: The notices to deactivate/uninstall MI Lite/Pro when the other one were installed had an errant extra quotation mark, and they&#8217;re now more specific about the action to take.</li>
<li>Fixed: For some users, the setting for user role exclusion was not working. This has been corrected.</li>
<li>Fixed: A redirect issue that was looping for some users. The code that does this, while working for most, doesn&#8217;t for some. We&#8217;ve removed it until a full investigation can be completed.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.3, February 20, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Path for fontawesome font files was incorrect</li>
<li>Fixed: Notice in the install routine for the $version variable not being set.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.2, February 19, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Upgrade routine could drop manual UA codes in certain cases. If you upgraded to 6.0.0 or 6.0.1 and it lost the manual UA code, installing this update will automatically restore the UA code entered as long as you haven&#8217;t used the oAuth or re-entered the manual UA code.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.1, February 19, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: Typo that caused an issue with PHP 7 installs.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.0, February 18, 2017</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Completely overhauled design, from top to bottom. The plugin has been completely rewritten.</li>
<li>New: <strong>no more advertisements</strong> in the settings pages. We hated them too.</li>
<li>New: Javascript based event tracking</li>
<li>New: ga.js is now officially deprecated. New users cannot use it anymore, and existing users can only switch to analytics.js (but not back). Please note, all new features will be developed exclusively for analytics.js. Google has deprecated it, and now we&#8217;re deprecating our support for it.</li>
<li>New: License key system now uses the MonsterInsights License management system</li>
<li>New: Ability to pick which roles can access the dashboard/reports &amp; settings/addons/tools page using our UI. There&#8217;s also a new custom capability for this (a meta capability)</li>
<li>New: Support for Google Analytics Master accounts. When you oAuth into MonsterInsights now, the UA view is now locked to what you picked using the brand new oAuth procedure.</li>
<li>New: Revamped dashboard</li>
<li>New: Completely new settings system, with a completely new settings page, and a completely new settings API. Also some new hooks and tabs in preparation for the many addons we&#8217;ll be releasing over the next few months.</li>
<li>New: No more conflicts between the base plugins</li>
<li>New: Completely overhauled translation experience. The lite version translations are now fully managed through translations.wordpress.org.</li>
<li>New: Opt-in to anonymous data so we can better improve MonsterInsights</li>
<li>New: Significantly better addons page</li>
<li>New: Single license key to manage all MonsterInsights extensions.</li>
<li>New: Automatic detection of blocked asset files (from things like un-whitelisted uBlock Origin) with step by step directions on how to easily correct.</li>
<li>Tweak: Completely overhauled the ga.js and analytics.js outputs to fix outstanding bugs.</li>
<li>Tweak: Better debugging + disabled + preview tracking modes, that more clearly indicate what&#8217;s going on </li>
<li>Tweak: Completely overhauled PHP regex tracking to solve nearly a dozen outstanding bugs including issues where non-link elements starting with the letter &#8220;a&#8221; such as  tags would get parsed as links causing issues. Also solves issues related to single versus double quote usage for existing onclick handles, non-semicolon terminating onclick handles and various other parsing issues.</li>
<li>Tweak: Many previously untranslatable strings are now translatable.</li>
<li>Tweak: Minified in-plugin images.</li>
<li>Tweak: Minified admin css and js</li>
<li>Tweak: Uses latest version of Google PHP API now.</li>
<li>Tweak: The system for creating reports and getting Google Analytics reports have changed. If you&#8217;ve hardcoded into Yoast functions previously not designed for frontend output this could cause problems. We&#8217;ll introduce an API intended for this type of use after we update to use the v4 reporting API.</li>
<li>Fixed: Fixed an issue with HostEurope and other hosts modifying the default PHP arg seperator.</li>
<li>Fixed: Prevents an issue where users with a plugin like Airplane Mode active will get a better error message than &#8220;code invalid&#8221; on the GA token auth screen (and also fixes how that detection is done in other parts of the plugin). </li>
<li>Removed: unused track_full_url setting</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.5.3, October 3rd, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Announces MI 6.0 beta.</li>
<li>Fixed: Compatibility with PHP compatibility scanner&#8217;s bug</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.5.2, July 7, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak: Updates license manager to have more reliable update information including better compatibility with Yoast SEO products.</li>
<li>Fixed: Compatibility with upcoming Shiny Updates v2 in WP core</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.5.0, May 1, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Added new System Info tab for faster support.</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue with changelog missing some deployed versions.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.9, April 15, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Font based dashboard icon</li>
<li>Tweak: The &#8220;MonsterInsights&#8221; menu item name has been renamed to just &#8220;Insights&#8221;</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue with eCommerce addon (also requires user to update eCommerce addon)</li>
<li>Fixed: Issue with 2 dashboard links</li>
<li>Fixed: A bug in pre-existing code caused the menu of the plugin to skyrocket unintentionally. This has been corrected.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.4.8, April 14, 2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>New: Google Analytics by Yoast is now MonsterInsights.</li>
<li>Fixed: Compatibility issue with WordPress 4.5</li>
</ul>

console report (Pro feature)"></a><p>Search console report (Pro feature)</p></li></ol>";}s:17:"short_description";s:125:"The best Google Analytics plugin for WordPress. Gallery Plugin &#8211; NextGEN Gallery";s:4:"slug";s:15:"nextgen-gallery";s:7:"version";s:6:"3.0.16";s:6:"author";s:45:"<a href="https://www.imagely.com">Imagely</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:38:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/imagely";s:8:"requires";s:5:"4.0.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:84;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:1973;i:4;i:216;i:3;i:66;i:2;i:60;i:1;i:452;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:2767;s:15:"support_threads";i:145;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:71;s:10:"downloaded";i:23289798;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-10-24 2:43pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2007-04-23";s:8:"homepage";s:65:"https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/nextgen-gallery/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:6941:"<h4>WordPress Gallery Plugin</h4>
<p>NextGEN Gallery has been the industry&#8217;s standard <strong>WordPress gallery plugin</strong> since 2007 and continues to receive over 1.5 million new downloads per year. It&#8217;s easy for simple photo galleries, but powerful enough for the most demanding photographers, visual artists, and imaging professionals.</p>
<p>On the back end, NextGEN offers a complete WordPress gallery management system with the ability to batch upload photos, import meta data, add/delete/rearrange/sort photos, edit thumbnails, group galleries into albums, and more.</p>
<p>On the front end, the free version of NextGEN provides two main gallery styles (slideshows and thumbnail galleries) and two album styles (compact and extended), all of which come with a wide array of options for controlling size, style, timing, transitions, controls, lightbox effects, and more. Learn more about <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/" rel="nofollow">NextGEN WordPress Gallery Plugin features.</a></p>
<p><span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/mNEnY23i9DE?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span></p>
<p><strong>NEXTGEN GALLERY DEMOS</strong><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/basic-thumbnail-gallery/" rel="nofollow">Basic Thumbnail Gallery</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/basic-slideshow-gallery/" rel="nofollow">Basic Slideshow Gallery</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/basic-compact-album/" rel="nofollow">Basic Compact Album</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/basic-extended-album/" rel="nofollow">Basic List Album</a></p>
<p><strong>INTRODUCING NEXTGEN GALLERY PRO.</strong> NextGEN Plus and NextGEN Pro are premium WordPress gallery plugin extensions for NextGEN Gallery that add new photo gallery displays, lightboxes, ecommerce, proofing, and pro support. Learn more about <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/" rel="nofollow">NextGEN Plus and NextGEN Pro photo plugin features.</a></p>
<p><span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/zmA-b_jiXN0?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span></p>

*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-masonry-gallery/" rel="nofollow">Pro Masonry Gallery</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-filmstrip-gallery/" rel="nofollow">Pro Filmstrip Gallery</a><br />

*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-grid-album/" rel="nofollow">Pro Grid Albums</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-list-album/" rel="nofollow">Pro List Album</a><br />

*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-proofing-demo/" rel="nofollow">Pro Proofing Demo</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-ecommerce-demo/" rel="nofollow">Pro Ecommerce Demo</a></p>
<h4>About Imagely</h4>
<p>NextGEN Gallery is maintained by Imagely. We&#8217;re the WordPress photography experts. In addition to NextGEN Gallery, NextGEN Plus, and NextGEN Pro, we also make WordPress themes for photographers, provide turnkey websites for photographers, and run the WordPress Photography Podcast.</p>
<p>Learn more or connect with us:<br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/" rel="nofollow">Imagely Website</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-photography-themes/" rel="nofollow">Genesis WordPress Themes for Photographers</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/hosting/" rel="nofollow">Managed WordPress Hosting for Photographers</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/podcast/" rel="nofollow">The WordPress Photography Podcast</a><br />

<h3>Shortcode</h3>
<p>NextGEN Gallery offers an easy-to-use Insert Gallery Window, which means you never need to work with shortcodes again when inserting and manageing galleries &#8211; if you would prefer not too.</p>
<p>If you do want to work with shortcodes, there is a powerful shortcode system as you&#8217;d expect of a popular WordPress gallery plugin. <a href="https://www.imagely.com/docs/nextgen-gallery-shortcodes/" rel="nofollow">Learn About NextGEN Gallery Shortcodes</a>.</p>
<p>For more information, feel free to visit the official website for the NextGEN Gallery <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/" rel="nofollow">WordPress Gallery Plugin</a>.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:1432:"<p>INSTALLATION: The easiest way to start uploading your photos is to login to you WordPress dashboard, go to Plugins &gt; Add New, search for NextGEN Gallery, and click to install the plugin. You can also download the plugin zip file from this page and upload it from the Plugins &gt; Add New &gt; Upload page.</p>
<p>HOW TO USE: Just go to a page or post and click the NextGEN Gallery icon or the Add Gallery button. From our Insert Gallery Window, you can create, manage, customize, and display your WordPress photo galleries. You can also manage your photo galleries and gallery settings from the central options area under the &#8220;Gallery&#8221; tab on your dashboard menu.</p>
<p>DOCUMENTATION: See <a href="https://www.imagely.com/docs/nextgen-gallery/" rel="nofollow">NextGEN Gallery Documentation</a>.</p>
<p>That&#8217;s it &#8230; have fun! For more information, feel free to visit the official website for the NextGEN Gallery <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin" rel="nofollow">WordPress Gallery Plugin</a>.</p>
<p><span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/qwNr5ZNGavo?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span></p>
";s:3:"faq";s:3693:"
<h4>Why are my photo galleries not opening up in a lightbox after I move my site?</h4>
<p>
<p>This is often due to the URL paths to the CSS and JavaScript files used by the Lightbox Effects not being changed to relevant addresses based on the new site. This article will help sort out this issue if that is the case: <a href="https://www.imagely.com/docs/galleries-opening-lightbox/" rel="nofollow">Why are my galleries not opening up in a lightbox?</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Do you have documentation or tutorials?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes. See <a href="https://www.imagely.com/docs/nextgen-gallery/" rel="nofollow">NextGEN Gallery Documentation</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Will this gallery plugin work with my theme?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yup, NextGEN is a popular and well-established WordPress gallery plugin, and has been for a long time. It will work well with most other themes and plugins in the WordPress ecosystem.</p>
</p>
<h4>Are the photo galleries flash based?</h4>
<p>
<p>Nope, we use no flash elements.</p>
</p>
<h4>Are the galleries mobile friendly?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, we&#8217;ve put a lot of work into this and, NextGEN Galleries are compatible with Android, iOS. All photo galleries are also responsive, so galleries look good on diverse screen sizes. NextGEN Pro also includes a full screen, responsive Pro Lightbox with mobile gesture support. It&#8217;s great for viewing photos on mobile devices.</p>
</p>
<h4>What is the difference between a gallery and an album?</h4>
<p>
<p>In simple terms, Albums are collections of galleries. So Galleries contain your photos and Albums contain your Galleries. Albums act as links and placeholders to quickly and easily navigate your galleries. Galleries will actually display your images.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I upload multiple images at once?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, you can batch upload entire photo galleries at one time.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I password protect galleries?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, WordPress allows you to password protect pages by default &#8211; which includes all photo galleries and content for the entire page. Password protection of pages can be turned on and off at any time, with just a few clicks.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I add a watermark to the my photos?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, you can add text or image watermarks to your gallery images.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I crop photo thumbnails?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, each thumbnail image can be individually adjusted to suit your needs.</p>
</p>
<h4>Is there pagination for photo galleries?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, you can use pagination when displaying thumbnail galleries. And you can adjust the amount of photos to be shown on a page at any time.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I customize the lightbox?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, the lightbox can be configured with multiple options directly from the Dashboard, and there are multiple CSS styles which can be applied and modified as well. If you want even more options, consider upgrading to NextGEN Pro and useing the NextGEN Pro lightbox.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I add HTML to photo captions?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, caption areas are fully HMTL capable.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I add an external links to galleries?</h4>
<p>
<p>Since the captions are fully HTML capable, you can add external links and any other type of mark up you wish.</p>
</p>
<h4>Is NextGEN Gallery available in foreign languages?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, our WordPress gallery plugin has been translated into dozens of languages &#8211; <a href="https://www.imagely.com/languages/" rel="nofollow">click here to find out more.</a></p>
</p>
<h4>More Information</h4>
<p>
<p>For more information, feel free to visit the official website for the NextGEN Gallery <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin" rel="nofollow">WordPress Gallery Plugin</a>.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:79687:"<h4>V3.0.16 &#8211; 10.24.2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed    Fontawesome 4 compatibility</li>
</ul>
<h4>v3.0.15 &#8211; 10.23.2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Added requirements notification manager</li>
<li>Changed: Basic Thumbnails default setting from &#8220;[Show slideshow]&#8221; to &#8220;Show slideshow&#8221;</li>
<li>Changed: Fixed order_by=rand and &#8216;variations&#8217; system not working by storing random results in a transient for 24h</li>
<li>Changed: How gallery directories are removed</li>
<li>Changed: Improved memory use during thumbnail generation</li>
<li>Changed: Manage Albums page now uses GET for editing navigation</li>
<li>Changed: Upgrading FontAwesome to 5.0.13</li>
<li>Fixed:   Attribute &#8216;target=_blank&#8217; not working in lightbox effects</li>
<li>Fixed:   Conflict with WP Social Widget</li>
<li>Fixed:   Corrected numerous phpdoc problems found by Phan</li>
<li>Fixed:   Editing of image attributes from search-galleries page</li>
<li>Fixed:   Gritter messages with long texts overlapped their close-notification icon</li>
<li>Fixed:   IGW gallery selections not persisting between edits</li>
<li>Fixed:   Orphaned entries being created and/or left in wp_postmeta</li>
<li>Fixed:   Repeated and missing images in featured images list</li>
</ul>
<h4>V3.0.13 &#8211; 10.11.2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed: Added settings for basic slideshow</li>
</ul>
<h4>V3.0.9 &#8211; 09.25.2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Added 2.0 template mechanism for basic galleries</li>
<li>NEW:     Simple Lightbox is the new default Lightbox</li>
<li>Changed: Changed Javascript library and styling for basic slideshow</li>
<li>Changed: New default template and styling for thumbnail galleries</li>
<li>Changed: New default template and styling for imagebrowser galleries</li>
<li>Changed: New default template and styling for compact albums</li>
<li>Changed: New default template and styling for extended albums</li>
<li>Changed: Changed implementation of &#8220;Number of Columns&#8221; setting</li>
<li>Changed: Significantly simplified NextGEN default shortcodes</li>
</ul>
<h4>V3.0.8 &#8211; 09.05.2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed:   IGW broken with Chrome 69+</li>
</ul>
<h4>V3.0.6 &#8211; 07.24.2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Added &#8216;ngg_gallery_title_select_field&#8217; filter</li>
<li>NEW:     Danish translations</li>
<li>NEW:     Slovakian translations</li>
<li>Changed: Removed unused swfUpload setting key from ngg_options array</li>
<li>Secured: Image attribute storage</li>
<li>Fixed:   Styling of upload notifications</li>
<li>Fixed:   Do not purge WPML tag/translation mapping when removing unused NGG tags</li>
<li>Fixed:   Don&#8217;t invoke icl_translate() when the admin language matches the default language</li>
<li>Fixed:   Importing Media Library images inside the IGW window</li>
<li>Fixed:   NGG &gt; Overview&#8217;s &#8220;Upgrade to Pro&#8221; links were still present when NGG Plus/Pro were active</li>
<li>Fixed:   Patched PEL to catch a possible exception caused by malformed IFD</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed unneeded wp_localize_script(&#8216;wp-color-picker&#8217;&#8230;)</li>
<li>Fixed:   Sorting galleries with over 1k images did not work past image 999</li>
</ul>
<h4>V3.0.1 &#8211; 05.17.2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed:   Prevent caching of display_tab.js which can break the IGW</li>
</ul>
<h4>V3.0.0 &#8211; 05.16.2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Complete redesign of NextGEN Gallery backend interface</li>
<li>Changed: Image descriptions may now include  elements with src, alt, title, id, class, name, rel, and style</li>
<li>Changed: Upgraded Select2 to latest release (4.0.5)</li>
<li>Changed: Updated link href to &#8216;image delete&#8217; &amp; &#8216;recover&#8217; links</li>
<li>Fixed:   Gutenberg compatibility</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed use of screen_icon() from plugin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Color selection widget keeping unsaved values between page refreshes</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.2.54 &#8211; 02.28.2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed:   Conflict with Gutenberg editor</li>
<li>Fixed:   Manage Albums &#8220;Not linked&#8221; option wasn&#8217;t selectable</li>
<li>Fixed:   Manage Galleries gallery path field was having extraneous slashes added on IIS servers</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.2.50 &#8211; 02.20.2018</h4>
<ul>
<li>Secured: Gallery paths and the ability to manage tags</li>
<li>Kudos:   ElevenPaths (Telefonica cibersecurity Unit)</li>
</ul>

<li>Secured: Vulnerable to CVE-2017-2416 buffer overflows</li>
<li>Kudos:   Zhouyuan Yang of Fortinet&#8217;s FortiGuard Labs</li>
<li>Fixed:   Incorrect CSS class format used in form generator text field</li>
<li>Fixed:   Clean exit in FastCGI environments</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use of deprecated functions in gallery plugin</li>

<h4>V2.1.31 &#8211; 04.05.2016</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Added constant NGG_SCRIPT_VERSION that is either the plugin version or rand() should SCRIPT_DEBUG be on</li>
<li>NEW:     Added warning when saving galleries and refuse to automatically delete galleries with one or more &#8220;../&#8221; in their path.</li>
<li>Changed: ATP slug field disallow several characters (spaces, ?, |, &amp;, [, ]) by replacing them with dashes as they are typed</li>
<li>Changed: Made get_static_url() look in the WP_CONTENT/ngg/(module_name)/static directory for CSS/JS overrides</li>
<li>Fixed:   Bug introduced in 2.1.24 allowing gallery paths &amp; slugs to contain spaces; galleries must be &#8220;saved&#8221; once to correct them</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with WPML String Translation when uploading images without title or description</li>
<li>Fixed:   Made get_image_url() encode gallery directory names &#8216;because%this%is&#8217; a valid directory</li>
<li>Fixed:   Manage Galleries &gt; Search results not saving when edited</li>
<li>Fixed:   Provided imagebrowser legacy templates not using AJAX pagination when enabled</li>
<li>Fixed:   Resource manager breaking the layout of the Multisite Plugin Activation page</li>
<li>Fixed:   Static url generation when the nextgen-gallery directory is a symlink outside of the WordPress roots</li>
</ul>

<li>Fixed:    NGG&#8217;s cross-frame-communication cookies not being purged</li>

<h4>V2.1.2 &#8211; 07.20.2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Ability to import from Media Library</li>
<li>NEW:     Added filter &#8216;ngg_datamapper_table_name&#8217;</li>
<li>NEW:     Added filter <code>ngg_legacy_template_directories</code> for legacy template locator (thanks Ross McKay)</li>
<li>NEW:     Pagination available on Manage Images page</li>

<li>NEW:     Added filters &#8216;ngg_load_frontend_logic&#8217; and &#8216;ngg_get_modules_to_load&#8217;</li>
<li>NEW:     Added filter &#8216;ngg_add_page_shortcode&#8217; to control Manage Galleries &gt; &#8216;Create new page&#8217; content</li>
<li>NEW:     Added filter &#8216;ngg_manage_albums_items_order&#8217;</li>
<li>Changed: Removed PHP4 support from WordPress gallery plugin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ability to set NextGEN Image as Featured Image</li>
<li>Fixed:   Don&#8217;t use resource manager in download requests for WP Photo Shelter</li>
<li>Fixed:   Updated custom jQuery-UI styling to resemble WordPress postbox styling</li>
<li>Fixed:   Styled plupload buttons to resemble WordPress buttons</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed &#8216;fixed&#8217; class from manage galleries table. Allows columns to adjust to content</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed note about flash support and fixed typoe (thanks Rene Wolf)</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed typo in nggallery.po</li>
<li>Fixed:   Cache results of lookup_columns() to avoid multiple identical queries; thanks go to Alex Bradaric</li>
<li>Fixed:   Better WP-CPI detection</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed unnecessary calls to parent::initialize()</li>
<li>Fixed:   Adjusted album-compact template to always include p.ngg-album-gallery-image-counter</li>
<li>Fixed:   Replaced empty gallery rendering in is_feed() with a link</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed default settings for imagerotator, which is no longer supported</li>
<li>Fixed:   Optimized scanning of images when importing a photo gallery</li>
<li>Fixed:   When a photo gallery is deleted, ensure that DB and filesystem are purged</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed Insert Gallery Window box shadow</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that file_exists() calls are prefixed with @</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.1.0 &#8211; 05.18.2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Album breadcrumbs and pagination</li>
<li>NEW:     Ability to override builtin MVC templates</li>
<li>NEW:     Robust transient management</li>
<li>NEW:     Added the ability to set post thumbnails via XML-RPC module</li>
<li>NEW:     Added &#8216;ngg_get_image_size_params&#8217; filter to control image generation</li>
<li>NEW:     Added &#8216;ngg_basic_tagcloud_title&#8217; and &#8216;ngg_basic_tagcloud_excluded_display_types&#8217; filters</li>
<li>NEW:     Added ngg_manage_images_items_per_page filter</li>
<li>NEW:     Added &#8220;ngg_get_image_url&#8221; filter</li>
<li>NEW:     Including Ukranian and Polish translations</li>
<li>NEW:     The ability to set template in widgets</li>
<li>Changed: Default thumbnail dimensions set to 240&#215;160</li>
<li>Changed: Product now adheres to Pope 0.12 and provides get_modules_to_load()</li>
<li>Changed: Updated gallery plugin translations</li>
<li>Changed: Removed link to capsman plugin in Roles accordion</li>
<li>Changed: Taxnomies now use internationalized strings</li>
<li>Changed: Image date/time meta data fields are stored as UNIX timestamps</li>
<li>Secured: Uploading zips</li>
<li>Fixed:   Various PHP warnings and notices in WordPress gallery plugin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility fixes for WPML</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that backup image functionality fails gracefully</li>
<li>Fixed:   WP option &#8216;ngg_do_upgrade&#8217; updated in every HTTP request</li>
<li>Fixed;   Empty $_SERVER[&#8216;PATHINFO&#8217;] causing multiple routing issues</li>
<li>Fixed:   &#8220;Manage Galleries&#8221; display image alttext in the filename column</li>
<li>Fixed:   Various issues with the tag cloud display type</li>
<li>Fixed:   Integrity check when updating from 1.9.x</li>
<li>Fixed:   Image filenames substituting spaces for + which is only proper in the query string</li>
<li>Fixed:   Insert Gallery Window not working with nested levels of gzip compression</li>
<li>Fixed:   Imagebrowser as lightbox effect not working with pagination</li>
<li>Fixed:   Plugin compatibility with MultiVerso Advanced File Sharing</li>
<li>Fixed:   &#8220;Add page&#8221; button not displaying on the next immediate page load</li>
<li>Fixed:   Double-escaping of non-latin characters</li>
<li>Fixed:   Imagebrowser pagination with custom templates</li>
<li>Fixed:   Custom CSS is enqueued late to ensure it&#8217;s one of the last stylesheets loaded</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed watermarking PNG images and photos</li>
<li>Fixed:   Using the &#8220;Import Metadata&#8221; bulk action overwrites existing data</li>
<li>Fixed:   Seconds were not retained from CaptureTime EXIF field</li>
<li>Fixed:   Conflicts created by our TinyMCE plugin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Image mapper setting gid to gallery name, not the unique ID</li>
<li>Fixed:   Restored nggdb-&gt;get_random_images(), nggdb-&gt;search_for_file, and nggdb-&gt;find_all_albums()</li>
<li>Fixed:   Allow gallery slug as parameter to nggdb::get_gallery()</li>
<li>Fixed:   Don&#8217;t minify Plupload&#8217;s i18n JavaScript</li>
<li>Fixed:   Custom template images not being given their full effect code attributes</li>
<li>Fixed:   When importing galleries from folders, allow symlinks</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use of C_Gallery_Mapper in C_Image_Wrapper</li>
<li>Fixed:   Properly handle themes that don&#8217;t call wp_footer() or wp_print_footer_scripts()</li>
<li>Fixed:   Warning about missing style.php file on Network Admin -&gt; Gallery page</li>
<li>Fixed:   Warning about getimagesize() failure when backing up an image</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.0.71 &#8211; 02.19.2015</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Module files are compiled into a single package file to reduce disk I/O</li>
<li>NEW:     All CSS stylesheets and Javascript source files are minified to reduce latency</li>
<li>NEW:     All lightboxes are configured using an in-memory management class.</li>
<li>NEW:     Uses Pope 2.0, benefiting from the new caching capabilities</li>
<li>NEW:     NextGEN Gallery&#8217;s functionality is disabled if NextGEN Pro is incompatible</li>
<li>NEW:     Added ngg_effect_code filter</li>
<li>Changed: Updated WordPress gallery plugin&#8217;s FontAwesome to 4.3.0</li>
<li>Changed: Updated WordPress gallery plugin&#8217;s  select2 to 3.5.2</li>
<li>Changed: Removed PicLens / CoolIris integration from WordPress gallery plugin</li>
<li>Changed: Removed JSON API. Please use XML-RPC API instead</li>
<li>Changed: For performance reasons, we cache FS &amp; url lookups/calculations</li>
<li>Changed: Greatly reduced the # of sql queries, and eliminated anything redundant</li>
<li>Changed: For performance reasons, we cache datamapper and SQL queries</li>
<li>Changed: Don&#8217;t enqueue scripts or styles unless we require them</li>
<li>Changed: Reduce the number of resources we enqueue for every HTTP request</li>
<li>Changed: Ngg_Store now uses cookies instead of localStorage</li>
<li>Changed: Insert Gallery Window is routed using wp-admin/admin_init</li>
<li>Changed: Removed unused code from ngglegacy module. Created wrappers for commonly-used functions</li>
<li>Changed: LZW module removed</li>
<li>Changed: Legacy template drop-down selection now using select2</li>
<li>Secured: Restrict folder browsing to NGG_IMPORT_ROOT constant</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility issue with PHP&#8217;s transparent ZLIB compression</li>
<li>Fixed:   Imagebrowser as lightbox effect not working when non-default permalink slug used</li>
<li>Fixed:   Angled quotations marks used in shortcode parameters</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility between ImageBrowser display type and TwentyFifteen theme</li>
<li>Fixed:   Allow pagination to retain query string url parameters when linking to other pages</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed pagination issues with slideshow galleries displayed as thumbnails</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fix C_GalleryStorage_Driver_Base-&gt;import_gallery_from_fs() not checking imgBackup</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed problem with default settings being applied multiple times</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fallback to &#8220;full&#8221; image sizes if &#8220;backup&#8221; images aren&#8217;t available</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use M_DataMapper&#8217;s serialization methods throughout the codebase</li>
<li>Fixed:   Conflict with WordPress SEO and get_the_excerpt() call</li>
<li>Fixed:   Don&#8217;t run Resource Manager on wp-login.php or wp-sign.php</li>
<li>Fixed:   TinyMCE Image Editor conflict with Insert Gallery Window placeholder images</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fix Shutter positioning when admin bar is displayed</li>
<li>Fixed:   Allow deselection of a WordPress gallery plugin legacy template</li>
<li>Fixed:   Prevent conflicts when using imagebrowser as a lightbox effect</li>
<li>Fixed:   Pagination not working for slideshow galleries using thumbnail integration</li>
</ul>

<li>Changed: Basic Albums templates now given the image counter P element the class &#8216;ngg-album-gallery-image-counter&#8217; (by user request)</li>
<li>Changed: Gallery widgets now apply height:auto to their element; fixes compatibility with some themes</li>
<li>Changed: Random galleries should be substantially faster now (1000% or more for large image tables)</li>
<li>Fixed:   Complete WPML compatibility</li>
<li>Fixed:   Disable Buddypress &#8216;bp_do_redirect_canonical&#8217; filter as it ruins our routing system</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use plugins_url() content_url() when appropriate rather than just site_url() and home_url()</li>
<li>Fixed:   WP Cron job will remove not only displayed gallery transients, but rendering transients as well</li>
<li>Fixed:   NGG_RENDERING_CACHE_TTL constant is honored properly</li>
<li>Fixed:   If using the caption template for Basic Thumbnails, only show the image caption when appropriate</li>
<li>Fixed:   If NGG is uninstalled, so are it&#8217;s custom capabilities</li>
<li>Fixed:   Translate &#8220;Attach NextGEN Gallery to Post&#8221; ATP icon alt text when translations are active</li>
<li>Fixed:   Multisite gallery path tooltip gave a wrong default setting</li>
<li>Fixed:   Flush &#8216;all&#8217; caches when pope_module_list setting changes</li>
<li>Fixed:   Don&#8217;t enqueue related images css in the admin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Basic slideshow galleries fixes WP creating extraneous P element above the slideshow display</li>
<li>Fixed:   Basic Singlepic will now display images marked &#8216;excluded&#8217; in the admin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Admin pages can now update when the &#8220;Save&#8221; button text has been translated</li>
</ul>

<li>NEW:     Displayed Gallery Triggers moved from NextGEN Pro to NextGEN Gallery (not in use)</li>
<li>NEW:     Added NGG_Store, a client-side persistence layer (not in use)</li>
<li>NEW:     Added NGG_CRON_SCHEDULE constant. Set to the number of seconds between the execution of NextGEN Gallery cron jobs</li>
<li>NEW:     Added NGG_RENDERING_CACHE_TTL constant. TTL measured in seconds.</li>
<li>NEW:     Added NGG_DISPLAYED_GALLERY_CACHE_TTL constant. TTL measured in seconds.</li>
<li>NEW:     Added NGG_DISABLE_LEGACY_SHORTCODES constant. When TRUE, [slideshow] becomes [nggslideshow].</li>
<li>NEW:     Added Font Awesome, available for NextGEN Gallery extensions</li>
<li>Changed: Transients are removed every 30 minutes instead of 60 minutes</li>
<li>Changed: Admin Page &amp; Form components refactored to allow custom POST processing</li>
<li>Changed: Default path for NEW multisite installations to wp-content/uploads/sites/%BLOG_ID%/nggallery/</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ability to upload ZIP files on Windows hosts</li>
<li>Fixed:   Support for filenames with non-ASCII characters</li>
<li>Fixed:   Dynamic updates in the Insert Gallery interface (interframe communication)</li>
<li>Fixed:   WordPress gallery plugin insert interface freezing in IE11</li>

<li>Fixed:   Module installer integrity</li>
<li>Fixed:   Database query performance. No more joins to the WP options table</li>
<li>Fixed:   Lightboxes storing absolute paths for static resources</li>
<li>Fixed:   Displayed gallery cache not regularly flushed</li>
<li>Fixed:   SQL query performance problems. Honor max_packet_allowed variable for MySQL</li>
<li>Fixed:   Multiple database queries generated for determining next available image slug</li>
<li>Fixed:   Corrupted MediaRSS feeds</li>
<li>Fixed:   Padding on Gallery Settings and Other Options pages</li>
<li>Fixed:   Routing issues on subdirectory installs</li>
<li>Fixed:   Importing galleries using the Insert Gallery Interface</li>
<li>Fixed:   Gallery path calculations on Windows web servers</li>
<li>Fixed:   Sub-album urls not processed correctly</li>
<li>Fixed:   Apply maximum entity count to existing displayed galleries</li>
<li>Fixed:   NextGEN Gallery Thumbnail Widget shouldn&#8217;t use ImageBrowser effect</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ability to set shuffle parameter for ImageRotator slideshow galleries</li>

<li>Fixed:   Sanitization of gallery title</li>
<li>Fixed:   Home URL now used instead of Site URL in MediaRSS feed</li>
<li>Fixed:   Insert Gallery interface broken when WPML is installed</li>
<li>Fixed:   Insert Gallery interface instructing browser to cache the page</li>
<li>Fixed:   Watermarking not working in low-memory environments</li>
<li>Fixed:   Maximum images limit not being applied for galleries already created.</li>
<li>Fixed:   Double forward slashes in static urls</li>

<h4>V2.0.40 &#8211; 11.26.2013</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Added the ability to apply lightbox effects to non-NGG images</li>
<li>NEW:     Added NGG_HIDE_STRICT_ERRORS constant. Define and set to TRUE to hide strict errors</li>
<li>NEW:     Added NEXTGEN_GALLERY_IMPORT_ROOT constant. Define and set to TRUE to browse from a custom directory</li>
<li>NEW:     Added NGG_DEBUG constant. Define and set to TRUE to display helpful messages for debugging</li>
<li>NEW:     Each custom table record will have an associated custom post record for expansion</li>
<li>NEW:     Display helpful error messages when there&#8217;s a problem uploading images and photos</li>
<li>NEW:     Add data-(src|thumbnail|image-id|title|description) attribute to gallery image anchors</li>
<li>NEW:     Variant support for displayed gallery sources. Random images is limited to 5 variations</li>
<li>Fixed:   Excessive creation of transients for random galleries</li>
<li>Fixed:   Issues prohibiting the ability to upload images and photos</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with NextGEN Gallery Export Plugin for Adobe Lightroom (thanks Vladimir!)</li>
<li>Fixed:   Sorting in the Insert Gallery interface</li>
<li>Fixed:   HTML allowed in gallery/album descriptions</li>
<li>Fixed:   Requests for galleries within albums that have numeric names are broken</li>
<li>Fixed:   Call to a non-member function get() on WP_Query</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ability to sort by Image ID in the Insert Gallery interface</li>
<li>Fixed:   Isolate the Insert Gallery Window from implicit third-party script inclusion</li>
<li>Fixed:   Check for the existance of thumbnails when generating urls, and if missing, generate new ones</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with NextGEN Facebook OpenGraph+ plugin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Various XML-RPC issues in WordPress gallery plugin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Widgets stylesheet not included</li>
<li>Fixed:   Issue with color not being pre-selected when previewing Watermark</li>
<li>Fixed:   E_NOTICE emitted when cleaning up cached image files</li>
<li>Fixed:   E_NOTICE emitted when viewing display type settings</li>
<li>Fixed:   Typo adjusting pcre.backtrack_limit for shortcodes</li>
<li>Fixed:   Content within the tabs of the Insert Gallery interface cut-off</li>
<li>Fixed:   Routing problem which would cause conflicts with different display types on the same page</li>
<li>Fixed:   Broken Dynamic CSS links on GoDaddy</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ability to use HTML in gallery/album descriptions</li>
<li>Fixed:   Sub-album requests conflicting with paginated galleries on the same page</li>
<li>Merged:  Pull request from andreasE (https://bitbucket.org/photocrati/nextgen-gallery/pull-request/6/)</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.0.33 &#8211; 10.21.2013</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Requests /ngg_tag/[tagname] will create a displayed gallery</li>
<li>NEW:     Option added to &#8220;Import Gallery&#8221; tab to use original images</li>
<li>Fixed:   Links are broken on the ngg_tags-sitemap.xml file by WordPress SEO</li>
<li>Fixed:   PHP notice: Attempt to assign property of non-object</li>
<li>Fixed:   Undefined property warnings when using NextGEN Basic Thumbnails</li>
<li>Fixed:   Detect if an applying a transient to a displayed gallery was successful</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility issues with BJ-Lazy-Load and Colorbox</li>
<li>Fixed:   Pagination conflicts for multiple Imagebrowsers on the same page</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ability to display previous exception with debug mode</li>
<li>Fixed:   Tagclouds not working in multisite instances</li>
<li>Fixed:   Load widgets.css when a widget is being used</li>
<li>Fixed:   Installer should remove all instances of the component factory</li>
<li>Fixed:   WordPress gallery plugin widget settings interface not intuitive</li>
<li>Fixed:   Inability to upload images and photos in some Windows host environments</li>
<li>Fixed:   Sorting images/galleries using the Insert Gallery interface</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fix detection of HTTPS (pull request by Leonhardt Wille)</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compilation errors of regular expressions</li>
<li>Fixed:   Pro galleries wouldn&#8217;t display in environments using PHP 5.3.3 or less</li>
<li>Fixed:   Scanning of router slug is now limited to the uri, not the url</li>
<li>Fixed:   Show slideshow link isn&#8217;t required for thumbnail/imagebrowser integration</li>
<li>Fixed:   WordPress media-upload with &#8216;singlepic&#8217; image size</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use target=_blank when the link setting is provided for NextGEN Basic Singlepic</li>
<li>Fixed:   Only display rendering errors if WP_DEBUG is enabled</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.0.31 &#8211; 10.03.2013</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Restored AJAX pagination for NextGEN Basic ImageBrowser display type</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with WordPress Local SEO by Yoast</li>
<li>Fixed:   Inability to upload images if image_slug field was missing in database</li>
<li>Fixed:   Integration of NextGEN Basic Thumbnail and NextGEN Basic Slideshow display types</li>
<li>Fixed:   Photocrati Resource Manager further adjusted to be third-party friendly</li>
<li>Fixed:   Added the ability to find legacy templates in both the child/parent theme directories</li>
<li>Fixed:   JavaScript errors in Attach to Post interface</li>
<li>Fixed:   Router can handle port numbers in urls</li>
<li>Fixed:   Carousel template was linking to NextGEN Basic ImageBrowser view</li>
<li>Fixed:   SQL query generated for displayed galleries using tags as source</li>
<li>Fixed:   3rd party compat: raise &amp; never lower pcre.backtrack_limit</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.0.30 &#8211; 09.25.2013</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Restored the ability to use imagebrowser display type instead of a lightbox effect</li>
<li>Changed: Displayed galleries are no longer rendered in RSS feeds</li>
<li>Changed: Removed &#8220;Plugin Check&#8221; widget from WordPress gallery plugin overview page</li>
<li>Fixed:   Silence PHP warnings/errors in an output buffer for AJAX actions</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility issue with WordPress SEO and broken site maps (and large error_logs)</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility issue with AJAX Event Calendar (and possibly others)</li>
<li>Fixed:   Adjusted Photocrati Resource Manager to be third-party friendly</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed empty result set for displayed galleries selecting &#8216;All&#8217; tags</li>
<li>Fixed:   URL generation for imagebrowser pagination links</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that image meta is imported on creation</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that transients are removed when an external object cache is used</li>
<li>Fixed:   Don&#8217;t load pluggable.php. This will fix plugin conflicts</li>
<li>Fixed:   In Insert Gallery interface, galleries created in one tab weren&#8217;t showing in another</li>
<li>Fixed:   Don&#8217;t output frame events cookie for XML-RPC requests</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.0.23 &#8211; 09.12.2013</h4>

<li>NEW:     Added &#8220;excluded_container_ids&#8221; as parameter for ngg_images shortcode</li>
<li>Fixed:   Lightbox effect is honoured by all display types</li>
<li>Fixed:   Highslide displays images and photos from the correct displayed galleries</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that sub-albums display correctly when the word &#8220;album&#8221; is part of a slug</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that sub-albums display correctly when numerical slugs are used</li>
<li>Fixed:   Related images heading only added when Related Images functionality is enabled</li>
<li>Fixed:   PHP Warning about undefined index when viewing basic albums</li>
<li>Fixed:   AJAX handling is third-party compatible</li>
<li>Fixed:   Image date is no longer overwritten when an image is modified</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed issue with displayed galleries using source=&#8217;tags&#8217;</li>
<li>Fixed:   Problem with transient cache not getting flushed properly from Other Options page</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use correct gallery/transient ID when ajax pagination is used</li>
</ul>

<li>Changed: Removed dependence on simplehtmldom library</li>
<li>Fixed:   Related images functionality works as it did in 1.9.x</li>

<li>Fixed:   Click-to-advance slideshow behavior for slideshow galleries</li>
<li>Fixed:   Security warnings from VaultPress</li>
