<h4>V2.0.11 &#8211; 08.19.2013</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Added &#8220;run_ngg_resource_manager&#8221; hook to by-pass our resource manager</li>
<li>Changed: Removed &#8220;Reset &amp; Uninstall&#8221; tab, for now</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with W3 Total Cache. Please flush cache after updating.</li>
<li>Fixed:   Conflicts with Photocrati Theme Galleries</li>
<li>Fixed:   Blank Insert Gallery interface window</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed ability to change Lightbox Effect settings</li>
<li>Fixed:   Implemented techniques to ensure WP_Query variables aren&#8217;t overwritten</li>
<li>Fixed:   Enqueuing AJAX JS libraries twice in wp-admin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Encoding issues</li>
<li>Fixed:   PHP warnings caused by accessing unserialized data as array</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fixed WordPress gallery plugin installer issues</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.0.7 &#8211; 08.09.2013</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     New resource manager that fixes many plugin and theme incompatibilities</li>
<li>NEW:     Styles (custom stylesheets) should reside in wp-content/ngg_styles</li>
<li>NEW:     Added option to &#8220;Other Options -&gt; Misc&#8221; to control maximum images returned</li>
<li>Secured: Removed default connector for jQuery FileTree library</li>
<li>Changed: Updated the simplehtmldom library to version 1.5</li>
<li>Changed: jQuery is now enqueued at the beginning of every request</li>
<li>Fixed:   Incompatibilities with BuddyPress</li>
<li>Fixed:   Incompatibilities with Events+, bbPress, Custom Permalinks, and many other plugins</li>
<li>Fixed:   Incompcatibilities with Member Access, AMember, Magic Fields, and More Fields</li>
<li>Fixed:   Incompatibilities with Elegant Themes, Oxygen, Responsive, and many other themes</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that gallery images don&#8217;t have a border by default</li>
<li>Fixed:   Conflict between imagebrowser and album urls</li>
<li>Fixed:   Reverted default gallerypath to wp-content/gallery/</li>
<li>Fixed:   Upgrade-safe way of overriding Styles</li>
<li>Fixed:   Generation of AJAX url is now based on slug</li>
<li>Fixed:   Restore nggShowGallery and nggShowSlideshow as wrappers to new API</li>
<li>Fixed:   Always use domain as specified by WordPress Site URL</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use WordPress Home URL over Site URL when appropriate</li>
<li>Fixed:   Numerous WordPress gallery plugin pagination issues</li>
<li>Fixed:   Adjusted our forms to comply with WordPress Firewalls</li>
<li>Fixed:   Correct use of select2 DOM selector for maximum compatibility</li>
<li>Fixed:   Path and URL calculations for Windows and UNIX environments</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that pluggable.php is loaded at the start of every request</li>
<li>Fixed:   Fancybox: adjust CSS for further box-sizing protection from themes</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use PHP 5.2.1 compatible named pattern matching syntax</li>
<li>Fixed:   Remove usage of <strong>DIR</strong> constant not supported by PHP 5.2.x</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed dependency on mb_string PHP module</li>
<li>Fixed:   Allow &#8220;No Lightbox&#8221; as an option for Lightbox Effects</li>
<li>Fixed:   Warning: &#8220;Invalid CRT parameters detected&#8221; for Windows environments</li>
</ul>
<h4>V2.0 &#8211; 07.30.2013</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW:     Improved user experience throughout the plugin, settings and usage.</li>
<li>NEW:     Plupload queue uploader that allows for bulk and zip uploads within the same interface.</li>
<li>NEW:     Complete redesign of the NextGEN options panel</li>
<li>NEW:     Added new interface for adding galleries from pages and posts.</li>
<li>NEW:     Galleries are now mobile friendly and responsive, which is most noticeable with a responsive theme.</li>
<li>NEW:     Streamlined functionality for displaying galleries based on tags.</li>
<li>NEW:     Architecture based on Pope Framework (http://bitbucket.org/photocrati/pope-framework)</li>
<li>NEW:     New shortcode, “ngg_images”, and corresponding Insert Gallery interface</li>
<li>NEW:     Galleries have now global and instance settings</li>
<li>NEW:     Support for FastCGI environments</li>
<li>Changed: Replaces shortcodes with placeholder images, however still supports legacy shortcodes.</li>
<li>Changed: Introduced new Growl-like notifications for WordPress gallery plugin</li>
<li>Changed: The container and its images are centered for photo slideshow galleries</li>
<li>Changed: NextGEN styles now override vs replace default styles</li>
<li>Changed: NextGEN legacy templates have been deprecated (but still function)</li>
<li>FIXED:   The ability to use NextGEN image as a Featured Image.</li>
<li>FIXED:   Misc PHP warnings, errors, in gallery plugin</li>
</ul>

<li>Fixed:   Removed mention of upgrade.php, which no longer exists</li>

<h4>V1.6.0 &#8211; 07.09.2010</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW : WordPress 3.0 Network (Multi-Site) support</li>
<li>NEW : Integrate jQuery Cycle as NON-Flash slideshow</li>
<li>NEW : Adding jQuery File Tree for import folder (THX to Sergey Pasyuk )</li>
<li>NEW : Added action hook &#8216;ngg_show_imagebrowser_first&#8217; on custom request</li>
<li>NEW : Added filter hook &#8216;ngg_slideshow_size&#8217; to resize sildeshow for mobile browser plugins</li>
<li>Changed : Reorder tabs for upload</li>
<li>Changed : New menu icon and screen icon (THX to Ben Dunkle)</li>
<li>Changed : Load frontend libs always</li>
<li>Changed : Rework of WordPress gallery plugin overview page</li>
<li>Bugfix : Security bugfix for Zip-Upload (THX to Dominic Szablewski)</li>
<li>Bugfix : Allow JPG, PNG, GIF extension</li>
<li>Bugfix : New German translation (THX to Martin Kramarz)</li>
<li>Bugfix : Copy/Move also backup file</li>
<li>Bugfix : Calculate correct ratio for fix thumbnail size (THX to Alekz Keck)</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.5.5 &#8211; 14.06.2010</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix : Compat issue for post thumbnails with WP2.9</li>
<li>NEW : Adding more hooks for custom fields plugin</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.5.4 &#8211; 14.06.2010</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix : No resize of smaller images or photos</li>
<li>Bugfix : Compat issues for Post Thumbnails under WP3.0</li>
<li>Bugfix : Esc_URL in Media RSS</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.5.3 &#8211; 11.04.2010</h4>
<ul>
<li>New : Adding pagination to footer</li>
<li>Changed : Prepare new filter to replace slideshow galleries</li>
<li>Bugfix : Remove non-breaking space from navigation</li>
<li>Bugfix : Pagination of galleries</li>
<li>Bugfix : Fixed brackets position for old shortcode query</li>
<li>Bugfix : Slideshow option &#8216;Show next image on click&#8221; has wrong default value</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.5.2 &#8211; 25.03.2010</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix : XSS security vulnerability (THX to Core Security Advisories Team , Pedro Varangot)</li>
<li>Bugfix : Missing $wpdb in shortcodes.php</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.5.1 &#8211; 23.03.2010</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix : PHP4 compat issue for Add gallery &amp; options page</li>
<li>Bugfix : Gallery widget can now have a empty title</li>
<li>Bugfix : Adding correct stripslash for gallery title</li>
</ul>
<h4>V1.5.0 &#8211; 18.03.2010</h4>
<ul>
<li>NEW : Support for Post thumbnail feature</li>
<li>NEW : Backup and Recover function for images (THX to Simone Fumagalli)</li>
<li>NEW : Resize images after upload (THX to Simone Fumagalli)</li>
<li>NEW : Added a JSON class for fetching galleries in a RESTful way (see xml/json.php)</li>
<li>NEW : Adding various new capabilities for user roles</li>
<li>NEW : Auto downloader for translation file</li>
<li>Changed : Rename query var from slideshow to callback for compat reason with other plugin</li>
<li>Changed : Convert WordPress gallery plugin widget function to new WP structure</li>
<li>Changed : Include lookup for tags into the backend search</li>
<li>Changed : Restructure addgallery and settings page to enable custom tabs</li>
<li>Bugfix : Select album preview from gallery preview pics instead random list</li>
<li>Bugfix : Keep fix dimension in edit thumbnail operation</li>
<li>Bugfix : Import meta data didn&#8217;t work correct for existing images</li>
<li>Bugfix : Fix onload bug for Chrome 4 in Shutter script</li>
<li>Bugfix : Remove various PHP notices for a better world</li>
<li>Removed : Canonical link is now part of WordPress 2.9</li>
</ul>

:64:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.7.zip";s:6:"2.1.77";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.77.zip";s:6:"2.1.79";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.79.zip";s:5:"2.1.9";s:64:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.1.9.zip";s:5:"2.2.1";s:64:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.2.1.zip";s:6:"2.2.10";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.2.10.zip";s:6:"2.2.12";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.2.12.zip";s:6:"2.2.14";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.2.14.zip";s:6:"2.2.16";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.2.16.zip";s:6:"2.2.18";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.2.18.zip";s:5:"2.2.2";s:64:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.2.2.zip";s:5:"2.2.3";s:64:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.2.3.zip";s:6:"2.2.30";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.2.30.zip";s:6:"2.2.33";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.2.33.zip";s:6:"2.2.45";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.2.45.zip";s:6:"2.2.46";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.2.46.zip";s:6:"2.2.50";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.2.50.zip";s:6:"2.2.54";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.2.54.zip";s:5:"2.2.8";s:64:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.2.8.zip";s:5:"2.2.9";s:64:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.2.2.9.zip";s:5:"3.0.0";s:64:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.3.0.0.zip";s:5:"3.0.1";s:64:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.3.0.1.zip";s:6:"3.0.11";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.3.0.11.zip";s:6:"3.0.13";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.3.0.13.zip";s:6:"3.0.15";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.3.0.15.zip";s:6:"3.0.16";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.3.0.16.zip";s:5:"3.0.6";s:64:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.3.0.6.zip";s:5:"3.0.8";s:64:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.3.0.8.zip";s:5:"3.0.9";s:64:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.3.0.9.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:58:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/nextgen-gallery.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:0:"";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"1x";s:68:"https://ps.w.org/nextgen-gallery/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=1875408";s:2:"2x";s:68:"https://ps.w.org/nextgen-gallery/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1875408";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:9:"languages";s:3:"any";s:8:"category";a:6:{s:7:"gallery";s:11:"recommended";s:4:"blog";s:4:"more";s:8:"personal";s:11:"recommended";s:8:"business";s:4:"more";s:5:"eshop";s:4:"more";s:4:"club";s:11:"recommended";}}s:7:"shariff";a:28:{s:4:"name";s:15:"Shariff Wrapper";s:4:"slug";s:7:"shariff";s:7:"version";s:5:"4.5.2";s:6:"author";s:76:"<a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/shariff/">Jan-Peter Lambeck & 3UU</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:34:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/3uu";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.7";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.6";s:6:"rating";i:98;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:76;i:4;i:1;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:2;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:79;s:15:"support_threads";i:18;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:222562;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-05-29 7:59pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2014-12-01";s:8:"homepage";s:41:"https://wordpress.org/plugins-wp/shariff/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:1403:"<p>The &#8220;original&#8221; share buttons automatically transmit data of your visitors to the social network sites as soon as they visit your website. They do not need to click on a share button for this and therefore have no choice, if they want their data to be send. The German computer magazine c&#8217;t has developed &#8220;Shariff&#8221; <code>(ʃɛɹɪf)</code> that follows the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR &#8211; Regulation (EU) 2016/679). This plugin adapts the Shariff concept and provides an easy to use solution for WordPress. We currently support 32 services in 25 languages: AddThis, Bitcoin, Diaspora, Facebook, Flattr, Flipboard, GooglePlus, LinkedIn, mailto, Mastodon, Odnoklassniki, Patreon, PayPal, PayPal.me, Pinterest, Pocket, Printer, Qzone, Reddit, RSS, SMS, Stumbleupon, Telegram, TencentWeibo, Threema, Tumblr, Twitter, VK, Wallabag, Weibo, WhatsApp, Xing.</p>
<p>For more information about the Shariff project check out the original <a href="https://github.com/heiseonline/shariff" rel="nofollow">GitHub project</a> and read about the project itself <a href="http://ct.de/shariff" rel="nofollow">c’t information page</a> (in German).</p>
<p>You can automatically add share buttons to posts, pages, the main blog page, product sites and many more as well as use it as a widget or add the shortcode <code>[shariff]</code> manually to your pages or themes.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:333:"<ol>
<li>Upload everything to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin using the plugins menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Use <code>[shariff]</code> anywhere on your site and/or use the Shariff settings menu.</li>
</ol>
<p>To enable it for all posts please check the options in the plugin settings.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:11543:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ol>
<li>Upload everything to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin using the plugins menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Use <code>[shariff]</code> anywhere on your site and/or use the Shariff settings menu.</li>
</ol>
<p>To enable it for all posts please check the options in the plugin settings.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I use the Shariff buttons in my theme?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes. Simply use the shortcode function <code>do_shortcode('[shariff]')</code>.<br />
You can use all options of the shorttag as described on the help tab in the plugin settings.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I use the total amount of shares in my theme?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes. You can use <code>do_shortcode('[shariff services="totalnumber"]')</code> to simply output the total amount of shares for a post in the loop. It will return the number itself wrapped in a <code>&lt;span class="shariff-totalnumber"&gt;&lt;/span&gt;</code> in order for the shariff.js to update the count. Also only cached data is used, in order to not slow down your site.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Is there an action hook to use the share counts every time they get updated?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes. You can use<br />
    function your_awesome_function( $share_counts ) {<br />
       // $share_counts is an array including all enabled services, the timestamp of the update and the url of the post.<br />
       // do stuff<br />
    }<br />
    add_action( &#8216;shariff_share_counts&#8217;, &#8216;your_awesome_function&#8217; );<br />
WARNING: This hook will get called A LOT. So be sure you know what you are doing.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I configure the widget?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: It uses the same options that have been configured on the plugin options page. However, you can put in a shorttag that overwrites the default options. It has the same format as you use in posts. Take a look at the help section of the plugin options page for more information.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I change the options on a single post?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes. You can change all options using the shorttag in the Shariff meta box on the right side of the post edit screen.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Why are shares not listed?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Shariff tries to protect the privacy of your visitors. In order to do this, the statistics have to be requested by your server, so social networks only see a request of your server and not from your visitor. However, we do not know, if you want this. Therefore it is not enabled by default.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I show the share counts?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Enable it on the plugin options page in general or add <code>backend="on"</code> to the shariff shorttag in your post.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: I still do not see share counts</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Please have a look at the status tab on the plugin options page. It states whether share counts are enabled and if there is a problem with a service. Please also keep in mind that the plugin has a minimum refresh time of 60 seconds and that each service has their own cache as well.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Why can&#8217;t I change the TTL to a smaller / bigger value?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: The time to live (TTL) value determines, if a share count of a post or page gets refreshed when someone visits this specific page / post of your blog. Too small values create too much useless traffic, too high values negate the goal of motivating visitors to also share a post. The value can be adjusted between 60 and 7200 seconds. Keep in mind, the actual lifespan depends on the age of the post as well.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: I get the Facebook API error message &#8220;request limit reached&#8221;!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Facebook has a rate limit of 600 requests per 600 seconds per IP address. Especially in shared hosting environments many domains share the same IP address and therefore the same limit. To avoid this you can try to raise the TTL value or provide a Facebook App ID and Secret. Google &#8220;facebook app id secret&#8221; will provide many guides on how to get these.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I change the position of all buttons?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Have a look at the alignment options in the admin menu or checkout the<br />
style option.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I change the design?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Have a look at the parameters &#8220;theme&#8221;, &#8220;orientation&#8221; and &#8220;buttonsize&#8221;. They work mostly like the original code parameters that are explained at http://heiseonline.github.io/shariff/ Or you can have a look at the test page at http://shariff.3uu.net/shariff-sample-page-with-all-options to get an<br />
overview. But please be warned: This is a test page! It is possible that you find features that are only provided in the development version. Use it only to get an impression of the design options.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I change the design of a single button?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: If you are a CSS guru please feel free to modify the css file. But of course this is a bad idea, because all changes will be destroyed with the next update! Instead take a look at the style and class attribute of the shorttag. If you put in any value it will create a DIV container with the ID &#8220;ShariffSC&#8221; around the buttons. If you are really a CSS guru you will know what does the magic from here on out. 😉</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: I want the buttons to stay fixed while scrolling!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: No problem. Just use the style attribute to add some CSS to the shorttag. For example in a widget (adjust the width as needed):<br />
    [shariff style=&#8221;position:fixed;width:250px&#8221;]<br />
Of course you can use all other options in that shorttag as well. It also works with the CSS style option on the plugins design options page, if you really want this applied to all buttons on your page.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: I want a horizontal line above my Shariff buttons!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: You can use the headline option on the design tab. For example, enter the following code to create a horizontal line and a headline:</p>
<p>Please share this post:</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: I want a different or no headline in a single widget, post or page!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Use the headline attribute to add or remove it. For example, you can use the following shorttag to remove a headline set on the plugins options page in a single widget:<br />
    [shariff headline=&#8221;&#8221;]<br />
Of course you can use all other options in that shorttag as well.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I add [shariff] on all posts?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes, check out the plugin options.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: But I want to hide it on a single post!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Do you really know what you want? 😉 However, it is possible. Write anywhere in your post &#8220;hideshariff&#8221;. It will be removed and Shariff will not be added. You can also use &#8220;/hideshariff&#8221; to write &#8220;hideshariff&#8221; in your post. You might also want to take a look at the Shariff meta box on the right side of your post edit screen.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: What are the differences between the two Shariff plugins?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: One is developed by us, one by someone else. 😉 The main difference is that this plugin has a few more options and a great support. 🙂 Neither of the plugins are &#8220;official&#8221; or directly developed by Heise.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Does it work with a CDN?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Yes.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Pinterest does not show an image!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: You can add media=&#8221;http://wwww.example.com/yourImage.png&#8221;<br />
within the [shariff] shorttag or add it in on the plugin options page &#8211; of course with the link to your image.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: Can I set a fixed URL to share?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: You can use the &#8220;url&#8221; parameter within the shortcode<br />
    [shariff url=&#8221;http://www.example.com/&#8221;]<br />
This is also available within widgets. However, it is not a good idea to manipulate the URI, because it could mislead your visitors. So you should only use it, if this is really needed and you do really know what you are doing. Therefore it is not available on the plugin options page in general.</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: What happened to the Twitter share counts and what is OpenShareCount?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Please read: https://www.jplambeck.de/twitter-saveoursharecounts/</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: The buttons are not correctly being shown on my custom theme!</h4>
<p>
<p>A: Please make sure that wp_footer(); has been added to your theme. For more information please visit: https://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/wp_footer</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: What is the external API feature?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: First of all: Usually you do not need it! The plugin requests all share counts itself. However, there are some reasons to put the backend on another server:<br />
&#8211; avoid requests from you WP server to all the social networks<br />
&#8211; use a more powerful server for the statistic<br />
&#8211; use the original backend implementation of Heise or your own solution<br />
&#8211; make your own backend available for more than one WP installation<br />
But please have in mind that there are also some good reasons not to use external servers:<br />
&#8211; you need an additional installation of WP and the plugin or have to create your own implementation of a Shariff backend<br />
&#8211; some plugin settings (backend checks, statistic, etc.) will only work on the external server<br />
&#8211; you have to use SHARIFF_FRONTENDS as an array with all your frontend domains to enable the backend or find your own solution<br />
&#8211; we CANNOT provide support for your own implementation</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: How can I configure the external API?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: In the statistic settings fill in the URL to the API of the external server. For the WordPress installation on the external server you have to create a &#8220;constant&#8221; called SHARIFF_FRONTENDS to permit other domains to use it. Please have in mind that you have to fill in all subdomains you want to use! The domains must be defined like this:<br />
    define( &#8216;SHARIFF_FRONTENDS&#8217;, &#8216;example.com|www.example.com|blog.example.com|another-domain.com&#8217; );</p>
</p>
<h4>Q: What does &#8220;Request external API directly.&#8221; mean?</h4>
<p>
<p>A: By default, the browser request the share counts from the server your site is running on. If you have entered an external API your server will then request the counts from this external API instead of fetching them itself. Therefore, the external server will only see the IP from your server and not the one from your visitors. If you check this option, the browser of your visitors will instead directly request the share counts from the external API and therefore reveal their IP address to them. This might be faster, but it is less secure. Please also make sure to set the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header right. If your site is available using https, your external API will need to be reached by https as well. Otherwise the request will get blocked for security reasons. All options and features (e.g. the ranking tab) regarding the statistic will only work on the external server.</p>
</p>
<h4>KNOWN BUGS</h4>
<p>
<p>These are bugs or unexpected glitches that we know of, but that do not have an impact on the majority of users, are not security relevant and will perhaps be fixed in the future &#8211; if we have time to spend or you provide us with a lot of &#8220;K&#xF6;lsch&#8221; 😉</p>
<ul>
<li>If the first post on the start page is password protected and Shariff is disabled on protected posts, a widget at the end of the loop will not be rendered.</li>
</ul>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:4744:"<h4>4.5.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>added support for share count requests of multilingual sites</li>
<li>updated button translations for Twitter and Pinterest (thanks to Jessica, @jess78)</li>
<li>updated to Facebook Graph API v3.0</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.5.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>added support for the new WordPress Privacy Policy Guide added in 4.9.6</li>
<li>minor css adjustments</li>
<li>minor bug fixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.5.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>new option to add Shariff to custom WordPress hooks</li>
<li>new option to support multilingual sites using WPML and other plugins</li>
<li>new support for WooCommerce products on the ranking table</li>
<li>new option to show different headlines based on share counts</li>
<li>updated button languages, now supporting 25 languages</li>
<li>fixed a bug causing share counts to not being displayed properly</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.4.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>added support for automatic addition to bbpress forums, topics and replies</li>
<li>fixed a bug that caused &#8220;hideshariff&#8221; to not function properly</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.4.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>new support for additional manual AMP integrations</li>
<li>fixed a PHP error on certain server configurations</li>
<li>new support for the print button on AMP pages</li>
<li>fixed a markup typo</li>
<li>minor css improvements</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.4.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>new support for the &#8220;AMP for WP&#8221; plugin by Ahmed and Mohammed Kaludi</li>
<li>improved support for the &#8220;AMP for WordPress&#8221; plugin by Automattic</li>
<li>new additional workaround for servers without $_SERVER for category pages</li>
<li>minor bug fixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.4.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>new service wallabag (thanks to Torsten, @knodderdachs)</li>
<li>minor bug fixes</li>
<li>updated help section</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.4.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>new service Telegram (thanks to Daniel Sturm, @dcsturm)</li>
<li>new service Flipboard (thanks to csigncsign, @csigncsign)</li>
<li>new service Mastodon (thanks to scroom, @scroom)</li>
<li>new service Qzone</li>
<li>new service Weibo</li>
<li>new service TencentWeibo</li>
<li>new service SMS (will work on iOS, might not work on other phones)</li>
<li>new support of the &#8220;AMP for WordPress&#8221; plugin by Automattic</li>
<li>new option to set a custom text for the info button</li>
<li>new option to disable the metabox</li>
<li>new option to add shariff to CPTs before the content</li>
<li>new ranking table now also shows pages</li>
<li>new fix to prevent Shariff buttons from being displayed on admin pages</li>
<li>new fix to support WP-CLI (thanks to Daniel Jagszent, @d&#8211;j)</li>
<li>fixed HTML errors regarding self closing tags (thanks to Tooni, @tooni)</li>
<li>fixed a missing closing tag under certain conditions (thanks to Pat, @fortythousandmiles)</li>
<li>removed GooglePlus share counts due to Google removing the API</li>
<li>added Czech translation of the buttons</li>
<li>updated a lot of button translations</li>
<li>updated to Facebook Graph API 2.12</li>
<li>updated a lot of strings to allow for easier translation</li>
<li>updated the reddit icon</li>
<li>updated help section</li>
<li>improved documentation of the REST API endpoint for share counts (thanks to David)</li>
<li>major improvements in regards to code quality</li>
<li>minor css improvements</li>
<li>minor security improvements</li>
<li>removed the mail form for the time being due to technical and legal due diligence</li>
<li>if you need the mail form functionality, please stick to version 4.3</li>
<li>https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shariff.4.3.0.zip</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.3.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>new service Odnoklassniki (thanks to rockhit)</li>
<li>new meta box allows for individual settings per post or page</li>
<li>new option to hide share counts that are zero</li>
<li>new option to disable dynamic cache lifespan (not recommended)</li>
<li>new option to set the button size to small, medium or large</li>
<li>new option to add a custom class to the container around Shariff</li>
<li>new option to open links in a popup (thanks to jackennils)</li>
<li>new option to use NewShareCount instead of OpenShareCount (Twitter)</li>
<li>added timestamp variable to be accessible via shortcode</li>
<li>fixed post timestamp for caching under certain conditions</li>
<li>fixed Facebook share count error for never crawled pages</li>
<li>fixed empty tab after sharing on certain mobile devices</li>
<li>fixed custom title attribute (thanks to kschlager)</li>
<li>updated Flattr user id for the future (thanks to poetaster)</li>
<li>reduced changelog on wordpress.org (thanks to timse201)</li>
<li>minor css improvements</li>
<li>updated help section</li>
</ul>
<p>The complete changelog can be found here: https://plugins.svn.wordpress.org/shariff/trunk/changelog.txt</p>

clear message that the site uses cookies.<br />
This plugin supports multi-language installations with the polylang-plugin from Chouby or WPML-plugin from wpml.org. It has a wide array of settings for controlling the style and contents.<br />
WF Cookie Consent is the &#8220;wunderfarm-way&#8221; to show how your website complies with the EU Cookie Law.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:279:"<ol>
<li>Upload <code>WF Cookie Consent</code> to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>If you want to set custom settings, go to Settings menu &gt; WF Cookie Consent.</li>
</ol>

SEO";s:4:"slug";s:13:"wordpress-seo";s:7:"version";s:3:"9.1";s:6:"author";s:43:"<a href="https://yoa.st/1uk">Team Yoast</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:42:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/joostdevalk";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.8";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";s:5:"5.2.4";s:6:"rating";i:98;s:7:"ratings";a:6:{i:5;i:22283;i:4;i:538;i:3;i:129;i:2;i:100;i:1;i:477;i:0;i:1;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:23528;s:15:"support_threads";i:469;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:394;s:10:"downloaded";i:138652116;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-11-06 9:26am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2010-10-11";s:8:"homepage";s:18:"https://yoa.st/1uj";s:8:"sections";a:4:{s:11:"description";s:5787:"<h3>Yoast SEO: the #1 WordPress SEO plugin</h3>
<p>Need some help with your search engine optimization? Need an SEO plugin that helps you reach for the stars? Yoast SEO is the original WordPress SEO plugin since 2008. It is the favorite tool of millions of users, ranging from the bakery around the corner to some of the most popular sites on the planet. With Yoast SEO, you get a solid toolset that helps you aim for that number one spot in the search results. Yoast: SEO for everyone.</p>
<p>Yoast SEO does everything in its power to please both visitors and search engine spiders. How? Below you’ll find a small sampling of the powers of Yoast SEO:</p>
<h4>Taking care of your WordPress SEO</h4>
<ul>
<li>The most advanced XML Sitemaps functionality at the push of a button.</li>
<li>Full control over site breadcrumbs: add a piece of code and you’re good to go.</li>
<li>Set canonical URLs to avoid duplicate content. Never have to worry about Google penalties again.</li>
<li>Title and meta description templating for better branding and consistent snippets in the search results.</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> Expand Yoast SEO with the News SEO, Video SEO, Local SEO and WooCommerce SEO extensions.</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> Need help? Yoast SEO Premium users get 1 year free access to our awesome support team.</li>
</ul>
<blockquote>
<p>Note: some features are Premium. Which means you need Yoast SEO Premium to unlock those features. You can <a href="https://yoa.st/1v8" rel="nofollow">get Yoast SEO Premium here</a>!</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>Write killer content with Yoast SEO</h4>
<ul>
<li>Content &amp; SEO analysis: Invaluable tools to write SEO-friendly texts.</li>
<li>The snippet preview shows you how your post or page will look in the search results &#8211; even on mobile. Yoast SEO Premium even has social media previews!</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> The Insights tool shows you what your text focuses on so you can keep your article in line with your keyphrases.</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> Synonyms &amp; related keyphrases: Optimize your article for synonyms and related keyphrases.</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> Automatic internal linking suggestions: write your article and get automatic suggested posts to link to.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Keep your site in perfect shape</h4>
<ul>
<li>Yoast SEO tunes the engine of your site so you can work on creating great content.</li>
<li>Our cornerstone content and internal linking features help you optimize your site structure in a breeze.</li>
<li>Integrates with Google Search Console: See how your site performs in the search engines and fix crawl errors.</li>
<li>Manage SEO roles: Give your colleagues access to specific sections of the Yoast SEO plugin.</li>
<li>Bulk editor: Make large-scale edits to your site.</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> Social previews to manage the way your page is shared on social networks like Facebook and Twitter.</li>
<li><strong>[Premium]</strong> Redirect manager: It keeps your site healthy by easily redirecting errors from Google Search Console, deleted pages and changed URLs.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Premium support</h3>
<p>The Yoast team does not always provide active support for the Yoast SEO plugin on the WordPress.org forums, as we prioritize our email support. One-on-one email support is available to people who <a href="https://yoa.st/1v8" rel="nofollow">bought Yoast SEO Premium</a> only.</p>
<p>Note that the <a href="https://yoa.st/1v8" rel="nofollow">Yoast SEO Premium</a> also has several extra features too, including the option to have synonyms and related keyphrases, internal linking suggestions, cornerstone content checks and a redirect manager, so it is well worth your investment!</p>
<p>You should also check out the <a href="https://yoa.st/1uu" rel="nofollow">Yoast Local SEO</a>, <a href="https://yoa.st/1uv" rel="nofollow">Yoast News SEO</a> and <a href="https://yoa.st/1uw" rel="nofollow">Yoast Video SEO</a> extensions to Yoast SEO. They work with the free version of Yoast SEO already, and these premium extensions of course come with support too.</p>
<h3>Bug reports</h3>
<p>Bug reports for Yoast SEO are <a href="https://github.com/Yoast/wordpress-seo" rel="nofollow">welcomed on GitHub</a>. Please note GitHub is not a support forum, and issues that aren’t properly qualified as bugs will be closed.</p>
<h3>Further Reading</h3>
<p>For more info on search engine optimization, check out the following:</p>
<ul>
<li>The <a href="https://yoa.st/1v8" rel="nofollow">Yoast SEO Plugin</a> official homepage.</li>
<li>The <a href="https://yoa.st/1va" rel="nofollow">Yoast SEO Knowledgebase</a>.</li>
<li><a href="https://yoa.st/1v6" rel="nofollow">WordPress SEO &#8211; The definitive Guide by Yoast</a>.</li>
<li>Other <a href="https://yoa.st/1v9" rel="nofollow">WordPress Plugins</a> by the same team.</li>
<li>Follow Yoast on <a href="https://facebook.com/yoast" rel="nofollow">Facebook</a> &amp; <a href="https://twitter.com/yoast" rel="nofollow">Twitter</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h3>From within WordPress</h3>
<ol>
<li>Visit &#8216;Plugins &gt; Add New&#8217;</li>
<li>Search for &#8216;Yoast SEO&#8217;</li>
<li>Activate Yoast SEO from your Plugins page.</li>
<li>Go to &#8220;after activation&#8221; below.</li>
</ol>
<h3>Manually</h3>
<ol>
<li>Upload the <code>wordpress-seo</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the Yoast SEO plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Go to &#8220;after activation&#8221; below.</li>
</ol>
<h3>After activation</h3>
<ol>
<li>You should see (a notice to start) the Yoast SEO configuration wizard.</li>
<li>Go through the configuration wizard and set up the plugin for your site.</li>
<li>You&#8217;re done!</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:124:"<p>You&#8217;ll find answers to many of your questions on <a href="https://yoa.st/1va" rel="nofollow">kb.yoast.com</a>.</p>
";s:9:"changelog";s:8437:"<h4>9.1.0</h4>
<p>Release Date: November 6th, 2018</p>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Improves keyphrase recognition in the first paragraph on texts which start with images and captions.</li>
<li>Adds a warning notification to the permalink settings page, linking to a knowledge base article. Props to <a href="https://github.com/valtlfelipe" rel="nofollow">valtlfelipe</a></li>
<li>Adds the filter <code>wpseo_opengraph_is_valid_image_url</code> that allows custom image URL validation. Props to <a href="https://github.com/petenelson" rel="nofollow">petenelson</a></li>
<li>Updates the font size of the snippet title measure element to correctly mimic Google desktop snippet title. Props to <a href="https://github.com/ol0lll" rel="nofollow">ol0lll</a></li>
</ul>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixes a bug where the featured image was not recognized in the SEO analysis when using Gutenberg.</li>
<li>Fixes an accessibility issue where focus would be lost when removing an uploaded image in the configuration wizard.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where notices were being thrown when quick editing a post and no post type object could be found.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where a dependency wasn&#8217;t loaded for the SEO -&gt; Tools page.</li>
<li>Fixes a faulty reference to the old SEOAssessor class.</li>
<li>Fixes the copy of the date archives help text which contains faulty information. Props to <a href="https://github.com/mkronenfeld" rel="nofollow">mkronenfeld</a></li>
<li>Fixes the spelling of the words &#8220;plug-in&#8221; and &#8220;set-up&#8221;. Props to <a href="https://github.com/pedro-mendonca" rel="nofollow">pedro-mendonca</a></li>
<li>Fixes a bug where a type error is thrown when the posts or terms focus keyword isn&#8217;t of the type WP_Post as this can collide with third-party plugins.</li>
</ul>
<p>Other:</p>
<ul>
<li>Changes the reference in the admin bar menu from &#8220;AdWords External&#8221; to &#8220;Google Ads&#8221;.</li>
<li>Removes non-functioning eye-markers for the link keyphrase assessment.</li>
</ul>
<h4>9.0.3</h4>
<p>Release Date: October 30th, 2018</p>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixes a bug where the metabox was broken when using the classic editor plugin.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where the Chrome browser tab would crash on Windows when a French or Italian text contains sentences in passive voice, props <a href="https://github.com/CarloCannas" rel="nofollow">CarloCannas</a>.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where the Yoast SEO analysis would error if used together with the DelightfulDownloads plugin.</li>
</ul>
<h4>9.0.2</h4>
<p>Release Date: October 24th, 2018</p>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixes a bug where it was impossible to change the profile in the Search Console integration step in the configuration wizard.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where the primary taxonomy picker was not shown in Gutenberg (v4.1).</li>
</ul>
<h4>9.0.1</h4>
<p>Release Date: October 23rd, 2018</p>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixes error with using <code>$</code> in wp-seo-admin-media.js. Now we use <code>jQuery</code> instead.</li>
</ul>
<h4>9.0.0</h4>
<p>Release Date: October 23rd, 2018</p>
<p>Bugfixes:</p>
<ul>
<li>Fixes a bug where the keyword would not be found in the slug when containing punctuation, for example the keyphrase <code>apples &amp; pears</code> in the slug <code>apples-pears</code>.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where the buttons to change the How-to steps and FAQ questions order would be only partially visible in mobile view.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where an &#8216;undefined index&#8217; notice would be given when an OpenGraph image URL didn&#8217;t have a correct path. Props to <a href="https://github.com/Julian-B90" rel="nofollow">@Julian-B90</a></li>
<li>Fixes a bug where the home description can contain HTML, resulting in unexpected characters on the Facebook social settings page.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where author sitemap caches would be attempted to be invalidated despite not all conditions being met.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where a fatal error on Yoast settings pages was thrown because they did not have a dedicated option class.</li>
</ul>
<p>Enhancements:</p>
<ul>
<li>Introduces two new principles for keyword recognition:
<ul>
<li>Makes keyphrase recognition flexible with regards to word order. This means that the keyphrase <code>SEO WordPress plugin</code> will be found in the sentence <code>This is the most popular SEO plugin for WordPress.</code> In order to use exact matches, the keyphrase can be enclosed in quotation marks.</li>
<li>When matching keyphrases for the various assessments, the analysis only targets content words and ignores function words (e.g., <code>the</code> or <code>and</code>). This functionality is available in English, German, Dutch, French, Spanish, Italian, Portuguese, Russian and Polish.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>The analysis of the following assessments incorporates the new keyword recognition principles:
<ul>
<li>Image alt attributes: checks whether there’s at least one image with an alt tag that contains words from the keyphrase. An exact match isn’t required anymore.</li>
<li>Keyphrase in introduction: checks whether words from the keyphrase are matched within one sentence in the introduction or, if not, whether they are present in the first paragraph at all. An exact match isn’t required anymore.</li>
<li>Keyphrase in title: still checks whether an exact match of the keyphrase is found in (the beginning of) the title, but now also recommends improvement if all words from the keyphrase are found in the title.</li>
<li>Keyphrase length: has new boundaries to check whether the keyphrase is not too long. For languages that have support for function word stripping (see above), only content words are taken into account.</li>
<li>Keyphrase in meta description: checks how often all words from the keyphrase are matched within the meta description.</li>
<li>Keyphrase in subheading: now checks whether at least one subheading contains more than half of the words from the keyphrase. An exact match isn’t required anymore.</li>
<li>Keyphrase in slug: checks whether a sufficient number of words from the keyphrase is used in the slug. The number of words required depends on the length of the keyphrase.</li>
<li>Keyphrase density: checks whether there are enough keyphrase matches; a match is defined as a sentence that contains all words from the keyphrase.</li>
<li>Link focus keyphrase: the assessment that checks whether you’re using your keyphrase to link to a different article doesn&#8217;t require an exact match anymore.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Improves the feedback texts for all SEO and readability assessments.</li>
<li>Improves the consistency of the SEO and readability results by showing them in a fixed order.</li>
<li>Adds target=&#8221;_blank&#8221; to the &#8220;How to connect to GSC&#8221; link to open the link a new tab. Props to <a href="https://github.com/zkan" rel="nofollow">@zkan</a></li>
<li>Changes all mentions of &#8216;keyword&#8217; to &#8216;keyphrase&#8217;. Read more about <a href="https://yoa.st/keyword-to-keyphrase" rel="nofollow">the transition from &#8216;keyword&#8217; to &#8216;keyphrase&#8217;</a>.</li>
<li>Optimizes and caches WPSEO_Option_Titles::enrich_defaults(). Props to <a href="https://github.com/soulseekah" rel="nofollow">@soulseekah</a></li>
<li>Introduces a Features tab in the network admin, which allows disabling all site-specific features for the entire network.</li>
<li>Improves the tab order within the structured data blocks in Gutenberg and make it consistent between the FAQ and How-To block.</li>
<li>Improves sitemap performance by disabling the caching by default.</li>
<li>Adds <code>target="_blank"</code> to the &#8220;How to connect to GSC&#8221; link to open a new tab when clicked.</li>
<li>Adds an assessment that checks whether your keyword consists only of function words.</li>
<li>Changes OpenGraph image handling to always use an image from the media library. This makes the performance of the OpenGraph image handling much better.</li>
<li>Improves performance by no longer using images from the content as a fallback for the OpenGraph and Twitter images.</li>
</ul>
<p>Other:</p>
<ul>
<li>Deprecates the WPSEO_Cornerstone class.</li>
<li>Deprecates the assessment that checks if stopwords are used within the keyphrase.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Earlier versions</h4>
<p>For the changelog of earlier versions, please refer to https://yoa.st/yoast-seo-changelog</p>

(WP-Piwik)";s:4:"slug";s:8:"wp-piwik";s:7:"version";s:6:"1.0.19";s:6:"author";s:64:"<a href="http://www.braekling.de">Andr&eacute; Br&auml;kling</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:40:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/braekling";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.8.7";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:92;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:69;i:4;i:3;i:3;i:2;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:7;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:81;s:15:"support_threads";i:4;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:1498491;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-01-09 9:13am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2009-06-04";s:8:"homepage";s:45:"http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wp-piwik/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:4529:"<p>This plugin uses the Matomo API to show your Matomo statistics in your WordPress dashboard. It&#8217;s also able to add the Matomo tracking code to your blog and to do some modifications to the tracking code. Additionally, WP-Matomo supports WordPress networks and manages multiple sites and their tracking codes.</p>
<p>To use this plugin the Matomo web analytics application is required. If you do not already have a Matomo setup (e.g., provided by your web hosting service), you have two simple options: use either a <a href="http://matomo.org/" rel="nofollow">self-hosted Matomo</a> or a <a href="https://www.innocraft.cloud/?pk_campaign=WP-Piwik" rel="nofollow">cloud-hosted Matomo by InnoCraft</a>.</p>
<p><strong>Requirements:</strong> PHP 7.0 (or higher), WordPress 4.0 (or higher), Matomo 3.0 (or higher)</p>
<p><strong>Languages:</strong> English, Albanian, Chinese, Dutch, French, German, Greek, Hungarian, Italian, Polish, Portuguese (Brazil). Partially supported: Azerbaijani, Belarusian, Hindi, Lithuanian, Luxembourgish, Norwegian, Persian, Romanian, Russian, Spanish, Swedish, Turkish, Ukrainian</p>
<h4>What is Matomo?</h4>
<p><span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/OslfF_EH81g?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span><br />
<a href="https://matomo.org/what-is-matomo/" rel="nofollow">Learn more.</a></p>
<h4>First steps</h4>
<ul>
<li>Learn how to install your own Matomo instance: <a href="https://matomo.org/docs/requirements/" rel="nofollow">Requirements</a>, <a href="https://matomo.org/docs/installation-optimization/" rel="nofollow">Installation</a>.</li>
<li>If you need support about Matomo, please have a look at the <a href="https://forum.matomo.org/" rel="nofollow">Matomo forums</a>.</li>
<li>Finally, you can start <a href="https://matomo.org/blog/2015/05/wordpress-integration-wp-piwik-1-0/" rel="nofollow">setting up WP-Matomo</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Shortcodes</h4>
<p>You can use following shortcodes if activated:</p>
<pre><code>[wp-piwik module="overview" title="" period="day" date="yesterday"]
</code></pre>
<p>Shows overview table like WP-Matomo&#8217;s overview dashboard. See Matomo API documentation on VisitsSummary.get to get more information on period and day. Multiple data arrays will be cumulated. If you fill the title attribute, its content will be shown in the table&#8217;s title.</p>
<pre><code>[wp-piwik module="opt-out" language="en" width="100%" height="200px"]
</code></pre>
<p>Shows the Matomo opt-out Iframe. You can change the Iframe&#8217;s language by the language attribute (e.g. de for German language) and its width and height using the corresponding attributes.</p>
<pre><code>[wp-piwik module="post" range="last30" key="sum_daily_nb_uniq_visitors"]
</code></pre>
<p>Shows the chosen keys value related to the current post. You can define a range (format: lastN, previousN or YYYY-MM-DD,YYYY-MM-DD) and the desired value&#8217;s key (e.g., sum_daily_nb_uniq_visitors, nb_visits or nb_hits &#8211; for details see Matomo&#8217;s API method Actions.getPageUrl using a range).</p>
<pre><code>[wp-piwik]
</code></pre>
<p>is equal to <em>[wp-piwik module=&#8221;overview&#8221; title=&#8221;&#8221; period=&#8221;day&#8221; date=&#8221;yesterday&#8221;]</em>.</p>
<h4>Credits</h4>
<ul>
<li>Graphs powered by <a href="http://www.jqplot.com/" rel="nofollow">jqPlot</a> (GPL 2.0 and MIT) and and <a href="http://omnipotent.net/jquery.sparkline/" rel="nofollow">jQuery Sparklines</a> (New BSD License).</li>
<li>All translators at the <a href="https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/wp-piwik/" rel="nofollow">Transifex translation community</a>.</li>
<li>Donations: Marco L., Rolf W., Tobias U., Lars K., Donna F., Kevin D., Ramos S., Thomas M., John C., Andreas G., Ben M., Myra R. I., Carlos U. R.-S., Oleg I., M. N., Daniel K., James L., Jochen K., Cyril P., Thomas K., Patrik K., Zach, Sebastian W., Peakkom, Patrik K., Kati K., Helmut O., Valerie S., Jochen D., Atlas R., Harald W., Jan M., Addy K., Hans-Georg E.-B., Yvonne K., Andrew D., the Matomo team itself, and all people flattering this.</li>
<li>All users who send me mails containing criticism, commendation, feature requests and bug reports &#8211; you help me to make WP-Matomo much better!</li>
</ul>
<p>Thank you all!</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:2466:"<h4>General Notes</h4>
<ul>
<li>First, you have to set up a running Matomo instance. You can get Matomo <a href="http://matomo.org/" rel="nofollow">here</a> and its documentation <a href="http://matomo.org/docs/" rel="nofollow">here</a>.</li>
<li>If you want to update your Matomo instance, you should set your WordPress blog to maintenance while the update process is running.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Install WP-Matomo on a simple WordPress blog</h4>
<ol>
<li>Upload the full <code>wp-piwik</code> directory into your <code>wp-content/plugins</code> directory.</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress.</li>
<li>Open the new &#8216;Settings/WP-Matomo (WP-Piwik) Settings&#8217; menu and follow the instructions to configure your Matomo connection. Save settings.</li>
<li>If you have view access to multiple site stats and did not enable &#8220;auto config&#8221;, choose your blog and save settings again.</li>
<li>Look at &#8216;Dashboard/WP-Matomo (WP-Piwik)&#8217; to see your site stats.</li>
</ol>
<h4>Install WP-Matomo on a WordPress blog network (WPMU/WP multisite)</h4>
<p>There are two differents methods to use WP-Matomo in a multisite environment:</p>
<ul>
<li>As a Site Specific Plugin it behaves like a plugin installed on a simple WordPress blog. Each user can enable, configure and use WP-Matomo on his own. Users can even use their own Matomo instances (and accordingly they have to). </li>
<li>Using WP-Matomo as a Network Plugin equates to a central approach. A single Matomo instance is used and the site admin configures the plugin completely. Users are just allowed to see their own statistics, site admins can see each blog&#8217;s stats.</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Site Specific Plugin</em></p>
<p>Just add WP-Matomo to your /wp-content/plugins folder and enable the Plugins page for individual site administrators. Each user has to enable and configure WP-Matomo on his own if he want to use the plugin.</p>
<p><em>Network Plugin</em></p>
<p>The Network Plugin support is still experimental. Please test it on your own (e.g. using a local copy of your WP multisite) before you use it in an user context.</p>
<p>Add WP-Matomo to your /wp-content/plugins folder and enable it as <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Create_A_Network#WordPress_Plugins" rel="nofollow">Network Plugin</a>. Users can access their own statistics, site admins can access each blog&#8217;s statistics and the plugin&#8217;s configuration.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:6377:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<h4>General Notes</h4>
<ul>
<li>First, you have to set up a running Matomo instance. You can get Matomo <a href="http://matomo.org/" rel="nofollow">here</a> and its documentation <a href="http://matomo.org/docs/" rel="nofollow">here</a>.</li>
<li>If you want to update your Matomo instance, you should set your WordPress blog to maintenance while the update process is running.</li>
</ul>
<h4>Install WP-Matomo on a simple WordPress blog</h4>
<ol>
<li>Upload the full <code>wp-piwik</code> directory into your <code>wp-content/plugins</code> directory.</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress.</li>
<li>Open the new &#8216;Settings/WP-Matomo (WP-Piwik) Settings&#8217; menu and follow the instructions to configure your Matomo connection. Save settings.</li>
<li>If you have view access to multiple site stats and did not enable &#8220;auto config&#8221;, choose your blog and save settings again.</li>
<li>Look at &#8216;Dashboard/WP-Matomo (WP-Piwik)&#8217; to see your site stats.</li>
</ol>
<h4>Install WP-Matomo on a WordPress blog network (WPMU/WP multisite)</h4>
<p>There are two differents methods to use WP-Matomo in a multisite environment:</p>
<ul>
<li>As a Site Specific Plugin it behaves like a plugin installed on a simple WordPress blog. Each user can enable, configure and use WP-Matomo on his own. Users can even use their own Matomo instances (and accordingly they have to). </li>
<li>Using WP-Matomo as a Network Plugin equates to a central approach. A single Matomo instance is used and the site admin configures the plugin completely. Users are just allowed to see their own statistics, site admins can see each blog&#8217;s stats.</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Site Specific Plugin</em></p>
<p>Just add WP-Matomo to your /wp-content/plugins folder and enable the Plugins page for individual site administrators. Each user has to enable and configure WP-Matomo on his own if he want to use the plugin.</p>
<p><em>Network Plugin</em></p>
<p>The Network Plugin support is still experimental. Please test it on your own (e.g. using a local copy of your WP multisite) before you use it in an user context.</p>
<p>Add WP-Matomo to your /wp-content/plugins folder and enable it as <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Create_A_Network#WordPress_Plugins" rel="nofollow">Network Plugin</a>. Users can access their own statistics, site admins can access each blog&#8217;s statistics and the plugin&#8217;s configuration.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I find the Matomo URL and the Matomo auth token?</h4>
<p>
<p>To use this plugin you will need your own Matomo instance. If you do not already have a Matomo setup, you have two simple options: use either a <a href="http://matomo.org/" rel="nofollow">self-hosted Matomo</a> or <a href="https://www.innocraft.cloud/?pk_campaign=WP-Piwik" rel="nofollow">cloud-hosted Matomo by InnoCraft</a>.</p>
<p>As soon as Matomo works, you&#8217;ll be able to configure WP-Matomo: The Matomo URL is the same URL you use to access your Matomo, e.g. for the demo site: http://demo.matomo.org. The auth token is some kind of a secret password, which allows WP-Matomo to get the necessary data from Matomo. To get your auth token, log in to Matomo, click at the preferences gear icon (top right) and click at &#8220;API&#8221; (left sidebar menu, near the bottom).</p>
<p>You can get a more detailed description here: https://matomo.org/blog/2015/05/wordpress-integration-wp-piwik-1-0/</p>
</p>
<h4>I get this message: &#8220;WP-Matomo (WP-Piwik) was not able to connect to Matomo (Piwik) using our configuration&#8221;. How to proceed?</h4>
<p>
<p>First, please make sure your configuration is valid, e.g., if you are using the right Matomo URL (see description above). Then, go to the &#8220;Support&#8221; tab and run the test script. This test script will try to get some information from Matomo and shows the full response. Usually, the response output gives a clear hint what&#8217;s wrong:</p>
<p>The response output contains&#8230;<br />
* <strong>bool(false)</strong> and <strong>HTTP/1.1 403 Forbidden</strong>: WP-Matomo is not allowed to connect to Matomo. Please check your Matomo server&#8217;s configuration. Maybe you are using a password protection via .htaccess or you are blocking requests from localhost/127.0.0.1. If you aren’t sure about this, please contact your web hoster for support.<br />
* <strong>bool(false)</strong> and <strong>HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found</strong>: The Matomo URL is wrong. Try to copy &amp; paste the URL you use to access Matomo itself via browser.<br />
* <strong>bool(false)</strong> and no further HTTP response code: The Matomo server does not respond. Very often, this is caused by firewall or mod_security settings. Check your server logfiles to get further information. If you aren’t sure about this, please contact your web hoster for support.</p>
</p>
<h4>PHP Compatibility Checker reports PHP7 compatbility issues with WP-Matomo.</h4>
<p>
<p>The Compatibility Checker shows two false positives. WP-Matomo is 100% PHP7 compatible, you can ignore the report.</p>
</p>
<h4>Overview shortcode shows no unique visitors using a yearly range.</h4>
<p>
<p>See <a href="http://matomo.org/faq/how-to/#faq_113" rel="nofollow">Matomo FAQ</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>WP-Matomo only shows the first 100 sites of my multisite network. How can I get all other sites?</h4>
<p>
<p>The Matomo API is limited to 100 sites by default. Add the following line to the section [General] of Matomo&#8217;s config/config.ini.php file:</p>
<pre><code>API_datatable_default_limit = 1000
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>Tracking does not work on HostGator!</h4>
<p>
<p>Try to enable the &#8220;avoid mod_security&#8221; option (WP-Matomo settings, Tracking tab) or create a mod_security whitelist.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I contribute to WP-Matomo as a translator?</h4>
<p>
<p>You like to contribute to WP-Matomo translations? Please use the <a href="https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/wp-piwik/" rel="nofollow">Transifex translation community</a>.</p>
<p>Of course, I will add missing languages if requested, and I will also upload the existing language files of older WP-Matomo releases.</p>
<p>If you can&#8217;t (or don not want to) use transifex, you can also translate languages/wp-piwik.pot delivered with WP-Matomo.</p>
<p>Thank you very much! 🙂</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:25396:"<h4>1.0.19</h4>
<ul>
<li>Security fix: Escape request var</li>
<li>Language updates</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.18</h4>
<ul>
<li>WPML.org support: Use different site IDs for different languages</li>
<li>Ecommerce widgets</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Header issue solved which caused incompatibilities with other plugins like Yoast SEO</li>
<li>Update of InnoCraft cloud links (InnoCraft is the team behind Matomo)</li>
<li>Bugfix: Avoid a broken page if Matomo is misconfigured and WordPress debugging enabled</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.16</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added InnoCraft Cloud support (the new service created by the people behind Matomo). Piwik.pro is still usable via HTTP mode, the configuration will be updated automatically.</li>
<li>Added search functionality to site browser</li>
<li>Added preload DNS option, see https://matomo.org/blog/2017/04/important-performance-optimizations-load-piwik-javascript-tracker-faster/</li>
<li>Added option to set link and download classes (expert settings)</li>
<li>Added option to choose which post types should be considered for annotations</li>
<li>Bugfix: Opening Matomo stats of a specific network site does not lead to the sitebrowser anymore</li>
<li>Bugfix: Avoid unnecessary notices</li>
<li>Bugfix: Avoid a warning in proxy script</li>
<li>Bugfix: NoScript code is working again</li>
<li>Replaced deprecated wp_get_sites</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.15</h4>
<ul>
<li>Allow to modify the tracked user ID using the filter &#8220;wp-piwik_tracking_user_id&#8221;</li>
<li>Bugfix: Output of &#8220;post&#8221; shortcode was incorrectly placed, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/post-shortcode-values-are-incorrectly-placed/</li>
<li>Bugfix: Usage of WP_PROXY_BYPASS_HOSTS, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/bug-considering-wp_proxy_bypass_hosts-in-proxy-setups/</li>
<li>Bugfix: Proxy script did not work with cURL, see https://github.com/braekling/WP-Matomo/issues/48</li>
<li>Bugfix: RSS feed tracking did not use proxy URL</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.14</h4>
<ul>
<li>Action &#8220;wp-piwik_site_created&#8221; was extended by a site ID parameter, so it will deliver the Matomo site ID of the created site</li>
<li>Bugfix: Fixed an issue with Matomo site creation</li>
<li>Bugfix: Allow changes of a manually defined tracking code on networks, see https://github.com/braekling/WP-Matomo/issues/46</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.13</h4>
<ul>
<li>Language updates</li>
<li>Readme typo fixes (thx to ujdhesa)</li>
<li>Perform your own code after site creation by using the action &#8220;wp-piwik_site_created&#8221;</li>
<li>Improved caching ID to avoid interferences, see https://github.com/braekling/WP-Matomo/issues/42</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.12</h4>
<ul>
<li>Removed notices and warnings</li>
<li>Allow to modify the tracking code using the filter &#8220;wp-piwik_tracking_code&#8221;</li>
<li>Network: Don&#8217;t show plugin overview settings link on individual sites</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.11</h4>

<li>Bugfix: Post shortcode is fixed and will work again</li>
</ul>

</ul>

</ul>

<li>Option: Track visitors without JavaScript, see http://matomo.org/faq/how-to/#faq_176</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.9.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Sparkline script update (IE 10 compatibility)</li>
<li>Syntax error fixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.9.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix regarding tracking code changes in proxy mode, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/problem-with-https-in-proxy-mode</li>
<li>Feature: Change text &#8220;WP-Matomo&#8221; in menu items and dashboard widgets</li>
<li>Code cleanup (&#8220;new&#8221; first step)</li>
<li>Debugging: Logger added</li>
<li>Avoid double slash (//) in tracking code</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.9.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>CDN support: http and https separated, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/request-cdn-support-1</li>
<li>Made  code optional. Move  code to site footer.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.9.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Matomo 1.11 compatibility fixes (Matomo 1.11 required now!) </li>
<li>Depending on Matomo 1.11 WP-Matomo will use async tracking now</li>
<li>CDN support added, see https://wordpress.org/support/topic/request-cdn-support-1</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.8.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Warning on empty data removed (overview table)</li>
<li>Removed a possible deadlock</li>
<li>Bugfix: Apply tracking code settings everytime the tracking code is updated</li>
<li>Reset/uninstall script bugfix regarding network mode</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.8</h4>
<ul>
<li>WordPress 3.5 compatibility fix: https://wordpress.org/support/topic/v35-errors-fix?replies=5 (Thanks Christian Foellmann!)</li>
<li>Advanced Search Result Analytics, see http://matomo.org/docs/javascript-tracking/#toc-tracking-internal-search-keywords-categories-and-no-result-search-keywords</li>
<li>Site Search stats added</li>
<li>Use js/index.php: Replaces piwik.js and piwik.php by js/ (instead of piwik.js only)</li>
<li>Connection timeout setting added</li>
<li>Full reset option added</li>
<li>Uninstall script added</li>
<li>Stats metaboxes: Date formatted</li>
<li>Use proxy settings defined in wp-config.php</li>
<li>Matomo.php proxy script added (see http://matomo.org/faq/how-to/#faq_132)</li>
<li>Bugfix: After upgrade, Matomo automatically places cookies again (https://wordpress.org/support/topic/after-upgrade-piwik-automatically-places-cookies-again)</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>Shortcodes added</li>
<li>WP-Matomo will rename sites in Matomo if site name changes in WordPress</li>
<li>Bugfix: Tracking code changes should stay active after WP-Matomo updates</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.6.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Matomo 1.9+ compatibility fix (Matomo 1.9 required!)</li>
<li>Browser version details added</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.6.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/plugin-wp-piwik-you-attempted-to-access-the-networks-dashboard-but-you-do-not" rel="nofollow">&#8220;Create Matomo site&#8221; link (network dashboard)</a></li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.6.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Toolbar graph bugfix</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>Option: Disable SSL peer verification (REST API)</li>
<li>Option: Use own user agent</li>
<li>Test script displays additional information (e.g. response headers)</li>
<li>Using WordPress metabox concept properly</li>
<li>Bugfix: Sparkline script only loaded if required</li>
<li>Stats site supports up to 3 columns</li>
<li>Network admin stats: Choose site using a paged table (instead of a select box).</li>
<li>Feature: <a href="http://matomo.org/docs/javascript-tracking/#toc-custom-variables" rel="nofollow">Custom variables</a>, using <a href="http://wp.smashingmagazine.com/2011/10/04/create-custom-post-meta-boxes-wordpress/" rel="nofollow">custom post meta boxes</a>.</li>
<li>Some minor bugfixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>WordPress 3.4 compatible (workaround)</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Requires at least Matomo 1.8.2!</li>
<li>Choose between HTTP API or PHP API</li>
<li>Show graph on WordPress Toolbar</li>
<li>Add option to disable cookies &#8211; Thanks to Mathias T.!</li>
<li>Update bugfix: Upgrading from WP-Matomo 0.8.7 or less will work again</li>
<li>Some minor bugfixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Adding a new site will work again.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Uses $wpdb-&gt;blogs instead of $wpdb-&gt;prefix.&#8217;blogs&#8217; to keep it compatible to different database plugins</li>
<li>Bugfix: SEO dashboard widget will work even if &#8220;last 30&#8221; is selected</li>
<li>Bugfix: New created blogs won&#8217;t show &#8220;Please specify a value for &#8216;idSite&#8217;.&#8221; anymore.</li>
<li>Bugfix: New network sites without title will be created</li>
<li>Bugfix: Upgrading from old versions will work again</li>
<li>Tabbed settings</li>
<li>Debug tools added (testscript, site configuration overview and WP-Matomo reset)</li>
<li>Support forum RSS feed</li>
<li>Language updates</li>
<li>Optionally use of set_time_limit(0) on stats page time out</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Usage as &#8220;Site Specific Plugin&#8221; <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/plugin-wp-piwik-as-simple-plugin-with-multisite-fills-auth-with-last-used-token" rel="nofollow">mixed up the different sites settings</a> (network mode)</li>
<li>Hotfix: Avoid &#8220;Unknown site/blog&#8221; message without giving a chance to choose an existing site. Thank you, Taimon!</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Auto-configuration</li>
<li>No code change required to enable WPMU mode anymore (Still experimental. Please create a backup before trying 0.9.0!)</li>
<li>All features in WPMU available</li>
<li>Bugfix: Removed unnecessary API calls done with each site request &#8211; Thank you, Martin B.!</li>
<li>Bugfix: <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/no-stats-on-dashboard-new-install" rel="nofollow">No stats on dashboard</a> (sometimes this issue still occured, should be fixed now)</li>
<li>Code cleanup (still not finished)</li>
<li>Minor UI fixes</li>
<li>Minor language/gettext improvements</li>
<li>Security improvements</li>
<li>Show SEO rank stats (very slow, caching will be added in 0.9.1)</li>
<li>WordPress dashboard SEO rank widget (very slow, caching will be added in 0.9.1)</li>
<li>New option: use js/index.php</li>
<li>New option: avoid mod_security</li>
<li>Multisite: Order blog list alphabetically (Network Admin stats site)</li>
<li>Settings: Order site list alphabetically (site list shown if order conf is disabled)</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.10</h4>
<ul>
<li>jqplot update (IE 9 compatibility) &#8211; Thank you, Martin!</li>
<li>Bugfix: <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/no-stats-on-dashboard-new-install" rel="nofollow">No stats on dashboard</a></li>
<li>Layout fix: <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/stats-graph-in-dashboard-changed" rel="nofollow">Graph width on dashboard</a></li>
<li>Minor code cleanup</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.9</h4>
<ul>
<li>WP 3.2 compatible, metabox support</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.8</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Will also work with index.php in Matomo path</li>
<li>Bugfix: last30 dashboard widget &#8211; show correct bounce rate</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>New language files (Azerbaijani, Greek, Russian)</li>
<li>Fixed hardcoded database prefix (WPMU-Matomo)</li>
<li>Minor bugfixes: avoid some PHP warnings</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added an optional visitor chart to the WordPress dashboard</li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/plugin-wp-piwik-multisite-update-procedure" rel="nofollow">WPMU/multisite bug</a> fixed</li>
<li>Minor bugfixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Select default date (today or yesterday) shown on statistics page</li>
<li>Bugfix: Shortcut links are shown again</li>
<li>German language file update</li>
<li>Minor optical fixes (text length)</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>New stats in overview box</li>
<li>WP 3.x compability fixes (capability and deprecated function warnings)</li>
<li>Some minor bugfixes</li>
<li>New config handling</li>
<li>Code clean up (not finished)</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Matomo 1.1+ compatibility fix</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/plugin-wp-piwik-jscode-not-updated-when-saving-new-url-in-wpmu-mode" rel="nofollow">WPMU URL update bug</a></li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Use load_plugin_textdomain instead of load_textdomain</li>
<li>Fixed js/css links if symbolic links are used</li>
<li>Changed experimental WPMU support to experimental WP multisite support</li>
<li>Try curl() before fopen() to avoid an <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/plugin-wp-piwik-problems-reaching-an-ssl-installation-of-piwiki" rel="nofollow">OpenSSL bug</a></li>
<li>Added Norwegian language file by Gormer</li>
<li>Don&#8217;t worry &#8211; new features will follow soon 😉</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Using jqPlot instead of Google Chart API</li>
<li>Some facelifting</li>
<li>Some minor bugfixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.7.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Track 404-pages in an own category</li>
<li>Get some page (and article) details</li>
<li>Language updates</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.7.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Percent calculation fixed</li>
<li>Bugfix: Visitor chart: No label overlapping if &lt; 50 visitory/day</li>
<li>Visitor chart: Added a red unique visitor average line</li>
<li>Visitor table: Added a TOTAL stats line</li>
<li>Pie charts: Show top 9 + &#8220;others&#8221;, new color range</li>
<li>Option: Show Matomo shortcut in overview box</li>
<li>Some performance optimization</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.6.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Unnecessary debug output removed</li>
<li>German language file update</li>
<li>WordPress dashboard widget: last 30 days view added</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.6.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Click at a visitor stats day-row to load its details</li>
<li>Add stats overview to your WordPress dashboard</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.6.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added experimental WPMU support</li>
<li>Switch to disable Google Chart API</li>
<li>Added Albanian [sq] language file</li>
<li>Added Belorussian [be_BY] language file</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.5.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Display statistics to selected user roles</li>
<li>Some HTML fixes (settings page)</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.4.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tracking filter added</li>
<li>Resolution stats</li>
<li>Operating System stats</li>
<li>Plugin stats</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.3.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>If allow_url_fopen is disabled in php.ini, WP-Matomo tries to use CURL instead of file_get_contents</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.3.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>WordPress 2.8 compatible</li>
<li>Bugfix: Warnings on WP 2.8 plugins site</li>
<li>Dashboard revised</li>
<li>Partly optimized code</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.3.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>WP-Matomo dashboard widgetized</li>
<li>Stats-boxes sortable and closeable</li>
<li>German language file added</li>
<li>Browser stats and bounced visitors</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.2.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>First public version</li>

5.zip";s:6:"1.0.16";s:58:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-piwik.1.0.16.zip";s:6:"1.0.17";s:58:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-piwik.1.0.17.zip";s:6:"1.0.18";s:58:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-piwik.1.0.18.zip";s:6:"1.0.19";s:58:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-piwik.1.0.19.zip";s:5:"1.0.2";s:57:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-piwik.1.0.2.zip";s:5:"1.0.3";s:57:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-piwik.1.0.3.zip";s:5:"1.0.4";s:57:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-piwik.1.0.4.zip";s:5:"1.0.5";s:57:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-piwik.1.0.5.zip";s:5:"1.0.6";s:57:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-piwik.1.0.6.zip";s:5:"1.0.7";s:57:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-piwik.1.0.7.zip";s:5:"1.0.8";s:57:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-piwik.1.0.8.zip";s:5:"1.0.9";s:57:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-piwik.1.0.9.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:51:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-piwik.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:76:"https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=6046779";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"1x";s:61:"https://ps.w.org/wp-piwik/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=1236622";s:2:"2x";s:61:"https://ps.w.org/wp-piwik/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1236616";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:9:"languages";s:3:"any";s:8:"category";a:1:{s:3:"any";s:9:"analytics";}}s:18:"wysija-newsletters";a:28:{s:4:"name";s:31:"MailPoet
