6:27am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2011-12-03";s:8:"homepage";s:24:"http://www.mailpoet.com/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:1989:"<p>Our lovely plugin is changing for the better: MailPoet 2 is being replaced by <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/mailpoet/">MailPoet 3</a>.</p>
<p>Version 2 will remain available right here on the repository. <a href="https://www.mailpoet.com/faq-mailpoet-version-2/" rel="nofollow">Read more the complete FAQ.</a></p>
<h4>Check out this 2 minute video.</h4>
<p><div class="embed-vimeo" style="text-align: center;"><iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/130151897" width="640" height="360" frameborder="0" webkitallowfullscreen mozallowfullscreen allowfullscreen></iframe></div>
</p>
<h4>Features</h4>
<p>Please visit <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/mailpoet/">MailPoet version 3 features</a> instead.</p>
<h4>Premium version</h4>
<p>MailPoet Premium offers these nifty extra features:</p>
<ul>
<li>Send to more than 2000 subscribers</li>
<li>A beautiful statistics dashboard to compare your newsletters and subscribers</li>
<li>Detailed stats for each subscriber and newsletter</li>
<li>Automated bounce handling that keeps your subscribers&#8217; list clean</li>
<li>Test your SPAM score before you send a newsletter to your subscribers</li>
<li>Improve deliverability with DKIM signature</li>
<li>Simple install process</li>
<li>Priority support</li>
</ul>
<h4>Support</h4>
<p>This version is no longer officially supported. Paying customer will continue to be supported until further notice.</p>
<h4>Translations in your language</h4>
<ul>
<li>Arabic</li>
<li>Basque</li>
<li>Catalan</li>
<li>Chinese</li>
<li>Croatian</li>
<li>Czech</li>
<li>Danish</li>
<li>Dutch</li>
<li>French (but of course!)</li>
<li>German</li>
<li>Greek</li>
<li>Hebrew</li>
<li>Hungarian</li>
<li>Indonesian</li>
<li>Italian</li>
<li>Japanese</li>
<li>Norwegian</li>
<li>Persian</li>
<li>Polish</li>
<li>Portuguese PT</li>
<li>Portuguese BR</li>
<li>Romanian</li>
<li>Russian</li>
<li>Serbian</li>
<li>Slovak</li>
<li>Slovenian</li>
<li>Spanish</li>
<li>Swedish</li>
<li>Turkish</li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:970:"<p>There are 3 ways to install this plugin:</p>
<h4>1. The super easy way</h4>
<ol>
<li>In your Admin, go to menu Plugins &gt; Add</li>
<li>Search for <code>mailpoet</code></li>
<li>Click to install</li>
<li>Activate the plugin</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
<h4>2. The easy way</h4>
<ol>
<li>Download the plugin (.zip file) on the right column of this page</li>
<li>In your Admin, go to menu Plugins &gt; Add</li>
<li>Select the tab &#8220;Upload&#8221;</li>
<li>Upload the .zip file you just downloaded</li>
<li>Activate the plugin</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
<h4>3. The old and reliable way (FTP)</h4>
<ol>
<li>Upload <code>wysija-newsletters</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>A new menu <code>MailPoet</code> will appear in your Admin</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:294:"
<h4>Got questions?</h4>
<p>
<p>Our <a href="https://www.mailpoet.com/support" rel="nofollow">support site</a> has plenty of articles and a ticketing system.</p>
<p><a href="https://www.mailpoet.com/faq-mailpoet-version-2/" rel="nofollow">Read more the complete FAQ on version 2.</a></p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:58852:"<h4>2.10.2 &#8211; 2018-10-17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: stuck &#8220;What&#8217;s new&#8221; page so you could still use the rest of the plugin.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.10.1 &#8211; 2018-10-16</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: Discount when upgrading to MailPoet 3. Consider upgrading today!</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.9 &#8211; 2018-07-24</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added: announcing about newly added image alignment support in MailPoet 3;</li>
<li>Fixed: missing text domains on some translations;</li>
<li>Removed: promotion that has ended a while ago.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.8.2 &#8211; 2018-03-14</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improved: protection against spam attacks. Thanks, Eslam Mohamed Reda!</li>
<li>Fixed: support for PHP 5.2 has been restored.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.8.1 &#8211; 2017-11-28</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added poll and discounts</li>
<li>Fixed editor sidebar missing if plugins enqueue the mediaelement script on WP 4.9</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.8 &#8211; 2017-11-20</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added support for ReCaptcha to protect subscription forms from automated abuse</li>
<li>Fixed editor sidebar missing if a theme uses wp_enqueue_media() function on WP 4.9</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.15.1 &#8211; 2017-11-02</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improved IP throttling to work independently of subscribers table (for robustness)</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.14 &#8211; 2017-10-23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Removed SWFUpload support</li>
<li>Fixed path for TinyMCE styles</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.13 &#8211; 2017-09-29</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added throttling of repeated subscriptions from an IP address</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.12.1 &#8211; 2017-09-19</h4>
<ul>
<li>Update messages in regards to official launch of MailPoet version 3</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.11.3 &#8211; 2017-07-21</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed Premium version download link</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.11.1 &#8211; 2017-07-17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improved welcome and update pages</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.10 &#8211; 2017-04-20</h4>
<ul>
<li>Introduced minor changes to the premium page</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.9 &#8211; 2017-04-17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed security issue reported by Craig Smith. Thanks!</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.8 &#8211; 2017-03-03</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed sending issues when MailPoet&#8217;s sending service is selected</li>
<li>Fixed sending post notifications when tag filters are used</li>
<li>Fixed the display of incorrect newsletter title in browser preview</li>
<li>Fixed PHP notices associated with sending on multisite hosts</li>
<li>Fixed broken DKIM signing</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.7 &#8211; 2017-01-31</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed activation issues on PHP 5.2</li>
<li>Removed PHPMailer library in compliance with the new WordPress security policy. Please report any sending issues!</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.6 &#8211; 2017-01-18</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed post categories not being displayed in sent newsletters</li>
<li>Fixed PHPMailer vulnerability</li>
<li>Fixed PEAR POP3&#8217;s usage of static methods</li>
<li>Fixed direct manipulation of the $wp_filter global</li>
<li>Fixed BBPress unsubscribe compatibility</li>
<li>Added ElasticEmail unsubscribe tag</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.5 &#8211; 2016-08-18</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed subscription form widget</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.4 &#8211; 2016-08-09</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed error appearing during newsletter creation</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.3 &#8211; 2016-08-08</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed issue with emoji when saving newsletters</li>
<li>Prevent encoding of &#8220;tel:&#8221; URLs</li>
<li>Fixed SQL injection vulnerability (Thanks to Force Interactive)</li>
<li>Fixed XSS vulnerability (Thanks to Sipke Mellema from Securify B.V.)</li>
<li>Fixed PHP warnings on Bounce management</li>
<li>Escape commma and quote marks during export</li>
<li>Fixed some editor issues</li>
<li>Fixed double signed DKIM emails</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.2 &#8211; 2016-06-01</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed broken CSS for Premium page</li>
<li>Fixed Custom Fields not saving on front-end</li>
<li>Fixed image ratio for specific locations</li>
<li>Fixed issue with missing rule (onlyNumberSp) in Italian &amp; German translations</li>
<li>Fixed broken email validation in Dutch language with long extensions</li>
<li>Fixed undefined property notice on Bounce pages</li>
<li>Added SparkPost API support</li>
<li>Fixed security issues. Thanks again to Falk Huber (T-Systems) for reporting them</li>
<li>Added new menu icon (New MailPoet Branding)</li>
<li>Fixed sending preview of an email with an empty subject</li>
<li>Added Ukrainian JS validation language</li>
<li>Replaced deprecated get_currentuserinfo() with wp_get_current_user()</li>
<li>Fixed PHP notices that may have appeared during the sending process</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.1 &#8211; 2016-03-15</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed security issues. Thanks to Falk Huber for letting us now.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7 &#8211; 2016-01-29</h4>
<ul>
<li>Enabled PHP7 compatibility</li>
<li>Fixed security issues. Thanks to Immunity and Netsparker (https://www.netsparker.com) for alerting us.</li>
<li>Fixed an issue with newsletters not saving during the creation process</li>
<li>Disabled SSL verification on hosts with invalid SSL certificates and PHP 5.6</li>
<li>Updated SendGrid mailer</li>
<li>Improved URL validation logic</li>
<li>Addressed PHP notices that appeared in cron output</li>
<li>Fixed other minor issues</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.19 &#8211; 2015-10-13</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a URL validation issue when WP&#8217;s home &amp; site URLs are different. Kudos to Divaldo for pointing it out.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.18 &#8211; 2015-09-21</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed URL validation issue</li>
<li>Improved newsletter/subscriber search</li>
<li>Fixed minor issues</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.17 &#8211; 2015-09-04</h4>
<ul>
<li>Enhanced redirection check in email URLs.</li>
<li>Fixed old-style PHP constructors.</li>
<li>Fixed newsletter preview bug.</li>
<li>Fixed import issues on old PHP versions.</li>
<li>Fixed minor issues.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.16 &#8211; 2015-06-23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added HHVM support</li>
<li>Added MariaDB support</li>
<li>Fixed import issue where existing subscriber&#8217;s data was not updated</li>
<li>Fixed minor issues</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.15 &#8211; 2015-02-17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed hidden signup confirmation when the theme &#8220;Twenty Fifteen&#8221; is activated</li>
<li>Fixed import issue on Windows servers, all valid subscribers CSV files can be imported now</li>
<li>Fixed the filter &#8220;Subscribers in no list&#8221; in the Subscribers&#8217; listing in the backend</li>
<li>Fixed bug in the frontend subscriptions page with the shortcode [wysija_page] not being replaced</li>
<li>Fixed rendering issue when sending WordPress Post notifications including multiple levels of nested HTML lists(ul &amp; ol)</li>
<li>Improved performance in the Subscribers&#8217; listing</li>
<li>Improved scheduled tasks process responses for greater reliability</li>
<li>Added &#8220;WBounce&#8221; to our list of compatible plugins in Settings &gt; Add-ons</li>
<li>Added non-translated strings for the subscribe and unsubscribe admin notifications</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.14 &#8211; 2014-11-26</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed all of the RTL issues on delivered newsletters and their web version</li>
<li>Fixed issue when importing subscribers with new custom fields</li>
<li>Fixed duplicated Monthly post notifications issue</li>
<li>Fixed View in Browser version deactivation</li>
<li>Removed option to switch to Beta</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.13 &#8211; 2014-10-27</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed a conflict with the plugin <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/magic-action-box/">Magic Action Box</a></li>
<li>Fixed blank export file when exporting subscribers with custom fields</li>
<li>Fixed the default subscribers ordering in the backend, we now display the most recent first</li>
<li>Fixed the bug on Bold and Italic commands in our newsletter editor</li>
<li>Fixed an issue on the new bulk resend confirmation email feature</li>
<li>Fixed bounce management issue (Premium only), counting until 3 when a mailbox is full</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.12 &#8211; 2014-10-16</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improved security thanks to Dominik Schilling, <a href="http://planetzuda.com" rel="nofollow">Ryan Satterfield</a> and <a href="https://logicaltrust.net/en/" rel="nofollow">Logical Trust</a></li>
<li>Improved performance issue</li>
<li>Improved email rendering</li>
<li>Improved our stats dashboard, now they have a few more goodiness attached to them</li>
<li>Improved Subscribers&#8217; Export, better data encoding for Windows servers</li>
<li>Improved Form Editor, Date fields now accept dates prior to 1970</li>
<li>Fixed conflict with EditFlow in our Visual Editor</li>
<li>Fixed rare bug on Windows Server stopping you from sending emails</li>
<li>Added option to Resend confirmation email in the Subscriber&#8217;s listing</li>
<li>Hard at work cleaning up our code and making it better</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.11 &#8211; 2014-08-14</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improved protection against CSRF attacks thanks to Yoshinori Matsumoto.</li>
<li>Fixed bug on scheduled newsletters edited back and forth and becoming uneditable.</li>
<li>Fixed when duplicating an email through the stats page of a newsletter, then deleting the duplicate would also delete the original.</li>
<li>Old code Spring cleaning part 2, getting rid of the junk.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.10 &#8211; 2014-08-04</h4>
<ul>
<li>Improved protection of themes upload, unsubscribe links, file access and statistics.</li>
<li>Improved the &#8220;Send a test email&#8221; function.</li>
<li>Fixed never ending process while sending previews on certain servers.</li>
<li>Fixed a few regular expressions for a better rendering in Outlook.</li>
<li>Fixed memory issue when dropping the &#8220;WordPress Post&#8221; widget on sites with thousands of taxonomies.</li>
<li>Fixed wrong subscribers count in the subscribers&#8217; listing.</li>
<li>Old code Spring cleaning, removed unused rusty pieces.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.9 &#8211; 2014-07-14</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed email display issues caused by responsive CSS. We&#8217;re truly sorry for this.</li>
<li>New columns on Subscribers page: &#8220;Never opened or clicked&#8221;</li>
<li>Removed &#8220;Unconfirmed&#8221; filter on Subscribers page when signup confirmation is off</li>
<li>Fixed a few minor bugs on the Statistics page for Premium users. Thanks for your feedbacks!</li>
<li>Fixed our hair with spray to look like cool kids in the eighties</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.8 &#8211; 2014-07-04</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed security issue reported by our dear Dominic. Thank you sir!</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.6.7 &#8211; 2014-07-01</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added 1 more add-on to our plugin&#8217;s listing</li>
<li>Implemented a new Email Rendering Engine, with a lot of bugs fixed for Outlook users and Mobile Users</li>
<li>Fixed broken &#8220;Automatic Latest Content&#8221; settings on sites with lots of tags</li>
<li>Fixed fatal error when sending to more than 1 million total subscribers</li>
<li>Fixed subscribers page being inaccessible on some Multisites (very rare bug)</li>
<li>Fixed Outlook 2013 paragraph spacing issue on previous beta</li>
<li>Fixed security issue reported by <a href="http://sucuri.net/" rel="nofollow">Sucuri</a></li>
<li>Fixed the HTML button on TinyMCE which was hidden in editor</li>
<li>Fixed the links popup on TinyMCE for IE11 in editor</li>
<li>Fixed &#8220;automated latest content&#8221; (ALC) bugs with multiple Custom Post Types</li>
<li>Fixed the upload image functionality in our plugin</li>
<li>Fixed default item selected on filter lists at the Subscribers page for Firefox and Opera users</li>
<li>Fixed warning message appearing on the subscription form for Admin Users</li>
<li>Fixed a few typos in the plugin</li>
<li>Improved the CSV export to expand its compatibility with Excel on Windows</li>
<li>Improved the performance of the plugin when loading admin assets</li>
</ul>

<li>Hey, we still have an issue with WordPress 3.9, our tinyMCE editor in Step 2 of the newsletter edition is not working properly (buttons are not usable)</li>
<li>No need to report us that issue, we&#8217;re already working hard to fix it. Thanks for your patience! 🙂</li>

</ul>
<h4>2.6 &#8211; 2014-03-18</h4>
<ul>
<li>This is the juiciest of all releases. Ready?</li>
<li>a new statistics dashboard in Premium. The beauty of the big picture</li>
<li>add more fields in your subscription forms, like phone number, address, or whatever you like</li>
<li>display an archive of your past newsletters in a page with a shortcode. Find it in the settings</li>
<li>display your posts&#8217; author names and categories in the newsletter editor</li>
<li>insert several posts at once in the editor, instead of one at a time. Time saver</li>
<li>a dozen new display options when you drop your posts in the newsletter, for the control freaks</li>
<li>find a list of add-ons in the settings. Plug your MailPoet with your other favorite plugins, like Gravity Forms</li>
<li>select your own WordPress pages for your confirmation and unsubscribe pages</li>
<li>use your MailPoet shortcodes in your confirmation emails, like [user:firstname | default:reader]</li>
<li>MailPoet now abides to German privacy laws. Guten tag Alex!</li>
<li>the browser version of your newsletter now include the Google Analytics tracking code (Premium)</li>
<li>right to left language improvements</li>
<li>our user interface is now styled for 3.8</li>
<li>needless to say, hundreds of mini improvements</li>
<li>we hand over to you 6 months of hard work. Enjoy!</li>
</ul>

<li>fixed Internet Explorer issue on WordPress Articles selection widget</li>
<li>fixed issue on IE8 where a draggable item was not disappearing after being dropped</li>
<li>fixed WordPress Synched list wrong count when sending</li>
<li>fixed image not being fetched from post content when inserting a WordPress post</li>
<li>fixed not sending auto newsletter with event &#8220;after a new user is added to your site&#8221; when double optin was off</li>
<li>fixed various plugins conflicting with our subscription form inserted into the content of a post or page</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.7 &#8211; 2012-11-09</h4>
<ul>
<li>added MailPoet custom cron option in Advanced Settings as an alternative to wp-cron</li>
<li>fixed translation missing for &#8220;unsubscribe&#8221;, &#8220;view in your browser&#8221; and &#8220;manage your subscription&#8221; links</li>
<li>fixed escaping quotes on subject in step 3 send preview</li>
<li>fixed wrong total of subscribers when sending</li>
<li>fixed bounced tab appearing empty for free users</li>
<li>fixed wrong selection in WordPress posts widget after a search(in visual editor)</li>
<li>fixed security issue with swf uploading module</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.6 &#8211; 2012-11-04</h4>
<ul>
<li>added basic Custom Post Type support in WordPress post widget</li>
<li>added resend an Activation Email for another list even when already subscribed</li>
<li>added posts autoload on scroll when adding single post in newsletter visual editor</li>
<li>fixed PHP Notice: step2 of newsletter creation</li>
<li>fixed PHP Notice: on debug class</li>
<li>fixed our debug hijacking WP_DEBUG in the backend (thanks Ryann)</li>
<li>fixed deprecated in bounce handling</li>
<li>fixed scrollbar issue in WordPress Post popup on Chrome &amp; Safari</li>
<li>fixed conflict with Simple Links plugin</li>
<li>fixed toolbar tabs disappearing in some languages (will be improved)</li>
<li>fixed bounce error not properly displayed prevented saving settings</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.1.3 &#8211; 2012-09-18</h4>
<ul>
<li>added restAPI for elasticemail when detected in the smtp configuration</li>
<li>improved install making sure that no crazy plugins will harm our initial setup (symptoms: Too many redirect crash or posting to social networks)</li>
<li>fixed SQL comments inserted as tables in some weird server&#8230;</li>
<li>fixed error 500 on update procedure of 2.1 when some roles were not existing. (add_cap on none object fatal error)</li>
<li>improved install process not creating new sql connection, only using wpdb&#8217;s one.</li>
<li>fixed synched plugins (Subscribe2 etc&#8230;) when there was just the main list</li>
<li>removed global css and javascript</li>
<li>fixed issue where the widget would not save</li>
<li>improved IE9 compatibility</li>
<li>fixed excerpt function to keep line breaks</li>
<li>fixed links with #parameters GA incompatibility -&gt; Thanks Adam</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.2 &#8211; 2012-09-05</h4>

<li>added security check for translated links (dutch translation issue with view in browser link)</li>
<li>removed _nonce non sense in the visitors subscription forms.</li>

<li>fixed styling issue in subscription form</li>
<li>fixed accents issue in subscription form</li>

<li>fixed warning showing up on some servers configuration when sending a preview of the newsletter</li>
<li>fixed popups in IE8 and improved overall display</li>
<li>fixed openssl_error_string function breaking our settings screen on some configurations.</li>
<li>fixed error with dkim on server without openssl functions</li>
<li>fixed bounce error with the rule unsubscribe user</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1.1 &#8211; 2012-09-02</h4>
<ul>
<li>fixed update 2.1 error : Duplicate column name &#8220;is_public&#8221; may have caused some big slow down on some servers and some auto post to facebook (deepest apologies).</li>
<li>fixed Outlook issue where text blocks would not have the proper width</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.1 &#8211; 2012-08-31</h4>
<ul>
<li>added ability for subscribers to change their email and lists.</li>
<li>added &#8220;View it in your browser&#8221; option.</li>
<li>added advanced access rights with capabilities for subscribers management, newsletter management, settings and subscription widget.</li>
<li>added new WordPress 3.3 plupload used when possible to use.</li>
<li>added mail-tester.com integration for Premium (fight against spam).</li>
<li>added DKIM signature for Premium to improve deliverability.</li>
<li>added the possibility to preview your newsletter without images in visual editor.</li>
<li>added background colors for blocks within the visual editor.</li>
<li>added alternate background colors for automatic latest post widget.</li>
<li>added possibility to add total number of subscribers in widget with shortcode.</li>
<li>added widget option &#8220;Display label within for Email field&#8221;.</li>
<li>improved email rendering and email clients compatibility including the new Outlook 2013</li>
<li>improved image upload with ssl.</li>
<li>improved compatibility with access rights plugins like &#8220;Advanced Access Manager&#8221; or &#8220;User Role Editor&#8221;.</li>
<li>improved import system with clearer message.</li>
<li>improved subscription widget, added security if there is no list selected.</li>
<li>improved Auto newsletter edition, warning added before pausing it.</li>
<li>improved popups for the visual editor (themes, images, add link,&#8230;)</li>
<li>updated TinyMCE to latest version, the editor now reflects the newsletter styles</li>
<li>compatibility with <a href="https://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/magic-action-box/" rel="nofollow">Magic Action Box</a>.</li>
<li>fixed links style in headings.</li>
<li>fixed no default value in optin form when JS disabled.</li>
<li>fixed issue with automatic latest post widget where one article could appear more than once.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.0.9.5 &#8211; 2012-08-15</h4>

<li>fixed firewall 2 avoid troubles with image uploader automatically</li>
<li>fixed problem of confirmation page on some servers when pretty links activated on wysijap post. Default is params link now.</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.0.9 &#8211; 2012-08-03</h4>

<li>improved debug mode with different level for different needs</li>
<li>added logging function to monitor post notification process for instance</li>
<li>improved send immediately post notification (in some case the trigger was not working&#8230; using different WordPress hook now)</li>
<li>fixed post notification interface (step1 and step3) not compatible with WordPress lower than 3.3</li>
<li>fixed issue when duplicating sent post notifications. You should not be able to copy a child email and then change it&#8217;s type like an automatic newsletter etc&#8230;</li>
<li>fixed zip format error when uploading your own theme (this error was happenning on various browsers)</li>
</ul>

Thumbnails Advanced";s:4:"slug";s:30:"regenerate-thumbnails-advanced";s:7:"version";s:7:"1.6.3.2";s:6:"author";s:48:"<a href="https://shortpixel.com/">shortpixel</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:43:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/turcuciprian";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:78;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:11;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:4;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:15;s:15:"support_threads";i:1;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:1;s:10:"downloaded";i:187830;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-09-14 3:26pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2015-07-10";s:8:"homepage";s:23:"http://ciprianturcu.com";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:933:"<p><strong>A free, fast and easy to use regenerate thumbnails plugin supported by ShortPixel 🙂</strong></p>
<p>reGenerate Thumbnails Advanced (RTA) plugin comes in handy when you install a new WordPress theme on your site that has different image sizes. While the newly uploaded images will be cropped and resized to fit your new theme, the old thumbnails will remain unchanged. Using RTA you can regenerate the thumbnails for all your existing images.</p>
<p>Features:</p>
<ul>
<li>Unused thumbs of existing images are removed automatically so you won&#8217;t waste disk space.</li>
<li>Date selection (last day, week, month, all) for the thumbs that will be regenerated.</li>
<li>Clean and simple interface where you have a progress bar showing you the percentage of images regenerated.</li>
<li>You get to see the total number of images affected by your period, as well as the images affected so far when processing</li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:261:"<p>Nothing special about the installation process, just visit &#8220;Plugins&#8221; section in your /wp-admin, search for &#8220;regenerate thumbnails advanced&#8221;, install &amp; activate the plugin and then from Settings section you can start using it.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:577:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<p>Nothing special about the installation process, just visit &#8220;Plugins&#8221; section in your /wp-admin, search for &#8220;regenerate thumbnails advanced&#8221;, install &amp; activate the plugin and then from Settings section you can start using it.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I regenerate just a few images</h4>
<p>
<p>You have the option to select from: all, past day, past week, past month</p>
</p>
<h4>What happens if I close the page and the script is loading?</h4>
<p>
<p>The script stops, it does not run in the background</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:4530:"<h4>0.7</h4>

<p>*Shows errors<br />

ink";s:33:"https://www.paypal.me/resizeImage";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"1x";s:83:"https://ps.w.org/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=1941417";s:2:"2x";s:83:"https://ps.w.org/regenerate-thumbnails-advanced/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1941417";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:9:"languages";s:3:"any";s:8:"category";a:6:{s:7:"gallery";s:11:"recommended";s:4:"blog";s:11:"recommended";s:8:"personal";s:4:"more";s:8:"business";s:4:"more";s:5:"eshop";s:11:"recommended";s:4:"club";s:11:"recommended";}}s:16:"disable-comments";a:29:{s:4:"name";s:16:"Disable Comments";s:4:"slug";s:16:"disable-comments";s:7:"version";s:5:"1.8.0";s:6:"author";s:53:"<a href="http://www.rayofsolaris.net/">Samir Shah</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:43:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/solarissmoke";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.7";s:6:"tested";s:3:"5.0";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:98;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:205;i:4;i:3;i:3;i:2;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:4;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:214;s:15:"support_threads";i:4;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:5619831;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-10-20 3:37am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2011-05-27";s:8:"homepage";s:47:"https://wordpress.org/plugins/disable-comments/";s:8:"sections";a:4:{s:11:"description";s:3220:"<p>This plugin allows administrators to globally disable comments on any post type (posts, pages, attachments, etc.) so that these settings cannot be overridden for individual posts. It also removes all comment-related fields from edit and quick-edit screens. On multisite installations, it can be used to disable comments on the entire network.</p>
<p>Additionally, comment-related items can be removed from the Dashboard, Widgets, the Admin Menu and the Admin Bar.</p>
<p><strong>Important note</strong>: Use this plugin if you don&#8217;t want comments at all on your site (or on certain post types). Don&#8217;t use it if you want to selectively disable comments on individual posts &#8211; WordPress lets you do that anyway. If you don&#8217;t know how to disable comments on individual posts, there are instructions in <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/disable-comments/faq/">the FAQ</a>.</p>
<p>If you come across any bugs or have suggestions, please use the plugin support forum. I can&#8217;t fix it if I don&#8217;t know it&#8217;s broken! Please check the <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/disable-comments/faq/">FAQ</a> for common issues.</p>
<p>Want to contribute? Here&#8217;s the <a href="https://github.com/solarissmoke/disable-comments" rel="nofollow">GitHub development repository</a>.</p>
<p>A <a href="https://github.com/solarissmoke/disable-comments-mu" rel="nofollow">must-use version</a> of the plugin is also available.</p>
<h3>Details</h3>
<p>The plugin provides the option to <strong>completely disable the commenting feature in WordPress</strong>. When this option is selected, the following changes are made:</p>
<ul>
<li>All &#8220;Comments&#8221; links are hidden from the Admin Menu and Admin Bar;</li>
<li>All comment-related sections (&#8220;Recent Comments&#8221;, &#8220;Discussion&#8221; etc.) are hidden from the WordPress Dashboard;</li>
<li>All comment-related widgets are disabled (so your theme cannot use them);</li>
<li>The &#8220;Discussion&#8221; settings page is hidden;</li>
<li>All comment RSS/Atom feeds are disabled (and requests for these will be redirected to the parent post);</li>
<li>The X-Pingback HTTP header is removed from all pages;</li>
<li>Outgoing pingbacks are disabled.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Please delete any existing comments on your site before applying this setting, otherwise (depending on your theme) those comments may still be displayed to visitors. You can use the Delete Comments tool to delete any existing comments on your site.</strong></p>
<h3>Advanced Configuration</h3>
<p>Some of the plugin&#8217;s behaviour can be modified by site administrators and plugin/theme developers through code:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Define <code>DISABLE_COMMENTS_REMOVE_COMMENTS_TEMPLATE</code> and set it to <code>false</code> to prevent the plugin from replacing the theme&#8217;s comment template with an empty one.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Define <code>DISABLE_COMMENTS_ALLOW_DISCUSSION_SETTINGS</code> and set it to <code>true</code> to prevent the plugin from hiding the Discussion settings page.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>These definitions can be made either in your main <code>wp-config.php</code> or in your theme&#8217;s <code>functions.php</code> file.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:398:"<ol>
<li>Upload the plugin folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
<li>The plugin settings can be accessed via the &#8216;Settings&#8217; menu in the administration area (either your site administration for single-site installs, or your network administration for network installs).</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:2077:"
<h4>Nothing happens after I disable comments on all posts &#8211; comment forms still appear when I view my posts.</h4>
<p>
<p>This is because your theme is not checking the comment status of posts in the correct way.</p>
<p>You may like to point your theme&#8217;s author to <a href="http://www.rayofsolaris.net/blog/2012/how-to-check-if-comments-are-allowed-in-wordpress/" rel="nofollow">this explanation</a> of what they are doing wrong, and how to fix it.</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I remove the text that says &#8220;comments are closed&#8221; at the bottom of articles where comments are disabled?</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin tries its very best to hide this (and any other comment-related) messages.</p>
<p>If you still see the message, then it means your theme is overriding this behaviour, and you will have to edit its files manually to remove it. Two common approaches are to either delete or comment out the relevant lines in <code>wp-content/your-theme/comments.php</code>, or to add a declaration to <code>wp-content/your-theme/style.css</code> that hides the message from your visitors. In either case, make you you know what you are doing!</p>
</p>
<h4>I only want to disable comments on certain posts, not globally. What do I do?</h4>
<p>
<p>Don&#8217;t install this plugin!</p>
<p>Go to the edit page for the post you want to disable comments on. Scroll down to the &#8220;Discussion&#8221; box, where you will find the comment options for that post. If you don&#8217;t see a &#8220;Discussion&#8221; box, then click on &#8220;Screen Options&#8221; at the top of your screen, and make sure the &#8220;Discussion&#8221; checkbox is checked.</p>
<p>You can also bulk-edit the comment status of multiple posts from the <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Posts_Screen" rel="nofollow">posts screen</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>I want to delete comments from my database. What do I do?</h4>
<p>
<p>Go to the settings page for the disable comments plugin and utlize the Delete Comments tool to delete all comments or according to the specified post types from your database.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:5292:"<h4>1.8.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added <code>DISABLE_COMMENTS_ALLOW_DISCUSSION_SETTINGS</code> configuration.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Small enhancements to hiding comment-related functionality in the admin.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>Dropped logic to try and hide the comments link from the Meta widget. Administrators should manually add styling to hide this link, or replace the Meta widget with an alternative.</li>
<li>Removed the <code>disable_comments_allow_persistent_mode</code> filter. Define <code>DISABLE_COMMENTS_ALLOW_PERSISTENT_MODE</code> instead.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added a tool for deleting comments in bulk.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix Javascript errors when the Meta widget is enabled.</li>
<li>Hide comments link from the Welcome panel.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Hide existing comments if there are any.</li>
<li>Filter the comments link in the Meta widget if it is enabled.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Remove the comments feed link from the head in WP 4.4 and higher.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.4.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Delay loading of translation text domain until all plugins are loaded. This allows plugins to modify translations.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Hide the troublesome &#8220;persistent mode&#8221; option for all sites where it is not in use. This option will be removed in a future release.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.3.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Compatibility updates and code refactoring for WordPress 4.3</li>
<li>Adding a few new translations</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.3.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Change the behaviour for comment feed requests. This removes a potential security issue.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Move persistent mode filter into a define.</li>
<li>Add an advanced option to show the theme&#8217;s comment template even when comments are disabled.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Allow network administrators to disable comments on custom post types across the whole network.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.1.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix PHP warning when active_sitewide_plugins option doesn&#8217;t contain expected data type.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Attempt to hide the comments template (&#8220;Comments are closed&#8221;) whenever comments are disabled.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix CSRF vulnerability in the admin. Thanks to dxw for responsible disclosure.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Compatibility fix for WordPress 3.8</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Disable comment-reply script for themes that don&#8217;t check comment status properly.</li>
<li>Add French translation</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix issue with settings persistence in single-site installations.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Prevent theme comments template from being displayed when comments are disabled everywhere.</li>
<li>Prevent direct access to comment admin pages when comments are disabled everywhere.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Make persistent mode option filter available all the time.</li>
<li>Fix redirection for feed requests</li>
<li>Fix admin bar filtering in WP 3.6</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Short life in the wild.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.9</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added gettext support and German translation.</li>
<li>Added links to GitHub development repo.</li>
<li>Allow network administrators to prevent the use of persistent mode.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.8</h4>
<ul>
<li>Remove X-Pingback header when comments are completely disabled.</li>
<li>Disable comment feeds when comment are completely disabled.</li>
<li>Simplified settings page.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.7</h4>
<ul>
<li>Now supports Network Activation &#8211; disable comments on your entire multi-site network.</li>
<li>Simplified settings page.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.6</h4>
<ul>
<li>Add &#8220;persistent mode&#8221; to deal with themes that don&#8217;t use filterable comment status checking.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Allow temporary disabling of comments site-wide by ensuring that original comment statuses are not overwritten when a post is edited.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Added the option to disable the Recent Comments template widget.</li>
<li>Bugfix: don&#8217;t show admin messages to users who don&#8217;t can&#8217;t do anything about them.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.3.5</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Other admin menu items could inadvertently be hidden when &#8216;Remove the &#8220;Comments&#8221; link from the Admin Menu&#8217; was selected.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.3.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: A typo on the settings page meant that the submit button went missing on some browsers. Thanks to Wojtek for reporting this.</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.3.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Custom post types which don&#8217;t support comments shouldn&#8217;t appear on the settings page</li>
<li>Add warning notice to Discussion settings when comments are disabled</li>
</ul>
<h4>0.3.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Some dashboard items were incorrectly hidden in multisite</li>

<h4>0.3.1</h4>

</ul>
<h4>0.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Make sure pingbacks are also prevented when comments are disabled.</li>
</ul>

Multisite friendly.";s:13:"download_link";s:59:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.zip";s:11:"screenshots";a:0:{}s:4:"tags";a:3:{s:8:"comments";s:8:"comments";s:7:"disable";s:7:"disable";s:6:"global";s:6:"global";}s:8:"versions";a:16:{s:3:"1.1";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.1.zip";s:5:"1.1.1";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.1.1.zip";s:3:"1.2";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.2.zip";s:3:"1.3";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.3.zip";s:5:"1.3.1";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.3.1.zip";s:5:"1.3.2";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.3.2.zip";s:3:"1.4";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.4.zip";s:5:"1.4.1";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.4.1.zip";s:5:"1.4.2";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.4.2.zip";s:3:"1.5";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.5.zip";s:5:"1.5.1";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.5.1.zip";s:5:"1.5.2";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.5.2.zip";s:3:"1.6";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.6.zip";s:3:"1.7";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.7.zip";s:5:"1.7.1";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.7.1.zip";s:5:"1.8.0";s:65:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/disable-comments.1.8.0.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:35:"http://www.rayofsolaris.net/donate/";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"1x";s:68:"https://ps.w.org/disable-comments/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=971176";s:2:"2x";s:68:"https://ps.w.org/disable-comments/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=971176";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:9:"languages";s:3:"any";s:8:"category";a:1:{s:3:"any";s:4:"more";}s:3:"new";i:1;}s:16:"breadcrumb-navxt";a:29:{s:4:"name";s:16:"Breadcrumb NavXT";s:4:"slug";s:16:"breadcrumb-navxt";s:7:"version";s:5:"6.2.1";s:6:"author";s:42:"<a href="http://mtekk.us/">John Havlik</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:36:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/mtekk";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.7";s:6:"tested";s:5:"5.0.0";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.3";s:6:"rating";i:92;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:95;i:4;i:7;i:3;i:4;i:2;i:2;i:1;i:5;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:113;s:15:"support_threads";i:23;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:4;s:10:"downloaded";i:6617076;s:12:"last_updated";s:22:"2018-10-26 11:18pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2007-12-01";s:8:"homepage";s:38:"http://mtekk.us/code/breadcrumb-navxt/";s:8:"sections";a:4:{s:11:"description";s:2306:"<p>Breadcrumb NavXT, the successor to the popular WordPress plugin Breadcrumb Navigation XT, was written from the ground up to be better than its ancestor. This plugin generates locational breadcrumb trails for your WordPress powered blog or website. These breadcrumb trails are highly customizable to suit the needs of just about any website running WordPress. The Administrative interface makes setting options easy, while a direct class access is available for theme developers and more adventurous users.</p>
<h4>PHP Requirements</h4>
<p>Breadcrumb NavXT 5.2 and newer require PHP5.3<br />
Breadcrumb NavXT 5.1.1 and older require PHP5.2</p>
<h4>Features (non-exhaustive)</h4>
<ul>
<li>RDFa format Schema.org BreadcrumbList compatible breadcrumb generation.</li>
<li>Extensive breadcrumb customization control via a settings page with appropriate default values for most use cases.</li>
<li>Network admin settings page for managing breadcrumb settings for all subsites with <a href="http://mtekk.us/archives/guides/controlling-breadcrumb-navxt-settings-from-the-network-settings-page/" title="Go to the article on configuring the network settings priority." rel="nofollow">configurable global priority</a>.</li>
<li>Built in WordPress Widget.</li>
<li>Extensible via OOP and provided <a href="http://mtekk.us/code/breadcrumb-navxt/breadcrumb-navxt-doc/2/#action_reference" title="Go to the Breadcrumb NavXT Documentation's action reference." rel="nofollow">actions</a> and <a href="http://mtekk.us/code/breadcrumb-navxt/breadcrumb-navxt-doc/2/#filter_reference" title="Go to the Breadcrumb NavXT Documentation's filter reference." rel="nofollow">filters</a>.</li>
<li>WPML compatible (enhanced compatibility with WPML extensions plugin).</li>
<li>Polylang compatible (enhanced compatibility with Polylang extensions plugin).</li>
<li>bbPress compatible (enhanced compatibility with bbPress extensions plugin).</li>
<li>BuddyPress compatible (enhanced compatibility with BuddyPress extensions plugin).</li>
</ul>
<h4>Translations</h4>
<p>Breadcrumb NavXT now supports WordPress.org language packs. Want to translate Breadcrumb NavXT? Visit <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/breadcrumb-navxt/" rel="nofollow">Breadcrumb NavXT&#8217;s WordPress.org translation project</a>.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:928:"<p>Breadcrumb NavXT can be installed from within WordPress’ administration panel. After installing and activating the plugin, to get breadcrumb trails to display either use the included widget, or call the breadcrumb trail in your theme (or child theme). See the <a href="http://mtekk.us/archives/guides/calling-the-breadcrumb-trail" title="Read more on calling the breadcrumb trail" rel="nofollow">Calling the Breadcrumb Trail</a> article for more information on calling the breadcrumb trail.</p>
<p>To customize the breadcrumb trail you may edit the default values for the options in the administrative interface. This is located in your administration panel under Settings &gt; Breadcrumb NavXT.</p>
<p>Please visit <a href="http://mtekk.us/code/breadcrumb-navxt/breadcrumb-navxt-doc/" title="Go to Breadcrumb NavXT's Documentation." rel="nofollow">Breadcrumb NavXT&#8217;s Documentation</a> page for more information.</p>
";s:9:"changelog";s:5821:"<h4>6.2.1</h4>
<p>Release date: October, 26th 2018</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior change: Added <code>span</code> element wrapping the breadcrumb title in the default unlinked breadcrumb template.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue that caused PHP warnings and “the following settings were not saved” messages for hierarchical CPTs.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.2.0</h4>
<p>Release date: September, 24th 2018</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior change: Cleaned up translations for default templates, simplifying and clarifying the translatable content.</li>
<li>Behavior change: Default unlinked breadcrumb templates no longer contain Schema.org BreadcrumbList markup.</li>
<li>Behavior change: Breadcrumb NavXT REST API endpoints are no longer enabled by default.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_register_rest_endpoint</code> filter.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_breadcrumb_assemble_json_ld_array</code> filter.</li>
<li>New feature: Added support for following the post parent hierarchy first then falling back to a secondary hierarchy.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where on loading the settings page immediately after migrating settings causes PHP warnings on CPT and custom taxonomy settings.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue that caused the settings reset option under the help drop down to not work.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.1.0</h4>
<p>Release date: June, 1st 2018</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior change: Links to generate support requests migrated to the WordPress.org forums.</li>
<li>New feature: Added support for Schema.org BreadcrumbList (microdata format) in the included widget.</li>
<li>New feature: Added new Root Page support for author archives.</li>
<li>New feature: Added REST API endpoint for posts, terms, and author archives.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Corrected label for the Schema.org BreadcrumbList (RDFa format) option in the included widget.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where a PHP warning would be thrown due to <code>get_term()</code> returning something other than an instance of <code>WP_Term</code>.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.4</h4>
<p>Release date: January, 26th 2018</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior change: Added auto migration of post type hierarchy settings to <code>bcn_display*()</code> functions.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where a PHP notice would be generated on the page for posts when the blog breadcrumb display option is set to false.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where a PHP notice would be generated on archive pages where attachments were included in the <code>wp_query</code> results.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.3</h4>
<p>Release date: January, 1st 2018</p>
<ul>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where an improper breadcrumb would be generated in the trail for pages under some circumstances.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the post and page roots were not updating to track user changes in Settings &gt; Reading.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.2</h4>
<p>Release date: December, 30th 2017</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior change: Added warning alerting that <code>bcn_breadcrumb::type</code> must be an array.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Changed Breadcrumb Separator and Paged Template from an input field to a textbox to reduce confusion caused by HTML entities.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the parents of a page may not show up in the breadcrumb trail.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the <code>$reverse</code> parameter for <code>bcn_display</code> and <code>bcn_display_list</code> did not work properly.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the <code>bcn_display_list</code> function did not include the <code>li</code> elements.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.1</h4>
<p>Release date: December, 28th 2017</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior change: Removed unused Blog Template and Blog Template (Unlinked) from settings page.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where changes to the hierarchy type for any post type would not save.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed issue where the blog display setting was ignored.</li>
</ul>
<h4>6.0.0</h4>
<p>Release date: December, 26th 2017</p>
<ul>
<li>Behavior change: <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::display_list()</code> deprecated in favor of using the <code>$template</code> parameter in <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::display()</code>.</li>
<li>Behavior change: <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_attachment()</code> deprecated in favor of calling <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_post()</code>.</li>
<li>Behavior change: <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_front_page()</code> deprecated in favor of calling <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_home()</code>.</li>
<li>Behavior change: <code>bcn_li_attributes</code> filter was deprecated in favor of <code>bcn_display_attributes</code>.</li>
<li>Behavior change: <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_archive_by_date()</code> deprecated in favor of calling bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_day()<code>,</code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_month()<code>, and/or</code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::do_year()`.</li>
<li>Behavior change: <code>bcn_breadcrumb_trail::find_type()</code> deprecated and removed from bcn_breadcrumb_trail.</li>
<li>Behavior change: Breadcrumb for 404 error pages changed to be a child of the front page.</li>
<li>New feature: Added support for various HTML tags in the widget&#8217;s pretext field.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_default_hierarchy_display</code> filter.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>bcn_default_hierarchy_type</code> filter.</li>
<li>New feature: Added <code>$posttype_name</code> as the third parameter to <code>bcn_show_tax_private</code>.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed UI/UX issue in the settings screen where enabling/disabling settings groups for the Home, Blog, and Mainsite breadcrumb settings did not work.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Fixed UI/UX issue in the settings screen where not including the paged breadcrumb still allowed the paged breadcrumb template to be edited.</li>
<li>Bug fix: Removed use of <code>create_function</code> in registering the widget as it was deprecated in PHP 7.2.</li>
</ul>

:"new";i:1;}s:19:"the-events-calendar";a:29:{s:4:"name";s:19:"The Events Calendar";s:4:"slug";s:19:"the-events-calendar";s:7:"version";s:6:"4.6.25";s:6:"author";s:51:"<a href="http://m.tri.be/1x">Modern Tribe, Inc.</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:42:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/moderntribe";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.5";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";s:5:"5.2.4";s:6:"rating";i:90;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:1285;i:4;i:87;i:3;i:53;i:2;i:41;i:1;i:125;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:1591;s:15:"support_threads";i:228;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:99;s:10:"downloaded";i:13656244;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-10-22 3:40pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2010-01-19";s:8:"homepage";s:0:"";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:10200:"<p>Create an events calendar and manage it with ease. The Events Calendar plugin provides professional-level quality and features backed by a team you can trust.</p>
<p>Packed with loads of useful features, The Events Calendar by Modern Tribe is ready to go right out of the box. It’s extensible, easy to use, and completely customizable.</p>
<p>Just getting started? Read through the <a href="http://m.tri.be/2d" rel="nofollow">New User Primer</a> to get set up.</p>
<p>Looking for additional functionality including recurring events, ticket sales, publicly submitted events, automatic imports, and more?</p>
<p><strong>Check out <a href="http://m.tri.be/mj" rel="nofollow">Events Calendar PRO</a> and <a href="http://m.tri.be/2a" rel="nofollow">other add-ons</a></strong></p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>New Import Tool!</strong><br />
  We’ve made bulk event imports easier to manage than ever. This add-on service for The Events Calendar allows you to import events from your favorite sources, including Meetup, Google Calendar, iCalendar, CSV, ICS and Other URLs (beta).<br />
  <a href="http://m.tri.be/197u" rel="nofollow">Check out Event Aggregator now</a>.</p>
</blockquote>
<h4>Built solid &amp; supported</h4>
<p>The Events Calendar is crafted the WordPress way with hours of strategy, design, development, and testing going into each release. We stand behind our work and offer light support weekly for the community via the WordPress.org support forums.</p>
<p>If you need a deeper level of support or a faster response to your specific question, our Events Calendar PRO add-on includes access to our premium support forums with a 24-48 hour response time during the workweek.</p>
<p>Enjoy using The Events Calendar, know how to customize it, and want to make money helping people? We’re growing our community team and would love to hear from you. If you’re interested, <a href="http://m.tri.be/mk" rel="nofollow">check this out!</a></p>
<h4>Plug-n-play &amp; highly customizable</h4>
<p>The Events Calendar is built to work out of the box. Just turn it on, configure the settings to match your needs and you&#8217;ll be making events in less than 5 minutes.</p>
<p>By developers, for developers&#8230; it&#8217;s ready to be the foundation for your wildest hack sessions. Complete with a skeleton stylesheet to theme fast and efficiently, loads of tools including partial template overrides, a host of template tags, hooks and filters, <a href="http://m.tri.be/eu" rel="nofollow">careful documentation</a>, as well as a <a href="http://m.tri.be/ext" rel="nofollow">library of free extensions</a>. The Events Calendar is built FOR people who build websites.</p>
<p>Whether your vision is big or small, you’re in good company. Hundreds of thousands of churches, eateries, small businesses, musicians, venues, and non-profits are publishing and promoting their events with The Events Calendar.</p>
<p>The Events Calendar has been scaled to work on networks with over 25 million unique visitors per month and hundreds of thousands of events. Fortune 100 companies, major universities, government institutions, and some seriously epic startups showcase their events with our platform.</p>
<h4>Features</h4>
<p>Whether you’re operating a hyperlocal hub listing thousands of events, a university with many thousands of users, or you’re a sole business owner listing your classes, The Events Calendar has your back.</p>
<ul>
<li>Rapidly create events</li>
<li>Saved venues &amp; organizers</li>
<li>Calendar month view with tooltips</li>
<li>Event List view</li>
<li>Day view</li>
<li>Event search</li>
<li>Google maps</li>
<li>Widget: Upcoming events list</li>
<li>Events Taxonomies (Categories &amp; Tags)</li>
<li>Google Calendar and iCal exporting</li>
<li>WP REST API endpoints</li>
<li>Completely ajaxified for super smooth browsing</li>
<li>Completely responsive from mobile to tablet to desktop</li>
<li>Tested on the major theme frameworks such as Avada, Genesis, Woo Themes, Thesis and many more.</li>
<li>Increase your SEO with Microformats</li>
<li>Internationalized &amp; translated</li>
<li>Multiple stylesheets to improve integration</li>
<li>Extensive template tags for customization</li>
<li>Hooks &amp; filters galore</li>
<li>Caching support</li>
<li>Debug mode for developers</li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/1a0r" rel="nofollow">Library of extensions</a></li>
</ul>
<h4>Submitting Patches</h4>
<p>If you’ve identified a bug and have a fix, we’d welcome it at our <a href="https://github.com/moderntribe/the-events-calendar" rel="nofollow">GitHub page for The Events Calendar</a>. Simply submit a pull request so we can review as part of our <a href="http://m.tri.be/release-schedule" rel="nofollow">release cycle</a> and merge into the codebase if appropriate from there. If a pull request is rejected, we&#8217;ll do our best to tell you why. Users whose pull requests are accepted will receive credit in the plugin&#8217;s changelog. For more information, check out the readme at our GitHub page. Happy coding!</p>
<h3>Documentation</h3>
<p>All of our online documentation can be found on <a href="http://m.tri.be/eu" rel="nofollow">our documentation site</a>.</p>
<p>Some links you may find particularly useful are:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2l" rel="nofollow">The Events Calendar New User Primer</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2m" rel="nofollow">The Themer&#8217;s Guide to The Events Calendar</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/18wm" rel="nofollow">Knowledgebase</a></li>
</ul>
<p>If you have any questions about this plugin, you can post a thread in our <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/the-events-calendar" rel="nofollow">WordPress.org forum</a>. Please search existing threads before opening a new one.</p>
<p>The <a href="http://m.tri.be/2r" rel="nofollow">Modern Tribe premium support forums</a> are available for you to read. You won&#8217;t, however, be able to post a message in any forums beyond Pre-Sale Questions unless you have purchased a premium license.</p>
<h3>Add-Ons</h3>
<p>But wait: there&#8217;s more! We&#8217;ve got a whole stable of plugins available to help you be awesome at what you do. Check out a full list of the products below, and over on <a href="http://m.tri.be/18wn" rel="nofollow">our website</a>.</p>
<p>Our Free Plugins:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/event-tickets/">Event Tickets</a></li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/advanced-post-manager/">Advanced Post Manager</a></li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/gigpress/">GigPress</a></li>
<li><a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/image-widget/">Image Widget</a></li>
</ul>
<p>Our Premium Plugins and Services:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/18wi" rel="nofollow">Events Calendar PRO</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/197u" rel="nofollow">Event Aggregator</a> (service)</li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/18wk" rel="nofollow">Event Tickets Plus</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2g" rel="nofollow">Community Events</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/18wl" rel="nofollow">Community Tickets</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/fa" rel="nofollow">Filter Bar</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2e" rel="nofollow">Eventbrite Tickets</a></li>
</ul>
<h3>Help</h3>
<p>Welcome to The Events Calendar, a full-featured events management system for WordPress. Thank you so much for using the labor of our love. We are Modern Tribe and we are here to help you be awesome.</p>
<p>If you aren&#8217;t familiar with The Events Calendar, check out our <a href="http://m.tri.be/2p" rel="nofollow">new user primer</a>. It&#8217;ll introduce you to the basics of what the plugin has to offer and will have you creating events in no time. From there, the resources below &#8212; extensive template tag documentation, FAQs, video walkthroughs and more &#8212; will give you a leg up as you dig deeper.</p>
<p>Additional resources available include:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://theeventscalendar.com/release-schedule/" rel="nofollow">Release Schedule</a></li>
<li><a href="https://theeventscalendar.com/known-issues/" rel="nofollow">Known Issues</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/eu" rel="nofollow">Documentation</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2n" rel="nofollow">FAQ</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2t" rel="nofollow">Help Videos</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2u" rel="nofollow">Tutorials</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2v" rel="nofollow">Release Notes</a></li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2r" rel="nofollow">Forums</a></li>
</ul>
<p>We hit the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/the-events-calendar/" rel="nofollow">The Events Calendar forum here on WordPress.org</a> about once a week, assisting users with basic troubleshooting and identifying bugs that have been reported. (If you are looking for more active support, might we suggest buying a PRO license? Our team hits the <a href="http://m.tri.be/2r" rel="nofollow">Premium Forums</a> daily.)</p>
<p>Some things to consider before posting on the forum:</p>
<ul>
<li>Look through existing threads before posting a new one and check that there isn&#8217;t already a discussion going on for your issue.</li>
<li>Your issue will be solved more quickly if you run a few checks before making a support request. Deactivate your plugins one by one &#8211; if the issue is fixed by deactivating a plugin you know you&#8217;ve got a plugin conflict. To test your Theme, revert to the default Twenty Twelve Theme to see if you are still experiencing the problem. If not, your Theme is the issue. Please provide this information when making your support request.</li>
<li>Sometimes, just resetting your permalinks can fix the issue. Visit Events -&gt; Settings -&gt; Permalinks, save your permalinks with a different option and then save with your preferred choice again. This can solve events-related problems and is worth a shot before creating a new thread.</li>
</ul>
<p>Still not happy? Shoot us an email to support@theeventscalendar.com or tweet to <a href="https://twitter.com/TheEventsCal" rel="nofollow">@TheEventsCal</a> and tell us why. We&#8217;ll do what we can to make it right.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:999:"<h4>Install &amp; Activate</h4>
<p>Installing the plugin is easy. Just follow these steps:</p>
<ol>
<li>From the dashboard of your site, navigate to Plugins &#8211;&gt; Add New.</li>
<li>Select the Upload option and hit &#8220;Choose File.&#8221;</li>
<li>When the popup appears select the the-events-calendar-x.x.zip file from your desktop. (The &#8216;x.x&#8217; will change depending on the current version number).</li>
<li>Follow the on-screen instructions and wait as the upload completes.</li>
<li>When it&#8217;s finished, activate the plugin via the prompt. A message will show confirming activation was successful. A link to access the calendar directly on the frontend will be presented here as well.</li>
</ol>
<p>That&#8217;s it! Just configure your settings as you see fit, and you&#8217;re on your way to creating events in style. Need help getting things started? Check out our <a href="http://m.tri.be/2l" rel="nofollow">new user primer</a> for help with settings and features.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:5576:"
<h4>Are there any troubleshooting steps you&#8217;d suggest I try that might resolve my issue before I post a new thread?</h4>
<p>
<p>First, make sure that you&#8217;re running the latest version of The Events Calendar (4.6 as of this release). If you&#8217;re running Events Calendar PRO it needs to match the version number of The Events Calendar. And if you&#8217;ve got any other add-ons, make sure those are current / running the latest code as well.</p>
<p>The most common issues we see are either plugin or theme conflicts. You can test if a plugin or theme is conflicting by manually deactivating other plugins until just The Events Calendar is running on your site. If the issue persists from there, revert to the default Twenty Fourteen theme. If the issue is resolved after deactivating a specific plugin or your theme, you&#8217;ll know that is the source of the conflict.</p>
<p>Note that we aren&#8217;t going to say &#8220;tough luck&#8221; if you identify a plugin/theme conflict. While we can&#8217;t guarantee 100% integration with any plugin or theme out there, we will do our best (and reach out the plugin/theme author as needed) to figure out a solution that benefits everyone.</p>
</p>
<h4>I&#8217;m still stuck. Where do I go to file a bug or ask a question?</h4>
<p>
<p>Users of the free The Events Calendar should post their questions in the plugin&#8217;s <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/the-events-calendar/" rel="nofollow">WordPress.org forum</a>, which we hit about once a week (usually on Wednesdays). Please make sure to read <a href="http://m.tri.be/19oc" rel="nofollow">our sticky post</a> providing an overview of the support we provide free users BEFORE posting. If you find you&#8217;re not getting support in as timely a fashion as you wish, you might want to consider purchasing a PRO license.</p>
<p>If you&#8217;re already a PRO user, you&#8217;re entitled access to our more actively-monitored <a href="http://m.tri.be/2r" rel="nofollow">Events Calendar PRO forum</a> on our website. We can provide a deeper level of support here and hit these forums on a daily basis during the work week. Generally, except in times of increased support loads, we reply to all comments within 24-48 hours during the business week.</p>
</p>
<h4>Events Calendar PRO looks awesome! I&#8217;m sold! How can I get my hands on it?</h4>
<p>
<p>Events Calendar PRO can be purchased directly on <a href="http://m.tri.be/18wi" rel="nofollow">our website</a>. There are five (5) license types available, and all licenses include access to premium support, new feature releases, and regular maintenance updates.</p>
</p>
<h4>I&#8217;m interested in PRO or another add-on, but there are a few questions I&#8217;ve got before making the purchase. Can you help me get those addressed?</h4>
<p>
<p>Absolutely. If you&#8217;re not finding your questions answered on the product pages, hit up our <a href="http://m.tri.be/2w" rel="nofollow">pre-sales forum</a> on our site. You can save yourself some time by reviewing the threads first to verify if your question has already been asked. If it hasn&#8217;t, post a new thread as a guest. We&#8217;ll get you a reply as quickly as we can, so you can make an informed decision regarding purchase.</p>
</p>
<h4>What add-ons are available for The Events Calendar, and where can I read more about them?</h4>
<p>
<p>The following add-ons are available for The Events Calendar:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/18wi" rel="nofollow">Events Calendar PRO</a>, for adding premium calendar features like recurring events, advanced views, cool widgets, shortcodes, additional fields, and more!</li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/197u" rel="nofollow">Event Aggregator</a>, a service that effortlessly fills your calendar with events from Meetup, Google Calendar, iCalendar, Eventbrite, CSV, and ICS.</li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/18wj" rel="nofollow">Event Tickets</a> (free), which allows you to collect RSVPs to events. It can run alongside The Events Calendar or as a standalone plugin that adds RSVP functionality to WordPress posts and pages.</li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/18wk" rel="nofollow">Event Tickets Plus</a>, which allows you to sell tickets for your events using your favorite e-commerce platform.</li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2g" rel="nofollow">Community Events</a>, for allowing frontend event submission from your readers.</li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/18wl" rel="nofollow">Community Tickets</a>, which allows event organizers to sell tickets to the events they submit via Community Events.</li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/fa" rel="nofollow">Filter Bar</a>, for adding advanced frontend filtering capabilities to your events calendar.</li>
<li><a href="http://m.tri.be/2e" rel="nofollow">Eventbrite Tickets</a>, for selling tickets to your event directly through Eventbrite.</li>
</ul>
</p>
<h4>I have a feature idea. What&#8217;s the best way to tell you about it?</h4>
<p>
<p>We&#8217;ve got a <a href="https://tribe.uservoice.com/forums/195723-feature-ideas" rel="nofollow">UserVoice page</a> where we&#8217;re actively watching for feature ideas from the community. Vote up existing feature requests or add your own, and help us shape the future of the products business in a way that best meets the community&#8217;s needs.</p>
</p>
<h4>I&#8217;ve still got questions. Where can I find answers?</h4>
<p>
<p>Check out our extensive <a href="http://m.tri.be/18wm" rel="nofollow">knowledgebase</a> for articles on using, tweaking, and troubleshooting our plugins.</p>
</p>

<li>Fix &#8211; Ensure that the <code>tribe-events-bar-should-show</code> filter functions as aspected; if <code>__return_false</code> is passed, the Tribe Bar will be totally hidden (thanks @debranettles for reporting this!) [112260]</li>

<h4>[4.6.22] 2018-08-22</h4>
<ul>
<li>Add &#8211; Allow filtering events, in REST API requests, by their post ID with <code>include</code> [94326]</li>
<li>Add &#8211; Enable future event display to get all events in the future that have not started [70769]</li>
<li>Add &#8211; Allow filtering events, in REST API requests, by their post ID with <code>include</code> [94326]</li>
<li>Add &#8211; Enable future event display to get all events in the future that have not started [70769]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevent subsequent CSV imports from duplicating events in some instances [102745]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; The &#8220;Import events but preserve local changes to event fields&#8221; Event Aggregator change authority setting will now behave as expected [87443]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Multiple fixes regarding linked post types (e.g. Organizers and custom post types) &#8211; props to @natureslens and others for reporting these [105116]:
<ul>
<li>Now correctly saves in their drag-and-drop order</li>
<li>Deprecated the functions added in version 4.6.13 that previously attempted to fix ordering logic but was not done in a backwards-compatible way: <code>get_order_meta_key()</code> and <code>tribe_sanitize_organizers()</code></li>
<li>We no longer rely on a separate postmeta value dedicated to ordering linked posts (e.g. <code>_EventOrganizerID_Order</code>), and you may want to remove all such values from your database after re-saving any events that have linked posts and their ordering is important</li>
<li><code>tribe_get_linked_posts_by_post_type()</code> now works as expected, no longer returning zero results in error, nor returning all of the post type&#8217;s posts if there are none linked. The <code>tribe_events_return_all_linked_posts_if_none</code> filter was added, as it is necessary for this fix.</li>
<li>Editing an existing event no longer loses the linked posts just because they were not part of the submission. Example of the bug in prior versions: If organizers are editable in the wp-admin event edit screen but not on the Community Events &#8220;event edit&#8221; form (via template override or other custom code), all pre-existing organizers were removed in error.</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Handle the case where Event Aggregator import queues might get stuck when deleting import records [111856]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Only show admin notice when it is a top-level page with the event slug, thanks to MikeNGarrett for the code fix! [111186]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Change template_redirect to an action for some legacy view redirects, thanks barryceelen! [110463]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Correctly import and set Organizers for iCal and ICS files Event Aggregator imports [96059]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Retain category title in month view and month view shortcode, thanks corthoover for the first report [108258]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; The &#8220;Import events but preserve local changes to event fields&#8221; Event Aggregator change authority setting will now behave as expected [87443]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Handle the case where Event Aggregator import queues might get stuck when deleting import records [111856]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevent subsequent CSV imports from duplicating events in some instances [102745]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fix the classic header option not working. Thanks @hanemac, David Luyendyk and others for flagging this! [111672]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Namespace javascript debug function to prevent conflicts causing a function found, thanks to Tom-Mulvey for the fix [110462]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add venue name to address string for iCal and gCal export, thanks for the coding from sylviavanos [110464]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211;  Drop the order from the query WPML linked query as it is set later in the method, thanks to dgwatkins for the PR [110459]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Display JS debug messages only if setting is set or through the <code>tribe_events_js_debug</code> filter. Thanks to Rob, @aand and others for flagging this! [82781]</li>
</ul>

<h4>[4.6.20.1] 2018-07-10</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fix an issue where Event Aggregator imports might get blocked at 1% progress [110258]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fix the error displayed when navigating the month view via shortcode. Thanks Lam, @ltcalendar, Disk and others for flagging this! [109589]</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.6.20] 2018-07-09</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add featured event column support for CLI imports [108027]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Display the exact search term in the &#8220;no results&#8221; notice on the events page [106991]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Allow venue and organizer fields to be intentionally empty on Event Singular REST API calls [109482]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Added basic checks to prevent saving obviously-invalid event meta values, such as sending <code>EventStartMinute</code> of <code>60</code> (since it should be 0-59) to <code>tribe_create_event()</code>. This prevents falling back to &#8220;zero&#8221; values (e.g. Unix Epoch) when another value was intended. Thanks to @compton-bob for flagging this via our Help Desk. [109722]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Add Privacy Policy guide for The Events Calendar [108454]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added event ID parameter to <code>tribe_events_event_classes</code> filter to make it more useful [64807]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added the <code>tribe_aggregator_record_finalized</code> action to allow developers to act before Event Aggregator imports start [109938]</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.6.19] 2018-06-20</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; CSV importer now supports a featured event column [72376]</li>
<li>Add &#8211; Add Eventbrite Icon to Third Party Accounts on the help page [105388]</li>
<li>Add &#8211; Accessibility repair: new title-bar template for loop views included above the filter bar and content containing the page title in a <code>h1</code> tag.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Accessibility repair: adjust main content container element from <code>div</code> to <code>main</code>.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; More robust handling of errors and exceptions during Event Aggregator imports [107929]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Ensure that the &#8220;Export Events&#8221; button is properly displayed in month view when paginating. Thanks to @linpleva, Steven, Will and others for flagging this! [104751]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Month view pagination for datepicker formats: YYYY.MM.DD, MM.DD.YYYY, and DD.MM.YYYY. Thanks @netzwerk, @wdburgdorf, @oliverwick and others for notifying us! [105443]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved customizer inconsistencies with month/week views and full styles [69758]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Check the Events Aggregator license each time the page is accessed [67864]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Improve Event Import message responses from Event Aggregator for certain cases where &#8220;Unknown service message&#8221; would be returned [107606]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Make the date picker respect the &#8220;Start of the week&#8221; Setting. Thanks to @websource, @dsb and others for flagging this! [76320]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Correct the &#8220;View All&#8221; link when using the events month view and plain permalinks. props to Kay and Robert for notifying us [72544]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Keep filter bar date when changing from month to list view, with all datepicker formats. Thanks to Caio for reporting this! [83018]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Correct the pagination in list view when a keyword is being searched. Thanks to @versi, @akr and Mary for reporting this! [94613]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Split linked posts (Organizers and Venues) by ownership, for all users [71349]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; The connected status for Eventbrite under Third Party Accounts on the Help page [106868]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed two PHP 5.2 errors on the Events &gt; Help page [108338]</li>

<li>Tweak &#8211; Added classes to meta output in Single Event meta templates to facilitate customization [62704]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add the <code>tribe_aggregator_async_insert_event</code> filter to allow overriding the Event Aggregator asynchronous event insertion [107929]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add the <code>'tribe_aggregator_async_import_event_task</code> filter to allow overriding the Event Aggregator asynchronous import task [107929]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added venue google map link to events in Day view [91610]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Renamed the Time zone mode option &#8220;Use the local time zones for each event&#8221; to &#8220;Use manual timezones for each event&#8221; (thanks @hikeitbaby for the suggestion) [67148]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Accessibility repair: heading hierarchy improvements throughout.</li>

<h4>[4.6.14] 2018-04-18</h4>
<ul>

<li>Fix &#8211; Hid the filters in the Tribe Bar if a unique view is enabled [75114]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed some imported-event handling so that events with no time and that aren&#8217;t all-day events do not display on the front-end [93979]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Changed the HTTP status codes of empty event, venue, organizer, category, and tag archives from 404 to 200 and return empty arrays to stick with WP REST API standard [102283]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Better &#8220;guessing&#8221; on column mapping during the import of CSV file (thanks to April in our Help Desk for flagging this problem!) [96162]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Add new <code>tribe_events_linked_post_type_meta_key</code> filter, required to be set for each custom linked post type, to output custom linked post types in their drag-and-drop order (thanks @natureslens for highlighting the issue) [100733]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added the <code>tribe_aggregator_find_matching_organizer</code> and <code>tribe_aggregator_find_matching_venue</code> filters in Events Aggregator to allow the definition of custom Venue and Organizer match criteria [97292]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Display the retry time for a failed Event Aggregator scheduled import in the Scheduled tab [102489]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add new filter, <code>tribe_events_import_event_duplicate_matches</code>, to determine if an event is part of the duplicates matches [77956]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Ensure &#8220;secondary&#8221; maps, e.g. in the sidebar, have the same full-width behavior as &#8220;main&#8221; maps [74052]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Restore some missing header navigation elements [99742]</li>

<li>Tweak &#8211; Added new REST API endpoint that allows looking up organizers by slug instead of ID at the path <code>organizers/by-slug/{slug}/</code>, it has the same functionality as the endpoint <code>organizers/{ID}</code> [96088]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added new REST API endpoint that allows looking up venues by slug instead of ID at the path <code>venues/by-slug/{slug}/</code>, it has the same functionality as the endpoint <code>venues/{ID}</code> [96088]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added <code>slug</code> to the REST API responses for organizer and venue data [96088]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added <code>slug</code> to the REST API parameters allowed to use when inserting or updating an organizer or event [96088]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added action: <code>tribe_events_venue_save</code> [96069]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added action: <code>tribe_events_organizer_save</code> [96069]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added filter: <code>tribe_events_rest_venue_prepare_postarr</code> [96069]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added filter: <code>tribe_events_rest_organizer_prepare_postarr</code> [96069]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Old <code>tribe_rest_venue_data</code> filter was passing the venue and the event two the second parameter because of the duplication. Now it has the second parameter as $venue, third parameter as $event if event ID was provided [96090]</li>
<li>Language &#8211; 5 new strings added, 30 updated, 0 fuzzied, and 0 obsoleted</li>

<li>Tweak &#8211; Added Google Maps API key to all Google Maps URLs when the key is available, allowing maps to load more reliably on some hosting environments (props to @sfdfortnight, @thor, and many others for reporting this!) [62910]</li>
