<li>Tweak &#8211; Added new REST API endpoint that allows looking up events by slug instead of ID at the path <code>events/by-slug/{slug}/</code>, it has the same functionality as the endpoint <code>events/{ID}</code> [92825]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added <code>slug</code> to the REST API responses for event data [92825]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added <code>slug</code> to the REST API parameters allowed to use when inserting or updating an event [92825]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added new <code>tribe_events_rest_use_inclusive_start_end_dates</code> filter so that users can make the REST API return events from a more literal date range [90005]</li>

</ul>

<h4>[4.6.5] 2017-11-16</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Improved legacy URL redirect logic to prevent unwanted redirects (our thanks to wesleyanhq and Adam Schwartz for highlighting this issue) [86942]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Modified tribe_get_template_part() to remove potential for multiple templates to be rendered in a single call [46630]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed an issue where Event Aggregator scheduled imports might remain stuck in pending status [90501, 92614, 91754]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Removed code which was automatically populating various address fields with default values when creating a new venue from within the event editor [44732]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved some issues with the &#8220;Show Map&#8221; and &#8220;Show Map Link&#8221; options in CSV files not being reliably respected on import (props @joappf and many others for highlighting this issue) [82784]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Added opportunities to override edit linked post links [89015]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed a bug where only some parts of event featured images were clickable in List Views (thanks @mattemkadia for highlighting this issue) [81392]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed the broken &#8216;Learn more&#8217; URL received after an unsuccessful &#8220;Other URL&#8221; import preview [92890]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed issue in list view navigation with backwards previous/next classes (thanks @secondtoughest) [36230]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed an issue where venues and organizers would not be correctly assigned to events in CSV imports with import statuses other than &#8220;Publish&#8221; [79680]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Remove net import scheduled notes for on domand imports [79079]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Allow for non-Latin characters to be used as the Events URL slug and the Single Event URL slug (thanks @daviddweb for originally reporting this) [61880]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Remove net import scheduled notes for on domand imports [79079]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Fixed some layout issues that would emerge with &#8220;Events URL Slug&#8221; option when &#8220;Plain&#8221; permalinks were enabled [92314]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tweaked some language in Event Aggregator&#8217;s metabox on individual edit-event screens to reduce confusion around the impact of the Update Authority on CSV imports [77957]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Fix PHP 7.1 compatibility with Event Aggregator (props @BJP NEALE) [90002]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added new filter: <code>tribe_events_force_filtered_ical_link</code>. This makes the &#8220;Export Events&#8221; URL more easily modifiable (thanks to @tdudley07 for highlighting this issue) [43908]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Made the &#8220;End of Day Cutoff&#8221; option better accommodate 24-hour and other time formats (thanks @festivalgeneral for bringing this issue to our attention!) [78621]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Made the options presented by the timezone selector filterable (via the newly added <code>tribe_events_timezone_choice</code> hook &#8211; our thanks to National University&#8217;s Marketing Department for this idea) [92909]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved integration with Twenty Seventeen &#8211; main events page now uses full height header when set to front page (thanks @uncovery for pointing this out) [89767]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Ensured REST API taxonomy endpoints are only registered in WordPress versions 4.7 and higher (thanks @dnaber-de for reporting this) [93227]</li>
<li>Language &#8211; 1 new strings added, 132 updated, 0 fuzzied, and 1 obsoleted</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.6.4] 2017-11-09</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Timepicker is now part of Tribe Common, it was removed from The Events Calendar</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Required changes to make the plugin compatible with version 4.6 of Event Tickets</li>
<li>Language &#8211; 10 new strings added, 167 updated, 0 fuzzied, and 2 obsoleted</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.6.3] 2017-11-02</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevent JS error when adding a Pro widget in the WP Customizer screen [72127]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed issue where the value of an event&#8217;s &#8220;Show Google Maps Link&#8221; option would not properly affect the displaying of the link on List View (props: @etechnologie) [75547]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Added some more specification to our jquery-ui-datepicker CSS to limit conflicts with other plugins and themes [90577]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Improve shortcode pagination/view change url so it is reusable (props: @der.chef and others) [70021]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Ensure the <code>tribe_json_ld_{type}_object</code> filter is available to make modifications of event, venue and organizer JSON LD data possible (thanks to Mathew for flagging this problem) [89801]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Improved JSON LD output for events by outputting the correct UTC offset where required (our thanks to Nina and many others for flagging this issue) [78233]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Fixed some display issues for the event schedule details (props @mia-caro)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved the clarity of and amount of context for some linked post labels to make translation of those labels a little easier and more nuanced (props @hnacc and others) [88589]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Changed the order in which the list view &#8220;next events&#8221; link is assembled for better translatability (with thanks to @alelouya for highlighting this problem) [72097]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adjusted linked posts selector HTML to improve compatibility with Batcache [92049]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved datepicker handling so an end date on or later than the start date can always be selected [89825]</li>
<li>Language &#8211; 0 new strings added, 7 updated, 0 fuzzied, and 0 obsoleted</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.6.2] 2017-10-18</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Restored functionality to the &#8220;currency position&#8221; options in Events Settings, and in the per-event cost settings (props @schola and many others!) [89918]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed issue in Month view with multi-month events not appearing on subsequent months (thanks @shinno.kei &amp; @schittly for helping isolate this) [89747]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Made some changes to prevent Month View caching from breaking WPML support when in Month View (props: @mpike and many others!) [82286]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed start/end times being displayed in incorrect timezone in structured data (thanks @mtncreative &amp; @esosa) [42125]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed an issue that would cause a 404 error if the selected default view was not enabled (thanks @pruneau) [45612]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Improved translatability by adding missing textdomains for a number of strings (props @pedro-mendonca) [91071]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Removed unneeded escaping to ensure the organizer link displays as expected (pros @f4w-pwharton) [91074]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improvements to the readme.txt file surrounding plugin requirements (thanks @ramiy) [90285]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improve site identification in multisite installations using Event Aggregator to avoid throttling issues [90489]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Avoid notice level errors when a non-existent category archive is requested (our thanks to Charles Simmons for highlighting this) [90697]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added a new filter <code>tribe_events_ical_single_event_links</code> to make customizing the iCal and gCal export links on single-event views easier [90705]</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.6.1] 2017-10-04</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed &#8220;Next Events&#8221; and &#8220;Previous Events&#8221; navigation links in list views, which would sometimes make a category-filtered list view lose its category filter as a user navigated through pages of future or past events (props @forumhelpdesk and @atomicdust for reporting this!) [72013]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed some layout issues with the Tribe Bar datepicker that would arise when using a Twentysixteen or Twentyfifteen child them (thanks to @stefanrueegger for reporting this) [46471]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevented modification of event titles within the loop when using TRIBE_MODIFY_GLOBAL_TITLE [89273]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed issue when exporting all-day multi-day events via iCal where the end date was one day early (Thank you @fairmont for reporting this!) [87775]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed issues with the jQuery Timepicker vendor script conflicting with other plugins&#8217; similar scripts (props: @hcny et al.) [74644]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed an issue that would prevent Event Aggregator scheduled imports from running [88395]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed the &#8220;Start Time&#8221; and &#8220;End Time&#8221; timepicker fields in the event-creation screen to make it impossible to have an end date/time that comes before the start date/time [72686]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Remove unnecessary parameters from some remove_action calls in the plugin (thanks to @JPry on GitHub for submitting this fix!) [88867]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adjusted the EA cron start time so that it never gets created in the past [88965]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved options format in the Event Aggregator settings [88970]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added a filter to CSV importer for altering the delimiter, escaping, and enclosing characters [70570]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adjusted the <code>tribe_update_venue()</code> template tag so it no longer creates some unnecessary meta fields involving post_title, post_content, etc. (thanks @oheinrich for bringing this to our attention) [66968]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved the performance of The Events Calendar REST API tweaking some queries [89743]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add support for a <code>found_posts</code> argument in <code>tribe_get_events</code>, <code>tribe_get_venues</code> and <code>tribe_get_organizers</code> functions to return the number of posts found matching the current query arguments [89743]</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Deprecated the <code>tribe-events-bar-date-search-default-value</code> filter; use <code>tribe_events_bar_date_search_default_value</code> instead [67482]</li>
<li>Language &#8211; Improvements to aid translatability of text throughout plugin (props: @ramiy) [88982]</li>
<li>Language &#8211; 7 new strings added, 180 updated, 4 fuzzied, and 3 obsoleted</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.6] 2017-09-25</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added full CRUD REST support for Events, Organizers, Venues, Event Categories, and Tags</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated Bootstrap Datepicker to v1.7.0</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added latitude/longitude to REST responses when available on venues</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added JSON-LD data to REST responses when available</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Replaced deprecated first parameter of <code>tribe_get_organizers()</code> with a parameter that, when specified with a truthy value, returns only organizers with upcoming events attached to them</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added linked post filters: <code>tribe_{$this-&gt;post_type}_has_events_excluded_post_stati</code>, <code>tribe_events_tribe_organizer_create</code>, <code>tribe_events_tribe_organizer_update</code>, <code>tribe_event_venue_duplicate_post_fields</code>, <code>tribe_event_organizer_duplicate_custom_fields</code></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added action: <code>tribe_events_organizer_created</code></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added REST filters: <code>tribe_rest_organizer_default_only_with_upcoming</code>, <code>tribe_rest_venue_default_only_with_upcoming</code>, <code>tribe_events_rest_term_allow_delete</code></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added duplicate-detection filters: <code>tribe_duplicate_post_strategies</code>, <code>tribe_duplicate_post_strategy</code>, <code>tribe_duplicate_post_{$strategy}_strategy</code></li>
<li>Language &#8211; 152 new strings added, 217 updated, 6 fuzzied, and 1 obsoleted</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.5.13] 2017-09-20</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add link to the featured image in the Events List widget. New filter introduced to control this: <code>tribe_events_list_widget_featured_image_link</code> (props to @cabadaj007 for the feature request) [84807]</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Remove &#8216;France, Metropolitan&#8217; option from country list to prevent issues with Google Maps API (thanks @varesanodotfr for pointing this out) [78023]</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Ignored Events will restore previous status instead of setting to &#8216;publish&#8217; [82213]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Patched jQuery Resize vendor library to avoid JavaScript conflicts (props to @britner for the original report) [71994]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed a typo in the Event List widget options [71081]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Addressed some PHP notices that would sometimes emerge in tag-filtered post lists in the wp-admin (thanks to @wfsec28 and others in the forums for reporting this!) [45274]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; When &#8220;Full Styles&#8221; or &#8220;Tribe Events Styles&#8221; are used, prevent duplicate featured images from showing up in the Twenty Seventeen theme (props to @want2what and others in the forums for reporting this) [80955]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed the issue that would prevent the start date and date range parameters from being taken into account when using &#8216;Other URL&#8217; source in Event Aggregator</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Aggregator will no longer update comments while inactive [78890]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Avoid issues when REST API archive request parameters are not in the original order (thanks @Nslaver for reporting this and providing a fix) [88748]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Aggregator prevents duplicated records with the same params from being created [68833]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Aggregator will now allow for some minor shifts in schedule execution time to help distribute requests to EA Service [86628]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improve text in the Event Aggregator settings [77452]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add actions before and after posts are inserted or updated by Event Aggregator to allow custom functions to kick in (<code>tribe_aggregator_before_insert_posts</code> and <code>tribe_aggregator_after_insert_posts</code>) [87530]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Allow users to import CSV with numerically-named categories by using a flag (currently <code>%n</code>) (thanks @Shamsi for reporting) [78340]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Allow date range and events count limits to be set on each type of import (except for &#8216;Other URL&#8217;) in Event Aggregator [79975]</li>
</ul>

<li>Tweak &#8211; Styling/layout improvements within the Event Aggregator screen [77895]</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.5.0.2] 2017-05-01</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Ensure compatibility with WordPress version 4.4 and earlier</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.5.0.1] 2017-05-01</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolving issue where some premium plugins were falsely claiming they were out of date</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.5] 2017-05-01</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Event Aggregator now allows users to import from other sites with The Events Calendar [68139]</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Include a Events REST API endpoint for read operations [70711]</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Include granular Scheduling for Events Aggregator</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Update Authority for modified fields now will include Organizer, Venues and Taxonomy changes [71152]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Clean up direct calls to get events and use wrapper <code>tribe_get_events()</code> which has a hook for customizing</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Remove including Event Tickets for backwards compatibility as a vendor library [71908]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Create a global ID to increase consistency on all of the imported items with Event Aggregator [75218]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevent Aggregator to run on Empty Queues thus generating fatals (props to @Donald for the report here) [75377]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Categories and Tags are no longer cleared when importing with Event Aggregator (thank you @Nicolas for the report) [74264]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Increase consistency on Column Mapping for CSV imports [76476]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added filters for REST API: <code>tribe_events_rest_url_prefix</code>, <code>tribe_rest_url</code>, <code>tribe_events_rest_use_builtin</code>, <code>tribe_rest_events_archive_data</code>, <code>tribe_rest_event_max_per_page</code>, <code>tribe_rest_event_data</code>, <code>tribe_rest_venue_data</code>, <code>tribe_rest_organizer_data</code>, <code>tribe_rest_event_categories_data</code>, <code>tribe_rest_event_tags_data</code>, <code>tribe_rest_event_taxonomy_term_data</code>, <code>tribe_rest_event_featured_image</code>, <code>tribe_events_rest_api_enabled</code></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added filters for REST API Documentation: <code>tribe_rest_swagger_cost_details_documentation</code>, <code>tribe_rest_swagger_date_details_documentation</code>, <code>tribe_rest_swagger_image_details_documentation</code>, <code>tribe_rest_swagger_image_size_documentation</code>, <code>tribe_rest_swagger_term_documentation</code>, <code>tribe_rest_swagger_event_documentation</code>, <code>tribe_rest_swagger_organizer_documentation</code>, <code>tribe_rest_swagger_venue_documentation</code>, <code>tribe_rest_swagger_documentation</code></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added filters for Modified fields tracking: <code>tribe_tracker_post_types</code>, <code>tribe_tracker_excluded_meta_keys</code>, <code>tribe_tracker_enabled</code>, <code>tribe_tracker_enabled_for_terms</code>, <code>tribe_tracker_taxonomies</code></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added filters for Event Aggregator: <code>tribe_aggregator_localized_data</code>, <code>tribe_aggregator_service_messages</code>, <code>tribe_aggregator_url_import_range_options</code>, <code>tribe_aggregator_url_import_range_cap</code>, <code>tribe_aggregator_url_import_range_start</code>, <code>tribe_aggregator_url_import_range_end</code></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Removed filters for Event Aggregator: <code>tribe_aggregator_track_modified_fields</code></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added actions for Initialization: <code>tribe_events_bound_implementations</code></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Removed methods for <code>Tribe__Events__Main</code>: <code>track_event_post_field_changes</code>, <code>maybe_load_tickets_framework</code></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Removed methods for <code>Tribe__Events__Aggregator__Service</code>: <code>has_service_message</code></li>
</ul>

<h4>[4.3] 2016-10-13</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added Event Aggregator to enable service-based event imports from iCal feeds, Facebook, and Meetup</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Revamped the CSV import screens to work within the new Event Aggregator pages</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adjusted some view logic to support the new Event Views shortcode in Pro [44800]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added a button to copy the system infomation on the help tab [43709]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added an option for users to opt into automatic system infomation so our support system can grab the system information found on the help tab automatically [31645]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Use an earlier hook for iCal feed generation (props @jlambe) [64141]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Revise and simplify integration with Event Tickets attendee screen [61992]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added context to a set of strings to make translation easier (props @pedro-mendonca) [64586]</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Deprecated various disused functions and classes relating to the Meta Factory [39905]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Cease using GLOB_BRACE for including deprecated files due to limited server support [63172]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Avoid problems that can occur when hooking and unhooking actions (props @Chouby) [63474]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolves an issue where we were duplicating a core WordPress hook but with a different set of parameters (props @Chouby) [66455]</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Correct the datetime formatting issues within the iCal feed (props @henryk) [65968]</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; <code>Tribe__Events__Main::initOptions()</code> has been deprecated with no replacement</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; <code>Tribe__Events__Main::set_meta_factory_global()</code> has been deprecated in favor of using the <code>Tribe__Events__Meta_Factory</code> class</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; The <code>setup_meta()</code> method in both the <code>Tribe__Events__Template__Single_Event</code> and <code>Tribe__Events__Template_Factory</code> classes has been deprecated</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; The <code>the_title()</code>, <code>event_date()</code>, <code>event_category()</code>, <code>event_tag()</code>, <code>event_website()</code>, <code>event_origin()</code>, <code>organizer_name()</code>, <code>organizer_email()</code>, <code>venue_name()</code>, <code>venue_address()</code>, and <code>venue_map()</code> methods have been deprecated in the <code>Tribe__Events__Advanced_Functions__Register_Meta</code> class</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; The <code>register()</code>, <code>check_exists()</code>, and <code>get_args()</code> methods have been deprecated in the <code>Tribe__Events__Meta_Factory</code> class</li>
</ul>

<h4>[4.2] 2016-06-08</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added Google Maps API key field in the Settings tab to avoid map timeouts and errors on larger sites (Thanks to Yan for reporting this!)</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added support for featured image, multiple organizers, excerpt and more custom fields in the .csv file import function for events (Thank you to Graphic Designer for posting on UserVoice!)</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added support for featured image, description, map details and more custom fields in the .csv file import function for venues</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added support for featured image and description in the .csv file import function for organizers (Thank you to Rebecca for posting on UserVoice!)</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added an oEmbed template for events</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Improve performance of a query used to determine if there are free/uncosted events (Thank you @fabianmarz for the pull request!)</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added support for attaching custom post types to events</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved filtering of the <code>tribe_event_featured_image()</code> function (Cheers to @fabianmarz!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add an encoding class for the CSV importer to prevent non utf8 characters from preventing imports (Thanks to screenrage for the report!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved our JSON-LD output to ensure consistency (Props to @garrettjohnson and Lars!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Language files in the <code>wp-content/languages/plugins</code> path will be loaded before attempting to load internal language files (Thank you to user aafhhl for bringing this to our attention!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Switch to HTTPS for the &#8220;Powered by The Events Calendar&#8221; link (Thank you Cynthia for reporting this!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Switch to using HTTPS by default for interactions with Google Maps API</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved filterability of calendar excerpts by introducing the new <code>tribe_events_get_the_excerpt</code> filter hook</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved filtering of organizer details when importing by CSV (Props to @Geir for bringing this up!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adjustments for single event view in Twenty Fifteen theme</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved performance of query used to test for events without any cost</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added missing semicolon to a laquo (Props to mwender on GitHub for the fix!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improve the &#8220;stickiness&#8221; of CSV import column mappings (Thank you @jamesgol!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Consistency of JSON-LD markup improved (Cheers to @garrettjohnson for the help!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Avoid notice-level errors when working with WP CLI on a site where The Events Calendar is also active (Thanks to @sun)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Corrected the spelling of timezone in the CSV Importer&#8217;s event field</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated venue and organizer templates to use the new architecture for attaching custom post types to events</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Move plugin CSS to PostCSS</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Category default view is now set to <code>default</code> in place of hardcoding the current default view in the category base rewrite rule [31907]</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; <code>Tribe__Events__PUE__Checker</code>, <code>Tribe__Events__PUE__Plugin_Info</code>, and <code>Tribe__Events__PUE__Utility</code> classes are deprecated and are replaced by <code>Tribe__PUE__Checker</code>, <code>Tribe__PUE__Plugin_Info</code>, and <code>Tribe__PUE__Utility</code> classes</li>
<li>Fixed &#8211; Changed the use of <code>have_posts()</code> in the maybe iCal links for the main views that could cause an infinite loop</li>
<li>Accessibility &#8211; Focus styles added for search fields</li>
<li>Accessibility &#8211; Add ARIA labels for Month/Day/List sub nav</li>
<li>Accessibility &#8211; Add ARIA label for events footer sub nav heading</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.1.4] 2016-05-19</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Improve accuracy of list view pagination after switching from month view</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Give the multi-organizer form &#8216;sticky&#8217; properties so values persist even if the submission is initially rejected</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Resolved minor CSS issues in the welcome page</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.1.3] 2016-04-28</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Month View single days are now ordered as follows: sticky events, ongoing multi-day events, all day events, then start time. In other words, all events should be ordered as you&#8217;d expect when viewing events in Month View.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Updated the compatibility of CSV importer with WordPress 4.5 due to a change in the <code>post_status</code> filter. This will help prevent some of the errors you may have seen when importing events using a CSV file.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added new event names for AJAX success to the List, Month, and Day views to help The Events Calendar&#8217;s compatibility with our other premium plugins.</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.1.2] 2016-04-11</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Removed an unneeded hook that attempted to add a query argument to event tag links</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved an issue where events marked as &#8220;sticky&#8221; would not display as such in Month View</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Dashes, hyphens, or whatever you like to call them in the events archive slug no longer breaks the URL</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; The notice that pops up when a conflicting &#8220;events&#8221; page exists can now be dismissed</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.1.1.1] 2016-04-07</h4>
<ul>
<li>Security &#8211; Tightened up security with post type link filtering (props to Nadal Soler for reporting this issue!)</li>
<li>Security &#8211; Tightened up security around tribe bar submissions (props to Paul Mynarsky for reporting this issue!)</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.1.1] 2016-03-30</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved bug where array notices were output on single event pages when venues were not set (props to zaxiscreative for reporting this issue!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved issue where the Month View in mobile sizes retained the long day-of-week names when the abbreviations should have been used (props to Lucy for the bug report!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where a &#8220;0&#8221; was added to the default Venue name when creating a new event</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed notice that caused Ajax requests to fail (props to cgrymala on WP.org for reporting this!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Removed quotes from around TZID-specified timezones in iCal feeds which causes problems with some parsers (props to factory44 for reporting the issue that lead to this fix)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved various capitalization issues with German translations (props to oheinrich in our forums for pointing out this issue!)</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.1.0.1] 2016-03-17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved multiple issues with the German <code>de_DE</code> language file that caused a number of site-breaking issues</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.1] 2016-03-15</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added a tribe_get_venue_website_url() function for fetching Venue website URLs (props to fervorcreative in our forums for this request!)</li>
<li>Performance &#8211; Lazy-load venue and organizer selector data</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Allow iCal filenames to be filtered via a new filter: tribe_events_ical_feed_filename</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added a hook to allow single day queries in month view to be filtered: tribe_events_month_daily_events_query_args</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improved the logic around rebuilding known date ranges</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Always show the &#8220;Merge Duplicates&#8221; button for venues and organizers in the Events General Settings page</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Allow the &#8220;same slug&#8221; notice to be dismissed and fix some text in that message</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Ignore alpha/beta/rc suffixes on version numbers when checking template versions</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add a filter for month view daily events query: tribe_events_month_daily_events_query_args</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added a more flexible cost range parsing function</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Obfuscate license keys Events &gt; Help &gt; System Information</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed a fatal that sometimes occurred when refreshing the import CSV page</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed issue where some characters were not escaped appropriately for month and year formats</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Added missing tribe-loading@2x.gif</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed a warning produced by passing a DateTime() object into start_date or end_date args of tribe_get_events (props to iamhexcoder for the pull request!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where events in month view were not always sorted in chronological order</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed the System Info URL in Events &gt; Help</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved issue where the default country would be &#8220;Array&#8221; if no default country is set</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where ajaxurl was sometimes undefined</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.0.7] 2016-03-02</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolve display issues on templates with Jetpack and a few themes</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Mobile breakpoints on month view working with custom breakpoints</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Reordering Venue and Organizer metadata no longer breaks titles</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevented notices from happening when using <code>the_title</code> filter</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; iCal links now will respect categories on the first page</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevent third-party bugs with SEO plugins when inserting events programmatically</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Organizer information is showing up again correctly</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Modified the add-on license validation method to better explain what is happening</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Description on mobile views now have the correct class attribute on HTML</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Added missing semicolon on the list navigation for &#8220;&amp;laquo&#8221;</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.0.6] 2016-02-17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adjust injection of event data into the_content from priority 10 to 9 for better 3rd-party plugin compatibility</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change mobile month view selector to load event details below the calendar for better theme compatibility</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Better handling of edge cases on the post_excerpt for List View</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Removal of generic CSS classes like <code>.updated</code> and <code>.published</code></li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevent Notices from appearing when using <code>tribe_get_organizer()</code></li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Make HTML Single Event Pages valid</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Numeric named categories URLs are now fully working</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Event Title now Accepts HTML on Tooltips</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Licenses Tab now will work with <code>DISALLOW_FILE_MODS</code> (Props to Sun for spotting and fixing this)</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.0.5] 2016-01-15</h4>
<ul>
<li>Security &#8211; Security fix with Venues and Organizers (props to grantdayjames for reporting this!)</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.0.4] 2015-12-23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Including the latest embedded Event Tickets release for backward compatibility</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.0.3] 2015-12-22</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adjust single-event.php template to allow the &#8220;Time&#8221; title and content to be filterable (Props to Sitecrafting for highlighting this issue!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved issue with an overly escaped Event Category edit URL that prevented editing categories (Thanks to Ian for the first report of this issue!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed issue where clicking on columns on the Events listed in the Admin Dashboard were ALWAYS sorted by Event start/end date before sorting by the column selected (Cheers to Corrado for bringing this to our attention!)</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.0.2] 2015-12-16</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adding better support for non-numeric cost values on events (Props to Mirja for highlighting this!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Avoid notice level errors when advanced events list widget settings are saved (Thank you Johan for reporting the issue!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improve messaging in the same-slug warning message (Thanks to Simon for bringing this to our attention!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Hook to Event Tickets to inject event dates into ticket emails</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adding better support for default venues (Props to Karly for noting this!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improve handling of internationalized slugs (Cheers to Oliver for the help!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Ensure the past events list displays the correct events when accessed via ajax (Thank you Jesse for highlighting this!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Support ordering by venue/organizer within event queries (Thank you Doug for bringing this to our attention!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed issue where events with the same date/time would sometimes be excluded from single-event navigation (Cheers to JeremyEnglert for the tip!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved issue where events set with the explicit cost of 0 were not showing as &#8220;Free&#8221; (Thank you terrizsolo for reporting this!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where the datepicker in Twenty Sixteen was really ugly</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where using Quick Edit on events caused the table columns in the event list to become jumbled on save (Props to A K for the report!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved bug where category links sometimes included event category 1 (Thank you Anthony for the original report of this problem!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed a settings page URL (Props to Kristy for the heads up!)</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.0.1] 2015-12-10</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add a warning message for major updates</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; For SEO reasons, use an h1 for the title rather than an h2 (props to wpexplorer for this fix)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Target the calendar view grid in JS using a simpler selector</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved WP 4.4 related fatal on the Nav Menu page that prevented the admin footer from rendering/enqueuing JS</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved bug where visiting /events/upcoming could sometimes result in an infinite redirect loop</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Removed <code>wp_trim_excerpt</code> and use only it&#8217;s powers, fixing the excerpt problem</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where the mobile calendar view did not display the date for the date being viewed</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where the admin toolbar&#8217;s Events &gt; Import &gt; CSV did not link to the CSV importer page</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed issue where the events list in the admin dashboard were not ordered in an intuitive manner</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved bug where sorting by event category or tag resulted in an error</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where full event content text was displayed where excerpts should have been displayed</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved issue where events imported via CSV were excluded from single event navigation</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where /events/list would sometimes 404 on a new install</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved bug where multiday all-day events displayed the end date as one day later than it should be when the End of Day Cut-off was set to something other than 12am</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Timezone handling fixed within generated iCal feeds</li>
</ul>
<h4>[4.0] 2015-12-02</h4>
<ul>
<li>Security &#8211; A TON of escaping was added to our codebase thanks to the efforts of the always-helpful Andy Fragen (@afragen)</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Moved the Ticket framework code into its own plugin (event-tickets)</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; The event cost now supports more international formats with the addition of the tribe_events_cost_separators filter (Thank you remokrol for bringing this to our attention!)</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added support for the twentysixteen theme</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Created a new Add-Ons tab in Settings so that TEC add-ons can have a consolidated settings tab</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Improve the date formats UI by providing example output for each selected format</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Restructured TEC&#8217;s core settings code for reusability with other standalone plugins like Event Tickets</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Deprecate old JS event names in favor of a new JS event naming standard. Example: deprecated tribe_ev_runAjax in favor of run-ajax.tribe</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Consolidated import pages for TEC and add-ons</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; When suggesting a UTF-8 compatibility CSV formatting tool, point to one that still exists</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added the ability to filter attendees CSV items via tribe_events_tickets_attendees_csv_items (Props to @bostondv on GitHub for this patch!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated all excerpt output to use tribe_events_get_the_excerpt() to ensure a consistent display of excerpt content (Cheers to Joseph to pointing this out!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add support for wp_get_document_title in response to the WordPress 4.4 deprecation of wp_title</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Check post creation permissions before letting users create venues and organizers from the event meta box</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Only display data separators between fields that have data when rendering organizers (Thank you Bud for highlighting this issue!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; When a user cannot create organizers, prevent the auto-selection of organizers when editing an event</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Remove microformat CSS classes from templates and replace with namespaced content-relevant CSS classes</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Changed the &#8220;updated&#8221; CSS class to &#8220;tribe-updated&#8221; so that it is properly namespaced (Thank you vijayrajesh!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; The Plugin Update Checker will now auto-save valid plugin keys (Thanks to Denon for originally bringing this up!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Cleaned up the output of JSON-LD data. Filterable via the new tribe_google_data_markup_json filter</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Drop the use of the generic CSS class &#8220;placeholder&#8221; in favor of &#8220;tribe-event-placeholder&#8221; (Thanks to Marc on the forums!)</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adjusted the CSS padding on Admin Menu items for Events</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Various codesniffer fixes</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; tribe_get_venue_link() no longer echoes if you ask it to return an <a> element</a></li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Error messages for empty Venue names</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Improve our responsiveness for the widget mini calendar, allowing smaller sidebars.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; No longer retrieve empty costs when fetching all costs for all events</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change the priority of bootstrapping the-events-calendar to ensure it occurs before any of the TEC addons in the event some addons are upgraded to v4.0 later than TEC</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Adjust the logic used for adding a noindex/follow tag to event views</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; No longer hiding default address fields when default venues are selected when Pro is active</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved issue where the iCal feed did not provide an appropriately formatted timezone in some cases (Cheers to Matt for the report!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Added support for translating some previously untranslatable strings (Props to tititou36, media325, and Stef!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Prevented duplicate CSS IDs on the mini calendars (Cheers to Corrado for the help!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug causing tribe_get_single_ical_link() and tribe_get_ical_link() to use the same URL when it shouldn&#8217;t (Props to Ben Byrne @drywall on Twitter for the heads up!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed issue where the &#8220;Add another organizer&#8221; text wasn&#8217;t using the correct singular label (Thank you MIKE for the report!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Various CSS fixes for twenty(ten-fifteen)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Improved our handling of <code>get_current_screen()</code> across the plugin, avoiding notices and warnings (Thank you Mike for the help!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where accessing object properties on a non object errored out when saving event meta (props to @dalethedeveloper on GitHub for this fix!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed bug where organizer ID meta attached sometimes included a blank record. That blank record is no longer returned in tribe_get_organizer_ids()</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed error message returned when tabbing away from a blank event name meta box so that it properly indicates that an event name is required (Our thanks to @tapan29bd for this fix!)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved issue where Timezone event start/end date property name strings were malformed which guaranteed a a call to get_post_meta for Timezone date strings</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed CSS issue where the month view calendar could sometimes extend beyond the edge of the page when Skeleton Styles were enabled</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed a problem where iCal data was generated with incorrect dates in the case of some all days events (thanks to Matt for highlighting this)</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved a problem causing the previous month view to appear when it should not</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Fixed issue in mobile month view where date was missing from heading</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Resolved issue that caused /events/ to 404 if it was visited on a new install before hitting &#8220;Save&#8221; on the Events &gt; Settings &gt; Display page</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; The Tribe__Events__Main::defaultValueReplaceEnabled() method is being deprecated in favor of tribe_get_option(&#8216;defaultValueReplace&#8217;). Schedules for removal in v4.5</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; The tribe_event_link() has been deprecated in favor of tribe_get_event_link(). Scheduled for removal in 5.0</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; The third parameter of tribe_get_organizer_link() (the $echo parameter) has been deprecated and is scheduled for removal in 5.0</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Abstract_Deactivation in favor of Tribe__Abstract_Deactivation</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Admin__Helpers in favor of Tribe__Admin__Helpers</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__App_Shop in favor of Tribe__App_Shop</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Autoloader in favor of Tribe__Autoloader</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Cache in favor of Tribe__Cache</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Cache_Listener in favor of Tribe__Cache_Listener</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Changelog_Reader in favor of Tribe__Changelog_Reader</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Credits in favor of Tribe__Credits</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Date_Utils in favor of Tribe__Date_Utils</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Field in favor of Tribe__Field</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Settings in favor of Tribe__Settings</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Settings_Tab in favor of Tribe__Settings_Tab</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Support in favor of Tribe__Support</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Template_Part_Cache in favor of Tribe__Template_Part_Cache</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Tickets__Attendees_Table in favor of Tribe__Tickets__Attendees_Table in the event-tickets plugin</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Tickets__Metabox in favor of Tribe__Tickets__Metabox in the event-tickets plugin</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Tickets__Ticket_Object in favor of Tribe__Tickets__Ticket_Object in the event-tickets plugin</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Tickets__Tickets in favor of Tribe__Tickets__Tickets in the event-tickets plugin</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Tickets__Tickets_Pro in favor of Tribe__Tickets__Tickets_Handler in the event-tickets plugin</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Validate in favor of Tribe__Validate</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__View_Helpers in favor of Tribe__View_Helpers</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::OPTIONNAME in favor of Tribe__Main::OPTIONNAME</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::OPTIONNAMENETWORK in favor of Tribe__Main::OPTIONNAMENETWORK</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::addHelpAdminMenuItem() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::add_help_admin_menu_item()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::addNetworkOptionsPage() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::add_network_options_page()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::array_insert_after_key() in favor of Tribe__Main::array_insert_after_key()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::array_insert_before_key() in favor of Tribe__Main::array_insert_before_key()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::debug() in favor of Tribe__Debug::debug()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::defaultValueReplaceEnabled() in favor of tribe_get_option( &#8216;defaultValueReplace&#8217; )</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::doHelpTab() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::do_help_tab()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::doNetworkSettingTab() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::do_network_settings_tab()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::doSettingTabs() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::do_setting_tabs()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::do_licenses_tab() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::do_licenses_tab()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::getNetworkOption() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::get_network_option()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::getNetworkOptions() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::get_network_options()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::getNotices() in favor of Tribe__Notices::get()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::getOption() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::get_option()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::getOptions() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::get_options()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::have_addons() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::have_addons()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::isNotice() in favor of Tribe__Notices::is_notice()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::pluginDir in favor of Tribe__Events__Main::plugin_dir</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::pluginName in favor of Tribe__Events__Main::plugin_name</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::pluginPath in favor of Tribe__Events__Main::plugin_path</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::pluginUrl in favor of Tribe__Events__Main::plugin_url</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::removeNotice() in favor of Tribe__Notices::remove_notice()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::renderDebug() in favor of Tribe__Debug::render()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::saveAllTabsHidden() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::save_all_tabs_hidden()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::setNetworkOptions() in favor of Tribe__Settings_Manager::set_network_options()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::setNotice() in favor of Tribe__Notices::set_notice()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; Tribe__Events__Main::truncate() in favor of tribe_events_get_the_excerpt()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; tribe_event_beginning_of_day() in favor of tribe_beginning_of_day()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; tribe_event_end_of_day() in favor of tribe_end_of_day()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; tribe_event_format_date() in favor of tribe_format_date()</li>
<li>Deprecated &#8211; tribe_events_the_notices() in favor of tribe_the_notices()</li>
</ul>
<h4>3.x and previous</h4>
<p>For release notes from the 3.x and older lifecycles, see our <a href="https://theeventscalendar.com/category/products/release-notes/" rel="nofollow">full historical release notes</a>.</p>

Link Checker";s:4:"slug";s:19:"broken-link-checker";s:7:"version";s:6:"1.11.5";s:6:"author";s:30:"Janis Elsts, Vladimir Prelovac";s:14:"author_profile";s:42:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/whiteshadow";s:8:"requires";s:3:"3.2";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.8.7";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:84;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:234;i:4;i:31;i:3;i:10;i:2;i:24;i:1;i:39;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:338;s:15:"support_threads";i:12;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:6072605;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2017-08-02 2:15pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2007-10-08";s:8:"homepage";s:50:"https://wordpress.org/plugins/broken-link-checker/";s:8:"sections";a:4:{s:11:"description";s:7018:"<p>This plugin will monitor your blog looking for broken links and let you know if any are found.</p>
<p><strong>Features</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Monitors links in your posts, pages, comments, the blogroll, and custom fields (optional).</li>
<li>Detects links that don&#8217;t work, missing images and redirects.</li>
<li>Notifies you either via the Dashboard or by email.</li>
<li>Makes broken links display differently in posts (optional).</li>
<li>Prevents search engines from following broken links (optional).</li>
<li>You can search and filter links by URL, anchor text and so on.</li>
<li>Links can be edited directly from the plugin&#8217;s page, without manually updating each post.</li>
<li>Highly configurable.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Basic Usage</strong></p>
<p>Once installed, the plugin will begin parsing your posts, bookmarks (AKA blogroll) and other content and looking for links. Depending on the size of your site this can take from a few minutes up to an hour or more. When parsing is complete, the plugin will start checking each link to see if it works. Again, how long this takes depends on how big your site is and how many links there are. You can monitor the progress and tweak various link checking options in <em>Settings -&gt; Link Checker</em>.</p>
<p>The broken links, if any are found, will show up in a new tab of the WP admin panel &#8211; <em>Tools -&gt; Broken Links</em>. A notification will also appear in the &#8220;Broken Link Checker&#8221; widget on the Dashboard. To save display space, you can keep the widget closed and configure it to expand automatically when problematic links are detected. E-mail notifications need to be enabled separately (in <em>Settings -&gt; Link Checker</em>).</p>
<p>The &#8220;Broken Links&#8221; tab will by default display a list of broken links that have been detected so far. However, you can use the links on that page to view redirects or see a listing of all links &#8211; working or not &#8211; instead. You can also create new link filters by performing a search and clicking the &#8220;Create Custom Filter&#8221; button. For example, this can be used to create a filter that only shows comment links.</p>
<p>There are several actions associated with each link. They show up when you move your mouse over to one of the links listed the aforementioned tab &#8211;</p>
<ul>
<li>&#8220;Edit URL&#8221; lets you change the URL of that link. If the link is present in more than one place (e.g. both in a post and in the blogroll), all occurrences of that URL will be changed.</li>
<li>&#8220;Unlink&#8221; removes the link but leaves the link text intact.</li>
<li>&#8220;Not broken&#8221; lets you manually mark a &#8220;broken&#8221; link as working. This is useful if you know it was incorrectly detected as broken due to a network glitch or a bug. The marked link will still be checked periodically, but the plugin won&#8217;t consider it broken unless it gets a new result.</li>
<li>&#8220;Dismiss&#8221; hides the link from the &#8220;Broken Links&#8221; and &#8220;Redirects&#8221; views. It will still be checked as normal and get the normal link styles (e.g. a strike-through effect for broken links), but won&#8217;t be reported again unless its status changes. Useful if you want to acknowledge a link as broken/redirected and just leave as it is.</li>
</ul>
<p>You can also click on the contents of the &#8220;Status&#8221; or &#8220;Link Text&#8221; columns to get more info about the status of each link.</p>
<p><strong>Translations</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Arabic &#8211; Yaser Maadan</li>
<li>Belorussian &#8211; <a href="http://www.comfi.com/" rel="nofollow">M. Comfi</a></li>
