";s:12:"installation";s:909:"<h4>From within dashboard (recommended)</h4>
<ol>
<li>Navigate to <code>Dashboard</code> ▸ <code>Plugins</code> ▸ <code>Add New</code>;</li>
<li>Search for <code>Shortcodes Ultimate</code>;</li>
<li>Click <code>Install</code>, then <code>Activate</code>.</li>
</ol>
<p><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6xhplrZJD9c" rel="nofollow">Watch video of the process</a>.</p>
<h4>Manual installation</h4>
<ol>
<li>Download a .zip file with plugin;</li>
<li>Unzip downloaded archive and upload <code>shortcodes-ultimate</code> folder under your <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory (resulted plugin path should be <code>/wp-content/plugins/shortcodes-ultimate/**</code>);</li>
<li>Navigate to <code>Dashboard</code> ▸ <code>Plugins</code> and active the plugin.</li>
</ol>
<p><a href="http://docs.getshortcodes.com/article/13-plugin-installation" rel="nofollow">Detailed installation guide</a>.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:2806:"
<h4>How this plugin works</h4>
<p>
<p><a href="http://docs.getshortcodes.com/article/36-shortcodes-ultimate" rel="nofollow">How Shortcodes Ultimate plugin works</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Shortcodes do not work. Why?</h4>
<p>
<p>The most common reasons of this issue are listed <a href="http://docs.getshortcodes.com/article/41-shortcodes-do-not-work" rel="nofollow">here</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Insert shortcode button do not work. Why?</h4>
<p>
<p>The most common reasons of this issue are listed <a href="http://docs.getshortcodes.com/article/42-insert-shortcode-button-do-not-work" rel="nofollow">here</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I remove default shortcodes?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, you can remove default shortcodes using &#8216;su/data/shortcodes&#8217; filter. Tutorial: <a href="http://docs.getshortcodes.com/article/51-how-to-remove-default-shortcodes" rel="nofollow">How to remove default shortcodes</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I create custom shortcodes?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, you can create custom shortcodes using &#8216;su/data/shortcodes&#8217; filter. Tutorial: <a href="http://docs.getshortcodes.com/article/45-how-to-add-custom-shortcodes" rel="nofollow">How to add custom shortcodes</a>.<br />
Alternatively, you can use <a href="https://getshortcodes.com/add-ons/shortcode-creator/" rel="nofollow">Shortcode Creator add-on</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I use shortcodes in template files?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes! <a href="http://docs.getshortcodes.com/article/52-using-of-shortcodes-in-template-files" rel="nofollow">How to use shortcodes in template files</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Will this plugin work with my theme?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes! Shortcodes Ultimate is designed to work with any theme, but your theme must include very basic things: &#8216;wp_head&#8217; and &#8216;wp_footer&#8217; template tags. Sometimes, the plugin may not work properly because of javascript errors caused by third-party plugins/themes.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I report a bug?</h4>
<p>
<p>You should <a href="https://github.com/gndev/shortcodes-ultimate/" rel="nofollow">create an issue at GitHub</a> or <a href="https://getshortcodes.com/contact/" rel="nofollow">open new support ticket</a> (for premium add-ons only).</p>
</p>
<h4>Where to find additional information?</h4>
<p>
<p>Plugin has comprehensive <a href="http://docs.getshortcodes.com/" rel="nofollow">documentation</a>.<br />
Also, you can find more answers at <a href="https://getshortcodes.com/support/" rel="nofollow">support page</a>.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I get support or talk to other users?</h4>
<p>
<p>If you get stuck, you can ask for help in <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate" rel="nofollow">official plugin forum</a>.<br />
For help with premium add-ons, please <a href="https://getshortcodes.com/contact/" rel="nofollow">open new support ticket</a>.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:29230:"<h4>5.1.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Gutenberg compatibility enabled by default</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.1.0</h4>
<p><strong>What&#8217;s new</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Added compatibility with the Gutenberg editor. <a href="https://vanokhin.com/su-now-supports-gutenberg/" rel="nofollow">Learn more</a>.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed <code>&lt;img&gt;</code> icon appearance of the <code>[su_service]</code> shortcode</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.0.8</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed Live Preview, wasn&#8217;t representing changed settings</li>
<li>Fixed <code>[su_siblings]</code>, now it works again at top-level pages</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Other</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Various code improvements</li>
<li>New filters for gallery, slider, and carousel</li>
<li>Returned <code>su_cmpt()</code> and <code>su_compatibility_mode_prefix()</code> utils</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.0.7</h4>
<p><strong>Security update</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed shortcode generator preview vulnerability. <a href="https://www.pluginvulnerabilities.com/2018/09/25/full-disclosure-of-vulnerability-in-wordpress-plugin-with-700000-active-installations/" rel="nofollow">Description</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.0.6</h4>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Added missing images for <code>su_audio</code>, <code>su_video</code>, <code>su_slider</code> and <code>su_carousel</code></li>
<li>Fixed Fatal error: Call to a member function get_page_permastruct() on null in link-template.php:357</li>
<li>Added missing <code>su_get_icon()</code> utility function</li>
<li>Added missing <code>su_scattr()</code> utility function</li>
<li>Added missing <code>su_do_shortcode()</code> utility function</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.0.5</h4>
<p><strong>Improvements</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Improved compatibility with fitvid.js;</li>
<li>Improved appearance of the <code>Show more</code> and <code>Show less</code> links of the <code>su_expand</code> shortcode;</li>
<li>The new option <code>mute</code> for <code>su_youtube</code> and <code>su_youtube_advanced</code> shortcodes;</li>
<li>Support for the <code>youtube-nocookie.com</code> domain in <code>su_youtube</code> and <code>su_youtube_advanced</code> shortcodes;</li>
<li>Support for nested shortcodes in the <code>title</code> attribute of the <code>su_button</code> shortcode;</li>
<li>The new option <code>dnt</code> (do not track) for the <code>su_vimeo</code> shortcode, <a href="https://help.vimeo.com/hc/en-us/articles/360001494447-Using-Player-Parameters" rel="nofollow">learn more</a>;</li>
<li>The new option <code>mute</code> for the <code>su_vimeo</code> shortcode;</li>
<li>https support for the <code>su_dailymotion</code> shortcode;</li>
<li>New options <code>title</code> and <code>rel</code> for the <code>su_permalink</code> shortcode;</li>
<li>The <code>su_post</code> shortcode now support slugs in the <code>post_id</code> attribute;</li>
<li>The new option <code>zoom</code> for <code>su_gmap</code>.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Changes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Shortcodes styles merged into a single stylesheet.</li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Fixes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Fixed warning in <code>su_siblings</code> shortcode.</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.0.4</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: added missing FontAwesome icons</li>
<li>Fixed: is_plugin_active call removed on frontend</li>
<li>Fixed: nested shortcodes</li>
<li>Fixed: issue with spoiler loaded through ajax</li>
<li>Fixed: [scheduler] shortcode logic</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.0.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>Changed: Inview.js library replaced with <a href="https://github.com/protonet/jquery.inview" rel="nofollow">jQuery.Inview</a></li>
<li>Fixed: caching issue with [su_dummy_text]</li>
<li>Fixed: PHP warning in [su_posts] shortcode when specified template does not exist</li>
<li>Updated: Font Awesome to version 4.7.0</li>
<li>Added: responsive styles for [su_pullquote]</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.0.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: an issue where RTL stylesheet won&#8217;t displayed if custom CSS field is empty</li>
<li>Fixed: icon sizes at &#8216;Dashboard &#8211; Available Shortcodes&#8217; page</li>
<li>Fixed: [expand] shortcode now works when loaded through AJAX</li>
<li>Fixed: border-radius on [box] shortcode</li>
<li>Fixed: compatibility with &#8216;Plugin Organizer&#8217;</li>
<li>Updated: OwlCarousel jQuery plugin</li>
<li>Added: new attribute &#8216;responsive&#8217; for table shortcode: [su_table responsive=&#8221;no|yes&#8221;]</li>
<li>Added: new attribute &#8216;playsinline&#8217; for youtube_advanced shortcode: [su_youtube_advanced playsinline=&#8221;no|yes&#8221;]</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.0.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fixed: serious security vulnerability, which allows attacker to run any code using filter in meta, post, or user shortcodes. Thanks to Robert L Mathews.</li>
<li>Fixed: changed admin menu position (it was replacing &#8216;Settings&#8217; menu on some installations)</li>
<li>Fixed: shortcodes prefix field now accepts special characters</li>
<li>Fixed: old bug when unwanted code parts was added with shortcode</li>
<li>Fixed: bug, where backslashes were removed from custom CSS code</li>
<li>Added: new attribute &#8216;ID&#8217; for [button] shortcode</li>
<li>Added: new filter &#8216;su/slides_query&#8217;, which can be used to modify posts query for slider, carousel and custom_gallery shortcodes</li>
<li>Added: new filter &#8216;su/assets/custom_css/template&#8217; to filter custom css output</li>
<li>Minor fixes</li>
</ul>
<h4>5.0.0</h4>
<ul>
<li>Read <a href="https://vanokhin.com/whats-new-in-shortcodes-ultimate-5/" rel="nofollow">this blog post</a> to learn more about update</li>
<li>New project website <a href="https://getshortcodes.com/" rel="nofollow">getshortcodes.com</a></li>
<li>New documentation <a href="http://docs.getshortcodes.com/" rel="nofollow">docs.getshortcodes.com</a></li>
<li>Added: &#8216;Available shortcodes&#8217; admin menu</li>
<li>Removed: &#8216;Examples&#8217; admin menu</li>
<li>Removed: &#8216;Cheatsheet&#8217; admin menu</li>
<li>Fixed: [feed] shortcode (now it uses SimplePie)</li>
<li>Changed default content for [tabs], [row] and [accordion] shortcodes</li>
<li>Fixed: [user] shortcode works when user is not logged in</li>
<li>Changed: Security improvement. Plugin will now strip all HTML tags from Custom CSS code</li>
<li>Minor improvements and fixes</li>
</ul>

<li>Fixed: templates/default-loop.php &#8211; removed extra n character in comments number, <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/minor-bug-in-templatesdefault-loopphp" rel="nofollow">forum topic</a></li>
<li>Fixed: large DB query on sites with many users, <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/installing-sc-ultimate-on-site-with-30000-wp-users" rel="nofollow">forum topic</a></li>
</ul>

<h4>4.4</h4>
<ul>
<li><strong>IMPORTANT</strong>: new galleries mechanism. Your created galleries will work but will not be visible in admin panel. Now, you&#8217;re able to create galleries right in &#8220;Insert shortcode&#8221; window. Also, you can now create galleries from posts, categories or even custom taxonomies.</li>
<li>Removed all default links (default youtube videos)</li>
<li>Updated admin page framework Sunrise</li>
<li>Minor admin panel fixes</li>
<li>Fixed file_get_contents() (disabled http wrappers) issue at the examples page</li>
<li>Added classes Shortcodes_Ultimate_Generator, Shortcodes_Ultimate_Shortcodes and Shortcodes_Ultimate_Data</li>
<li>Removed unused classes MediaUpload and ImageMeta</li>
<li>New shortocde [dummy_image]</li>
<li>New shortocde [dummy_text]</li>
<li>New shortocde [animate]</li>
<li>New shortocde [youtube_advanced]</li>

<li>New slider control for shortcode generator</li>
<li>Small fixes</li>

<ul>

<h4>4.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>Font Awesome icons (in Generator)</li>
<li>Fixed warning in footer &#8211; <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/bug-showing-in-online-site-after-updating-the-plugin" rel="nofollow">forum topic</a></li>
<li>Removed warning at settings page &#8211; <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/warning-on-settings-page" rel="nofollow">forum topic</a></li>
<li>Removed another warning (undefined index) &#8211; <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/undefined-index-with-wp_debug-true" rel="nofollow">forum topic</a></li>
<li>Changed syntax for shortcodes inside of attributes &#8211; <a href="http://gndev.info/kb/how-to-use-another-shortcodes-inside-of-attributes/" rel="nofollow">documentation</a></li>
<li>Small performance improvemets</li>
<li>Aded font-awesome.css. Will be completely included in closest versions</li>
<li>Added default taxonomy value for [posts]</li>
<li>Added default post_type value for [posts]</li>
<li>Added ability to use shortcodes inside of attributes</li>
<li>Translated into Japanese</li>
<li>Fixed [button wide=yes]</li>
<li>Fixed media query for [column]</li>
<li>Added new attr [column center=yes]</li>
<li>Improved js code for spoilers and tabs</li>
<li>Improved js code for generator</li>
<li>Added pot file</li>
<li>Fixed [button] css code</li>
<li>Updated [accordion], [spoiler] and [tabs] js code</li>
<li>Fixed [tooltip]</li>
<li>Updated Greek translation</li>
<li>Fixed [lightbox]</li>
<li>Disabled wp_footer check</li>
<li>Fixed wp_footer notice, again</li>
<li>Small fix for tooltips</li>
<li>Fixed wp_footer notice</li>
<li>Greek translation</li>
<li>Added compatibility mode prefix for spoilers inside of accordion</li>
<li>Updated qTip plugin</li>
<li>Added shortcode [tooltip]</li>
<li>Added new attribute. [tab disabled=&#8221;yes&#8221;]. Now, any tab can be disabled. <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/tabs-how-to-disable-one-of-the-tabs" rel="nofollow">Forum topic</a></li>
<li>Added [accordion] scrolling. <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/accordion-usability-issue" rel="nofollow">Forum topic</a></li>
<li>Added wp_footer check. User will be noticed if current theme doen&#8217;t includes wp_footer</li>
<li>Updated caching mechanism. Cache will be reseted when you add or remove terms</li>
<li>Updated galleries mechanism. Removed some conflicts</li>
<li>Fixed spoiler background for style=fancy</li>
<li>Additional access check option for Shortcode Generator</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.1</h4>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://gndev.info/shortcodes-ultimate/metro-skins/" rel="nofollow">5 metro skins</a></li>
<li>New screencast &#8211; <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kCWyO2F7jTw" rel="nofollow">How to create image gallery</a></li>
<li>New attribute &#8220;center&#8221; for [button]. Buttons can now be centered on the page</li>
<li>Updated [frame]. Now it can contain other shortcodes</li>
<li>Updated caching mechanism. Cache now will be reseted on plugin activation</li>
<li>Fixed many PHP warnings when debug mode enabled</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [media]. Shortcode has basic support for youtube and vimeo videos</li>
<li>Fixed bug with hidden single [tab]</li>
<li>Added attribute &#8220;active&#8221; for tabs container. This option allows you to select tab number that will be open by default</li>
<li>Fixd button style 3D</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [frame]</li>
<li>Fixed [column] margins</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [tabs]. Now it accepts style=3 and vertical attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [spoiler]. Now it accepts 0 and 1 as values for attribute open. Also, it now accepts style attribute (1, 2, default, fancy, simple)</li>
<li>Added custom CSS import from previous versions. Styles will be imported automatically and prepended to the existing CSS-code</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [highlight]. Now it accepts bg and background attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [label]. Now it accepts style and type attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [dropcap]. Now it accepts 1, 2 and 3 as style values</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [permalink]. Now it accepts p and id attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [button]. Need to test</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [members]. Now it accepts style and login attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [box]. Now it accepts color and box_color attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [note]. Now it accepts color and note_color attributes</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [column]. Now it accepts attribute last and can be not wrapped with [row]</li>
<li>Added backward compatibility for [document]. Now it accepts file and url attributes</li>
</ul>
<h4>4.0</h4>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://gndev.info/shortcodes-ultimate/" rel="nofollow">Official plugin page</a></li>
<li><a href="http://gndev.info/shortcodes-ultimate/maker/" rel="nofollow">Premium add-on for creating custom shortcodes</a></li>
<li>Plugin based on <a href="https://github.com/gndev/sunrise" rel="nofollow">Sunrise Plugin Framework</a></li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/gndev/shortcodes-ultimate" rel="nofollow">GitHub repo</a>. Now you can easily fork and modify best plugin in the world (:</li>
<li>Brand new Shortcode Generator, <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DR2c266yWEA" rel="nofollow">demo video</a></li>
<li><a href="http://gndev.info/kb/shortcodes-ultimate-api-overview/" rel="nofollow">Shortcodes API</a></li>
<li>Completely reorganized code. Added and removed some shortcodes</li>
<li>For security maniacs: timthumb.php replaced by native WordPress mechanism</li>
<li>For speed-up maniacs: completely rewritten assets mechanism. Now css and js files included on page depend on used shortcodes</li>
<li>Added new shortcode [posts]. This is awesome and flexible mechanism to display your content in many different ways</li>
<li>Now you can create your own custom skins for shortcodes</li>
<li>Columns, google maps, google document viewer, youtube player, vimeo player and custom audio player is now fully responsive</li>
</ul>

.4.0.3.zip";s:5:"4.0.4";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.0.4.zip";s:5:"4.0.5";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.0.5.zip";s:5:"4.0.6";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.0.6.zip";s:5:"4.0.7";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.0.7.zip";s:5:"4.0.8";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.0.8.zip";s:5:"4.0.9";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.0.9.zip";s:5:"4.1.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.1.0.zip";s:5:"4.1.1";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.1.1.zip";s:5:"4.1.2";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.1.2.zip";s:5:"4.1.3";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.1.3.zip";s:5:"4.1.4";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.1.4.zip";s:5:"4.1.5";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.1.5.zip";s:5:"4.1.6";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.1.6.zip";s:5:"4.1.7";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.1.7.zip";s:5:"4.1.8";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.1.8.zip";s:5:"4.1.9";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.1.9.zip";s:6:"4.10.0";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.10.0.zip";s:6:"4.10.1";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.10.1.zip";s:6:"4.10.2";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.10.2.zip";s:5:"4.2.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.2.0.zip";s:5:"4.2.1";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.2.1.zip";s:5:"4.2.2";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.2.2.zip";s:5:"4.2.3";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.2.3.zip";s:5:"4.3.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.3.0.zip";s:5:"4.3.1";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.3.1.zip";s:5:"4.3.2";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.3.2.zip";s:5:"4.4.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.4.0.zip";s:5:"4.4.1";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.4.1.zip";s:5:"4.4.2";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.4.2.zip";s:5:"4.4.3";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.4.3.zip";s:5:"4.4.4";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.4.4.zip";s:5:"4.4.5";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.4.5.zip";s:5:"4.4.6";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.4.6.zip";s:5:"4.5.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.5.0.zip";s:5:"4.5.1";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.5.1.zip";s:5:"4.5.2";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.5.2.zip";s:5:"4.5.3";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.5.3.zip";s:5:"4.6.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.6.0.zip";s:5:"4.6.1";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.6.1.zip";s:5:"4.6.2";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.6.2.zip";s:5:"4.6.3";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.6.3.zip";s:5:"4.7.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.7.0.zip";s:5:"4.7.1";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.7.1.zip";s:5:"4.7.2";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.7.2.zip";s:5:"4.8.0";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/shortcodes-ultimate.4.8.0.zip";s:5:"4.8.1";s:68:"http .zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:29:"https://paypal.me/anovladimir";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"1x";s:72:"https://ps.w.org/shortcodes-ultimate/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=1760590";s:2:"2x";s:72:"https://ps.w.org/shortcodes-ultimate/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1760590";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:9:"languages";s:3:"any";s:8:"category";a:1:{s:3:"any";s:4:"more";}s:3:"new";i:1;}s:20:"fast-velocity-minify";a:29:{s:4:"name";s:20:"Fast Velocity Minify";s:4:"slug";s:20:"fast-velocity-minify";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.3.5";s:6:"author";s:50:"<a href="http://fastvelocity.com">Raul Peixoto</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:38:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/alignak";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.5";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:96;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:91;i:4;i:3;i:3;i:1;i:2;i:3;i:1;i:2;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:100;s:15:"support_threads";i:22;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:22;s:10:"downloaded";i:581478;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-08-29 5:43am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2016-06-21";s:8:"homepage";s:23:"http://fastvelocity.com";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:3483:"<p>This plugin reduces HTTP requests by merging CSS &amp; Javascript files into groups of files, while attempting to use the least amount of files as possible. It minifies CSS and JS files with PHP Minify (no extra requirements).</p>
<p>Minification is done in real time and done on the frontend only during the first uncached request. Once the first request is processed, any other pages that require the same set of CSS and JavaScript will be served that same static cache file.</p>
<p>This plugin includes options for developers and advanced users, however the default settings should work just fine for most sites.</p>
<h4>Aditional Optimization</h4>
<p>I can offer you aditional <code>custom made</code> optimization on top of this plugin. If you would like to hire me, please visit my profile links for further information.</p>
<h4>Features</h4>
<ul>
<li>Merge JS and CSS files into groups to reduce the number of HTTP requests</li>
<li>Google Fonts merging and optimization</li>
<li>Handles scripts loaded both in the header &amp; footer separately</li>
<li>Keeps the order of the scripts even if you exclude some files from minification</li>
<li>Supports localized scripts (https://codex.wordpress.org/Function_Reference/wp_localize_script)</li>
<li>Minifies CSS and JS with PHP Minify only, no third party software or libraries needed.</li>
<li>Option to use YUI Compressor rather than PHP Minify (you you have &#8220;exec&#8221; and &#8220;java&#8221; available on your system).</li>
<li>Option to defer JavaScript and CSS files.</li>
<li>Stores the cache files in the uploads directory.</li>
<li>View the status and logs on the WordPress admin page.</li>
<li>Option to Minify HTML for further improvements.</li>
<li>Ability to turn off minification</li>
<li>Ability to turn off CSS or JS optimization seperatly (by disabling either css or js processing)</li>
<li>Ability to manually ignore scripts or css</li>
<li>Support for conditional scripts and styles</li>
<li>Support for multisite installations</li>
<li>Support for gzip_static on Nginx</li>
<li>Support for the CDN Enabler plugin</li>
<li>Auto purging of cache files on W3 Total Cache, WP Supercache, WP Rocket, Wp Fastest Cache, Cachify, Comet Cache, Zen Cache, LiteSpeed Cache, Nginx Cache (by Till Krüss ), SG Optimizer, HyperCache, Godaddy Managed WordPress Hosting and WP Engine (read the FAQs)</li>
<li>WP CLI support</li>
<li>Support for preconnect and preload headers</li>
<li>and some more&#8230;</li>
</ul>
<h4>WP-CLI Commands</h4>
<ul>
<li>Purge all caches: <code>wp fvm purge</code></li>
<li>Purge all caches on a network site: <code>wp --url=blog.example.com fvm purge</code></li>
<li>Purge all caches on the entire network (linux): <code>wp site list --field=url | xargs -n1 -I % wp --url=% fvm purge</code></li>
<li>Get cache size: <code>wp fvm stats</code></li>
<li>Get cache size on a network site: <code>wp --url=blog.example.com fvm stats</code></li>
<li>Get cache size on each site (linux): <code>wp site list --field=url | xargs -n1 -I % wp --url=% fvm stats</code></li>
</ul>
<h4>Notes</h4>
<ul>
<li>The JavaScript minification is by <a href="https://github.com/matthiasmullie/minify" rel="nofollow">PHP Minify</a></li>
<li>The alternative JavaScript minification is by <a href="http://yui.github.io/yuicompressor/" rel="nofollow">YUI Compressor</a></li>
<li>Compatible with Nginx, HHVM and PHP 7. </li>
<li>Minimum requirements are PHP 5.5 and WP 4.4, from version 1.4.0 onwards</li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:318:"<ol>
<li>Upload the plugin folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory or upload the zip within WordPress</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the <code>Plugins</code> menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Configure the options under: <code>Settings &gt; Fast Velocity Minify</code> and that&#8217;s it.</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:14934:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ol>
<li>Upload the plugin folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory or upload the zip within WordPress</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the <code>Plugins</code> menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Configure the options under: <code>Settings &gt; Fast Velocity Minify</code> and that&#8217;s it.</li>
</ol>
</p>
<h4>Why is Sucuri saying that there is a &#8220;potential&#8221; backdoor, or malware on the Server Info page ?</h4>
<p>
<p>It’s a false positive, but for a more indepth explanation: https://wordpress.org/support/topic/malware-alert-3/ In addition, note that I have reached out to Sucuri, which confirmed that they are aware of the false positive and are updating their signatures to remove that notice.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I exclude certain assets by wildcard?</h4>
<p>
<p>Each line on the ignore list will try to match a substring against all CSS or JS files, for example <code>//yoursite.com/wp-content/plugins/some-plugin/js/</code> will ignore all files inside that directory. You can also shorten the URL like <code>/some-plugin/js/</code> and then it will match any css or js URL that has <code>/some-plugin/js/</code> on the path. Obviously, doing <code>/js/</code> would match any files inside any &#8220;/js/&#8221; directory and in any location, so to avoid unexpected situations please always use the longest, most specific path you can use.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Why is the ignore list not working?</h4>
<p>
<p>The ignore list may be working, just try to use partial paths (see wildcard help above) and use relative urls only without any query vars.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Why are there several or lots of JS and CSS files listed on the status page, or why the cache directory takes so much space?</h4>
<p>
<p>Well, some sites and themes have a combined CSS size above 1+ MB, so when you have 200 files, that&#8217;s 200+ MB.<br />
Different pages may need different JS and CSS files per page, post, category, tag, homepage or even custom post types, but if the requirements never change and you always load the exact same files on every page, you will not see as many files. Likewise, if you have some dynamic URL for CSS or JS that always changes in each page view (the query var for example), you must add it to the ignore list (else it will generate a new cache file every page view).</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Can I update plugins and themes?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, but it&#8217;s recommended that you purge the cache (from the plugin status page) in order for the merging and minification cache files to be regenerated and for you to be sure the updates went smoothly. The plugin will also try to automatically purge some popular cache plugins, however we still recommend that you purge all caches on your cache plugin / server (whatever you use) &#8220;after&#8221; purging Fast Velocity Minify cache.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Is it compatible with other caching plugins?</h4>
<p>
<p>You must disable any features on your theme or cache plugins, which perform minification of css, html and js.<br />
The plugin will try to automatically purge several popular cache plugins, however we still recommend you to purge all caches (on whatever you use) if you also manually purge the cache on the plugin settings for some reason.<br />
The automatic purge is active for the following plugins and hosting: W3 Total Cache, WP Supercache, WP Rocket, Wp Fastest Cache, Cachify, Comet Cache, Zen Cache, LiteSpeed Cache, SG Optimizer, Godaddy Managed WordPress Hosting and WP Engine</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Is it resource intensive, or will it use too much CPU on my shared hosting plan?</h4>
<p>
<p>No, it&#8217;s not. On the first run, each single file is minified into an intermediate cache. When a new group of files is found, it reuses those files and merges them into a new static cache file. All pages that request the same group of CSS or JS files will also make use of that file.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Is it compatible with multisites?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes, it generates a new cache file for every different set of JS and CSS requirements it finds.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Is it compatible with AdSense and other ad networks?</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin is compatible with any add network but also depends on how you are loading the ads into the site. We only merge and minify css and JavaScript files enqueued in the header and footer that match your own domain name&#8230; which would exclude any external ads. If you&#8217;re using a plugin that uses JS to insert the ads on the page, there could be issues. Please report on the support forum if you found such case.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>After installing, why did my site feels slow to load?</h4>
<p>
<p>The cache regeneration happens once per URL or if the included CSS + JS files change. If you need the same set of CSS and JS files in every page, the cache file will only be generated once and reused for all other pages, however if you have a CSS or JS that is generated dynamically and uses a time based query string, (url changes on every page view), you must add it to the ignore list by wildcard.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>How do I use the pre-compressed files with gzip_static on Nginx?</h4>
<p>
<p>When we merge and minify the css and js files, we also create a <code>.gz</code> file to be used with <code>gzip_static</code> on Nginx. You need to enable this feature on your Nginx configuration file if you want to make use of it.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Where is the YUI Compressor option gone?</h4>
<p>
<p>This functionality depends on whether you have exec and java available on your system and PHP can detect it or not. It will be visible on the basic Settings page under the JavaScript Options section and it is available for JS files only.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>After installing, why are some images and sliders not working?</h4>
<p>
<p>a) You cannot do double minification, as it will break things, so make sure you have disabled any features on your theme or other plugins, which perform minification of css, html and js files.</p>
<p>b) Are you trying to use the defer JS or CSS options, without understanding exactly how it works? Be advised that most themes do not work properly with those options on.</p>
<p>c) The plugin relies on PHP Minify to minify JavaScript and css files, however it is not a perfect library and there are plugins that are already minified and do not output a min.js or min.css name and end up being minified again. Try to disable minification on JS and CSS files and purge the cache.</p>
<p>d) Sometimes a plugin conflicts with another when merged. Try to disable CSS processing first and see if it works. Try to disable JS processing second and see if it works. Try to disable HTML minification last and see if it works. If one of those work, you know there is a conflict.</p>
<p>e) If you have a conflict, try to add each CSS and each JS to the ignore list, one by one until you find the one that causes the conflict. If you have no idea of which files to add, check the log file on the status page for a list of files.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Why are some of the CSS and JS files not being merged?</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin only processes (same domain) JS and CSS files enqueued using the official method outlined here: https://developer.wordpress.org/themes/basics/including-css-javascript/</p>
<p>Some developers enqueue all files properly but might still &#8220;print&#8221; conditional tags directly in the header, while they should be following the example as explained on the codex: https://developer.wordpress.org/reference/functions/wp_script_add_data/</p>
<p>Because &#8220;printing CSS and JS tags on the header and footer is evil&#8221; (seriously), we cannot capture those files and merge them together.</p>
<p>There are also specific ways to enqueue files meant to be loaded for IE users only, mobile users, desktop users, printers, etc., else those may be merged together and break things. There is a blacklist and default ignore list on the PRO tab because of this.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I load CSS async, get the critical path or why is there a flash of unstyled content when I enable this?</h4>
<p>
<p>This is an advanced option for highly skilled developers. Do not try to fiddle with these settings if you are not one, as it will almost certainly break your site layout and functionality.</p>
<p>Loading CSS async only works properly and consistently, when you have one single CSS file being generated and your critical path is generic enough to be common on all pages.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>How to undo all changes done by the plugin?</h4>
<p>
<p>The plugin itself does not do any &#8220;changes&#8221; to your site and all original files are untouched. It intercepts the enqueued CSS and JS files, processes and hides them, while enqueuing the newly optimized cached version of those files. As with any plugin, simply disable or uninstall the plugin, purge all caches you may have in use (plugins, server, cloudflare, etc.) and the site will go back to what it was before installing it. The plugin does not delete anything from the database or modify any of your files.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Why is it that even though I have disabled or deleted the plugin, the design is still broken?</h4>
<p>
<p>Some &#8220;cheap&#8221; or so called &#8220;optimized&#8221; hosting providers, implement a misconfigured and aggressive cache on their servers, and then are &#8220;smart&#8221; enough to ignore your multiple cache purge requests if those are too frequent.</p>
<p>Some providers use a &#8220;deploy system&#8221;, where you upload / replace / delete the files via sftp, but those are not reflected on the live site immediately. This means that in some cases, you can delete your whole WordPress installation via sftp, and the site still works perfectly fine even after purging the cache.</p>
<p>You may have deleted the physical files from the disk, but that&#8217;s either just some random storage they gave you and that they sync to the main server every few hours, or it may be the actual live server but with a file cache layer on top of it (so the old code keeps running even though you have deleted the files).</p>
<p>The only solution is to contact your hosting company and ask them why you have deleted the plugin and purged your cache, but the live site does not reflect the changes.</p>
<p>Providers well known to have this issue are hostgator and iPage (please report others if you find them).</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Why is my Visual Composer or Page Editor not working?</h4>
<p>
<p>Some plugins and themes need to edit the layout and styles on the frontend. When they need to do that, they enqueue several extra js and css files that are caught by this plugin and are merged, when in fact those need to load separately. If you encounter such issue of your page editor not working on the frontend, kindly enable the &#8220;Fix Page Editors&#8221; and purge your caches.</p>
<p>This option hides all optimization from logged in users, so it is as if the plugin has been disabled. Not logged in users and search engines, still see the optimized version.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>How should I use the &#8220;Preload Images&#8221; and what is it for?</h4>
<p>
<p>Certain themes and plugins, either load large images or sliders on the homepage. Most of them will also load &#8220;above the fold&#8221; causing the &#8220;Prioritize visible content&#8221; or the &#8220;Eliminate render-blocking JavaScript and CSS in above-the-fold content&#8221; message on pagespeed insights.</p>
<p>While this may not work when the images are large, you can use the &#8220;Preload Images&#8221; for the first relevant images that load above the fold, such as the logo or the first image of a slider. Please note however, this is for images that show up in all pages, not just the homepage.</p>
<p>Do not put too many images here as those are downloaded in high priority and it will slow down the rest of the page load.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>What are the recommended cloudflare settings for this plugin?</h4>
<p>
<p>On the &#8220;Speed&#8221; tab, deselect the Auto Minify for JavaScript, CSS and HTML as well as the Rocket Loader option as there is no benefit of using them with our plugin (we already minify things).</p>
<p>Those options can also break the design due to double minification or the fact that the Rocket Loader is still experimental (you can read about that on the &#8220;Help&#8221; link under each selected option on cloudflare).</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>I have a complaint or I need support right now. Why haven&#8217;t you replied to my topic on the support forum yet?</h4>
<p>
<p>Before getting angry because you have no answer within a few hours (even with paid plugins, sometimes it takes weeks&#8230;), please be informed about how wordpress.org and the plugins directory work.</p>
<p>The plugins directory is an open source, free service where developers and programmers contribute (on their free time) with plugins that can be downloaded and installed by anyone &#8220;at their own risk&#8221; and are all released under the GPL license.</p>
<p>While all plugins have to be approved and reviewed by the WordPress team before being published (for dangerous code, spam, etc.) this does not change the license or add any warranty. All plugins are provided as they are, free of charge and should be used at your own risk (so you should make backups before installing any plugin or performing updates) and it is your sole responsibility if you break your site after installing a plugin from the plugins directory.</p>
<p>Support is provided by plugin authors on their free time and without warranty of a reply, so you can experience different levels of support level from plugin to plugin. As the author of this plugin I strive to provide support on a daily basis and I can take a look and help you with some issues related with my plugin, but please note that this is done out of my goodwill and in no way I have any legal or moral obligation for doing this. I am also available for hiring if you need custom-made speed optimizations (check my profile links).</p>
<p>For a full version of the license, please read: https://wordpress.org/about/gpl/</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I get support or report bugs?</h4>
<p>
<p>You can get support on the official WordPress plugin page at https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/fast-velocity-minify<br />
You can also see my profile and check my links if you wish to hire me for custom speed optimization on WordPress or extra features.</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I donate to the plugin author?</h4>
<p>
<p>If you would like to donate any amount to the plugin author (thank you in advance), you can do it via PayPal at https://goo.gl/vpLrSV</p>
<p>&#8230;</p>
</p>

settings.";}}s:4:"tags";a:5:{s:8:"gtmetrix";s:8:"gtmetrix";s:9:"pagespeed";s:9:"pagespeed";s:10:"php-minify";s:10:"PHP Minify";s:7:"pingdom";s:7:"pingdom";s:14:"yui-compressor";s:14:"YUI Compressor";}s:8:"versions";a:16:{s:5:"2.2.0";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.0.zip";s:5:"2.2.1";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.1.zip";s:5:"2.2.2";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.2.zip";s:5:"2.2.3";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.3.zip";s:5:"2.2.4";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.4.zip";s:5:"2.2.5";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.5.zip";s:5:"2.2.6";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.6.zip";s:5:"2.2.7";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.7.zip";s:5:"2.2.8";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.8.zip";s:5:"2.2.9";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.2.9.zip";s:5:"2.3.0";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.3.0.zip";s:5:"2.3.1";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.3.1.zip";s:5:"2.3.2";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.3.2.zip";s:5:"2.3.4";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.3.4.zip";s:5:"2.3.5";s:69:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.2.3.5.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:63:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/fast-velocity-minify.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:0:"";s:5:"icons";a:1:{s:2:"1x";s:73:"https://ps.w.org/fast-velocity-minify/assets/icon-128x128.jpg?rev=1440946";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:9:"languages";s:3:"any";s:8:"category";a:1:{s:3:"any";s:4:"more";}s:3:"new";i:1;}s:12:"a3-lazy-load";a:29:{s:4:"name";s:12:"a3 Lazy Load";s:4:"slug";s:12:"a3-lazy-load";s:7:"version";s:5:"1.9.1";s:6:"author";s:47:"<a href="https://a3rev.com/">a3rev Software</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:36:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/a3rev";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.5";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:88;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:67;i:4;i:2;i:3;i:3;i:2;i:2;i:1;i:9;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:83;s:15:"support_threads";i:21;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:2;s:10:"downloaded";i:526531;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-08-11 2:48am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2014-12-20";s:8:"homepage";s:0:"";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:8034:"<p>a3 Lazy Load is a Mobile Oriented, very simple to use plugin that will speed up sites page load speed. The more content heavy your site the better the plugin will perform and the more you will see the improvements in performance. See <a href="http://ressio.github.io/lazy-load-xt/demo/stresstest1000img.htm" rel="nofollow">this demo</a> of a page with 1,000 images (yes 1,000 images) to load.</p>
<p>a3 Lazy Load is inspired by and powered by the ressio <a href="https://github.com/ressio/lazy-load-xt" rel="nofollow">Lazy-Load-xt JavaScript</a>.</p>
<p>a3 Lazy Load is the most fully featured, incredibly easy to set up lazy load plugin for WordPress. Use the plugins admin settings to easily define what elements are lazy loaded and when they become visible in the users browser. As the user scrolls down the page the next lot of elements you have applied lazy Load to are only loaded as they become visible in the view port.</p>
<h4>IMAGE LAZY LOAD</h4>
<p>Images are the number one element that slows page load and increases bandwidth use. From the a3 Lazy Load admin panel turn load images by a3 Lazy Load ON | OFF. For more flexibility when ON you can choose to ON | OFF lazy load for images in</p>
<ul>
<li>Post, Pages and Custom Post Types (All Content areas)</li>
<li>Widgets (Sidebar, header and footer)</li>
<li>Apply to post thumbnails</li>
<li>Apply to gravatars</li>
</ul>
<h4>MORE THAN JUST IMAGES</h4>
<h4>VIDEO LAZY LOAD</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load supports all WordPress video Embeds including Youtube, Vimeo and HTML5 video &#8211; for a full list see the <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Embeds" rel="nofollow">WordPress Codex Embeds</a> list. The WordPress embed method of copying and pasting the video url into posts and pages content area is fully supported.</p>
<p><strong>Note</strong> &#8211; Works with Videos added by Text and HTML Widgets but not the new WordPress Video widget. That widget does not pull iframe at first load, it use JavaScript to replace html to iframe and hence a3 lazy Load can&#8217;t see it to apply.</p>
<p>From the a3 lazy Load admin panel turn Video Support ON | OFF. When ON you can choose to ON | OFF lazy load for videos in</p>
<ul>
<li>Video embeded by URL in Post and Pages (All Content areas)</li>
<li>Video in Widget types, Text Widget and HTML Wigets.</li>
<li>Youtube <a href="http://ressio.github.io/lazy-load-xt/demo/youtube-iframe.htm" rel="nofollow">see demo</a></li>
<li>Video <a href="http://ressio.github.io/lazy-load-xt/demo/video-html5.htm" rel="nofollow">see demo</a></li>
<li>Fully Compatible with the popular <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/youtube-embed/">Youtube Embed Plugin</a></li>
</ul>
<h4>iFRAME LAZY LOAD</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load has built in support for content that is added by iframe from any source in content and widgets. Examples</p>
<ul>
<li>WordPress embedded media</li>
<li>Facebook Like boxes with profiles, Like buttons, Recommend</li>
<li>Google+ Profile</li>
<li>Google Maps</li>
</ul>
<h4>POST EMBED</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fully compatible with WordPress embed post on any site feature introduced in version WP version 4.4</li>
<li>Makes embed post load much faster</li>
</ul>
<h4>WORDPRESS AMP</h4>
<ul>
<li>Built in auto support for WordPress AMP plugin</li>
<li>Built in support for Better AMP plugin</li>
<li>There are no setting options for exclude /amp &#8211; Lazy Load is just never applied to the /amp endpoint</li>
<li>When the url is loaded in browser without /amp Lazy Load is applied </li>
</ul>
<h4>ADVANCED CUSTOM FIELDS</h4>
<p>Fully compatible with the very popular Advanced Custom Fields plugin, Free and Premium versions.</p>
<h4>LAZY LOAD EFFECTS</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load gives you the option to lazy load images with a FADE IN or SPINNER effect</p>
<ul>
<li>FADEIN <a href="http://ressio.github.io/lazy-load-xt/demo/fadein.htm" rel="nofollow">see demo</a></li>
<li>SPINNER <a href="http://ressio.github.io/lazy-load-xt/demo/spinner.htm" rel="nofollow">see demo</a></li>
<li>Option to create a custom Lazy Load pre-load background colour</li>
</ul>
<h4>WOOCOMMERCE</h4>
<p>a3 lazy Load is built and tested to be fully compatible with the very widely used WooCommerce plugin</p>
<h4>PERFORMANCE TWEAKS</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load gives you the option to load its script from your sites HEAD or from the FOOT.</p>
<ul>
<li>Note that your theme must have the wp_footer() function if you select FOOTER load.</li>
<li>Note the plugin CSS is always loaded from the HEAD.</li>
</ul>
<h4>EXCLUDE IMAGES &amp; VIDEO</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load allows you to easily exclude any image or video by class name from having the Lazy Load effect applied. <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/a3-lazy-load/#faq-header">See FAQ&#8217;s</a></p>
<h4>JAVASCIPT DISABLED FALLBACK</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load has built in Noscript fallback if user has JavaScript turned off in their browser. Developers who use underscore.js in their applications can use the Noscript parameter to exclude their plugins content from Lazy Load.</p>
<h4>THEME &amp; PLUGIN COMPATIBILITY</h4>
<p>a3 Lazy Load works with any WordPress theme that follows the WordPress Theme Codex. However, many Theme &amp; Plugin developers will use a custom written function to add objects, example the theme has a home page with layout created by a custom function they have written. a3 Lazy Load cannot know what these functions are and so cannot apply to the objects loaded by that custom function.</p>
<p>If your images or objects not being Lazy Loaded in a certain section of your site, but are Lazy Loaded everywhere else you will know this is the cause. Please if this happens raise a support ticket with the developer, explaining that they just need to add a simple tag to their custom functions so that a3 Lazy Load apply to their custom function and be fully compatible. <a href="https://wordpress.org/plugins/a3-lazy-load/#faq-header">Here is a list</a> of a3 lazy Load filter tags to include in your ticket to make it easy for the developer.</p>
<p>Don&#8217;t forget when a developer does add full compatibility with a3 Lazy Load please let us know via a support ticket on this forum and we will add them to the list below.</p>
<p>These are just some of the more popular plugins that are either tested 100% compatible with a3 Lazy Load or tags has been added for 100% compatibility.</p>
<ul>
<li>Plugin &#8211; Advanced Custom Fields</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; WooCommerce</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; WP Offload</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; WP Super Cache and W3 Total Cache plugins</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; Youtube Embed</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; WordPress AMP</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; WPTouch. Note &#8211; Set to not apply on Mobiles if WPTouch is installed</li>
<li>Plugin &#8211; MobilePress &#8211; Set to not apply on Mobiles if MobilePress is installed</li>
<li>Plugins &#8211; Will not conflict with any plugin that has lazy load built in</li>
<li>CDN&#8217;s &#8211; Cloudfront, Cloudflare and all other known CDN architecture.</li>
</ul>
<h4>MORE FEATURES</h4>
<ul>
<li>Full support of jQueryMobile framework</li>
<li>WordPress Multi site ready.</li>
<li>Backend support for RTL display.</li>
<li>Translation ready</li>
</ul>
<h4>JOIN THE a3 LAZY LOAD COMMUNITY</h4>
<p>When you download a3 lazy Load, you join our community. Regardless of if you are a WordPress newbie or experienced developer if you are interested in contributing to a3 Lazy Load development head over to the <a href="https://github.com/a3rev/a3-lazy-load" rel="nofollow">a3 Lazy Load GitHub Repository</a> to find out how you can contribute.<br />
Want to add a new language to a3 Lazy Load? Great! You can contribute via <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/a3-lazy-load" rel="nofollow">translate.wordpress.org</a></p>
<h3>USAGE</h3>
<ol>
<li>Install and activate the plugin</li>
<li>Open WordPress Settings menu</li>
<li>Click on a3 Lazy Load menu</li>
<li>Turn ON Lazy Load and all preferred settings</li>
<li>Save Changes and enjoy the improved performance Lazy Load will give your site</li>
</ol>
";s:12:"installation";s:186:"<h4>Minimum Requirements</h4>
<ul>
<li>WordPress 4.6 or greater</li>
<li>PHP version 5.6.0 or greater</li>
<li>MySQL version 5.6 or greater OR MariaDB version 10.0 or greater</li>
</ul>
";s:3:"faq";s:2173:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<h4>Minimum Requirements</h4>
<ul>
<li>WordPress 4.6 or greater</li>
<li>PHP version 5.6.0 or greater</li>
<li>MySQL version 5.6 or greater OR MariaDB version 10.0 or greater</li>
</ul>
</p>
<h4>How do I exclude individual objects from Lazy Load?</h4>
<p>
<p>Use this built in class name to exclude lazy load on individual images, videos and iframes.<br />
    a3-notlazy</p>
</p>
<h4>Why are some images, videos, objects not Lazy Loaded?</h4>
<p>
<p>a3 Lazy Load can only be applied to objects that are added using core WordPress functions. If your theme or a plugin developer adds objects such as images or videos via a custom written function, a3 lazy Load cannot know what that custom function is and hence cannot Lazy Load the object.</p>
<p>So if you see object not being lazy loaded please check first if those objects are loaded by the theme or a plugin. If they are, you can be confident that they are loaded by a custom function.</p>
<p>If this is the case, please help yourself and other a3 lazy Load users by raising a support ticket with the developer and ask them to add an a3 Lazy Load filter tag to their function to allow a3 Lazy Load to find it and apply to the object.</p>
<p>Below is a list of available a3 Lazy Load filters to use and pass onto the developer.</p>
</p>
<h4>Filter tags to apply lazy load</h4>
<p>
<p>Apply lazy load for images in content.<br />
    a3_lazy_load_images<br />
Example:<br />
    apply_filters( &#8216;a3_lazy_load_images&#8217;, $your_content, null );</p>
<p>Apply lazy load for videos and iframe from content.<br />
    a3_lazy_load_videos<br />
Example:<br />
    apply_filters( &#8216;a3_lazy_load_videos&#8217;, $your_content, null );</p>
<p>Apply lazy load for all images, videos and iframe from content<br />
    a3_lazy_load_html<br />
Example:<br />
    apply_filters( &#8216;a3_lazy_load_html&#8217;, $your_content, null );</p>
</p>
<h4>Filter Tags to Exclude by Theme Class name</h4>
<p>
<p>Filter tags to add to class name of theme to exclude lazy load on images or videos.<br />
    a3_lazy_load_skip_images_classes<br />
    a3_lazy_load_skip_videos_classes</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:20771:"<h4>1.9.1 &#8211; 2018/08/10</h4>
<ul>
<li>This maintenance update resolves 2 issues from the v 1.9.0 upgrade</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Set min-width of placeholder to resolve any image tag that does not have width or height not showing the spinner effect. Example Gutenberg image block.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Update Lazy Load extra script to resolve duplicated call time for images, iframe, videos on viewport</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.9.0 &#8211; 2018/08/06</h4>
<ul>
<li>This feature upgrade is focused on adding a number of new options for excluding Lazy Load from sections of a site. Compatibility with WordPress 4.9.8, Gutenberg 3.4.0 and WooCommerce 3.4.4</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add exclude from Lazy Load by URI</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add exclude from Lazy Load by Page types</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add support for using Wildcards in images and videos skipped classes</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Upgrade lazyloadxt lib to latest version 1.1.0</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Rename jquery.lazyloadxt.js to jquery.lazyloadxt.extra.js</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add new Exclude by URI’s and Page Types Options box and help text</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Test for compatibility with WordPress 4.9.8</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Test for compatibility with WooCommerce 3.4.4</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Test for compatibility with Gutenberg 3.4.0</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Make Skip Classes feature work when have entered it to that list</li>
<li>Credit &#8211; Props to Kurt @AMPERAGE-Marketing for his contribution to this release</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.9 &#8211; 2018/06/04</h4>
<ul>
<li>This Maintenance update has 2 code tweaks for compatibility with themes and plugins that load images via the wp_kses_post sanitizer as WooCommerce does since version 3.4.0 with widgets and on Cart page.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Append lazy attributes to attribute list of allowed post tags list so that lazy load can run on frontend when that content is output via wp_kses_post </li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add noscript tag to allowed post tags list to resolve duplicate image if that image is output via wp_kses_post</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Test for compatibility with WooCommerce version 3.4.1</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.8 &#8211; 2018/05/26</h4>
<ul>
<li>This maintenance update is for compatibility with WordPress 4.9.6 and the new GDPR compliance requirements for users in the EU </li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Test for compatibility with WordPress 4.9.6</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Check for any issues with GDPR compliance. None Found</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.7 &#8211; 2018/03/24</h4>
<ul>
<li>Maintenance Update. 2 code tweaks to enhance the lazy loading of images, video and iframe added by third party shortcodes in the content</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Increase lazy load filter priority value so that lazy load is applied to images loaded by the shortcode function do_shortcode </li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Increase lazy load filter priority value so that lazy load is applied to video and iframe loaded by the shortcode function do_shortcode</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.6 &#8211; 2018/03/24</h4>
<ul>
<li>Maintenance Update. 1 bug fix from this morning 1.8.5 major maintenance release. A small piece of new code in v 1.8.5 was written on PHP v7 and is not compatible with PHP version 5.6 If you are running v PHP 5.6 please run this update to fix it</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; PHP Fatal Error Call instance a3_lazy_load instead of us $this is not an object caused by incompatibility with PHP version 5.6</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.5 &#8211; 2018/03/23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Maintenance Update. Refactor of Lazy Load on Widgets, Full Compatibility with the Advanced Custom Fields plugin, optimization tweaks and 3 bug fixes.</li>
<li>Refactor &#8211; Apply lazy load to all widgets instead of Text Widget and HTML widget from WordPress</li>
<li>Refactor &#8211; Remove the code that hook to tag &#8216;wp_get_attachment_image_attributes&#8217; which was required to add support for lazy load for [gallery] shortcode. Redundant after WP version 4.6.0 and now removed.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add filter to acf_the_content tag for apply lazy load on the Content from ACF plugin. Kudos to @ondoheer for creating full compatibility with ACF Free and Premium version. </li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Disable load new google fonts via API. Google fonts not used and saves 4 calls to database on each page load. Thanks to Robert Harm for reporting the issue</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Optimized loading gif compression for even faster load. Thanks @jasom for the suggestion</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Remove duplicate parameters from plugin scripts. Thanks to @galbaras for reporting the issue</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Add new FAQs tab to plugins page with Add Lazy Load Tags to custom Function description and exclude Lazy Load Class name for easy reference.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Update plugins description</li>
<li>Framework &#8211; Define filter tag for enable OR disable load new google fonts via API</li>
<li>Framework &#8211; Update plugin framework to new version 2.0.3</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Turn Image in Widget OFF option which had stopped working. Thanks to @japenz and @dimitar-koev for reporting and confirming the bug</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; If videos embed have preload=none do not call video load from a3 Lazy Load. Thanks to Celso Azevedo @celsoazevedo for an excellent bug report which enabled us to replicate the issue.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Remove src with placeholder image url for iframe</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.8.4 &#8211; 2018/02/13</h4>
<ul>

<li>Framework &#8211; Add Framework version for all style and script files</li>

<h4>1.7.0 &#8211; 2016/03/01</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Full compatibility with AMP plugin. No settings for it just hardcoded that Lazy Load is not applied for any url appended with /amp endpoint. Lazy load is applied to the url without the endpoint</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Define new &#8216;Background Color&#8217; type on plugin framework with ON | OFF switch to disable background or enable it</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Define new function &#8211; hextorgb() &#8211; for convert hex color to rgb color on plugin framework</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Define new function &#8211; generate_background_color_css() &#8211; for export background style code on plugin framework that is used to make custom style</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Saved the time number into database for one time customize style and Save change on the Plugin Settings</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Replace version number by time number for dynamic style file are generated by Sass to solve the issue get cache file on CDN server</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Define new &#8216;strip_methods&#8217; argument for Uploader type, allow strip http/https or no</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Upgraded to the latest version of a3 plugin framework</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress version 4.4.2</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WooCommerce version 2.5.2</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Define new placeholder image data for iframe. Microsoft browsers smartscreen filter was blocking the .gif placeholder loading inside iframes and throwing an unsafe website message</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.6.0 &#8211; 2016/01/22</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Add support for Lazy loading images, video or iframe inside content that is loaded by AJAX</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Full support for loading Product Thumbnails within the WooCommerce cart widget</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress version 4.4.1</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WooCommerce version 2.5</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5.2 &#8211; 2015/12/24</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change on enqueue styles and scripts for faster load</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Register new script &#8216;jquery-lazyloadxt-srcset&#8217; for enqueue when lazyload script is called , full support for WP 4.4 Responsive Images</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Filter for change the &#8216;srcset&#8217; attribute name to &#8216;data-srcset&#8217; name to prevent browsers loading the image while page is loading</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Create a new script for when image comes into view port that it changes &#8216;data-srcset&#8217; to &#8216;srcset&#8217; so image is loaded then by lazy load</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5.1 &#8211; 2015/12/11</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change the placeholder image name from &#8216;placeholder.gif&#8217; to &#8216;lazy_placeholder.gif&#8217; to avoid conflict if thumb image has name like placehoder.gif</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change pattern parameter from &#8220;/data-src=[&#8216;\&#8221;]/is&#8221; to &#8220;/ data-src=[&#8216;\&#8221;]/is&#8221; to check &#8216;data-src&#8217; exists as attribute of video, image, iframe, Solve the issue when 3rd party script adds attribute with format of name &#8216;***-data-src&#8217; to html tag.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Use preg_match( &#8220;/src=.*lazy_placeholder.gif[&#8216;\&#8221;]/s&#8221;, $imgHTML ) On themes that have loop code was causing loading of the placeholder instead of the image</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.5.0 &#8211; 2015/12/10</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Change media uploader to New UI of WordPress media uploader with WordPress Backbone and Underscore</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Apply Lazy Load for new Embed Post feature on WordPress 4.4</li>

<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated a3 Plugin Framework to the latest version</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Full compatibility with Responsive Image feature on WordPress 4.4</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Change the PlaceHolder image from data image to real image placeholder.gif for fix display on IE</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress major version 4.4</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Check if &#8216;HTTP_USER_AGENT&#8217; is defined before call it from strpos</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.4.1 &#8211; 2015/08/22</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; include new CSSMin lib from https://github.com/tubalmartin/YUI-CSS-compressor-PHP-port into plugin framework instead of old CSSMin lib from http://code.google.com/p/cssmin/ , to avoid conflict with plugins or themes that have CSSMin lib</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; make __construct() function for &#8216;Compile_Less_Sass&#8217; class instead of using a method with the same name as the class for compatibility on WP 4.3 and is deprecated on PHP4</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; change class name from &#8216;lessc&#8217; to &#8216;a3_lessc&#8217; so that it does not conflict with plugins or themes that have another Lessc lib</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Plugin Framework DB query optimization. Refactored settings_get_option call for dynamic style elements, example typography, border, border_styles, border_corner, box_shadow</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WordPress major version 4.3.0</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Update the plugin framework for setup correct default settings on first installed</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Update the plugin framework for reset to correct default settings when hit on &#8216;Reset Settings&#8217; button on each settings tab</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.4.0 &#8211; 2015/06/17</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Plugin framework Mobile First focus upgrade</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Massive improvement in admin UI and UX in PC, tablet and mobile browsers</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Introducing opening and closing Setting Boxes on admin panels.</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added Plugin Framework Customization settings. Control how the admin panel settings show when editing.</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added House Keeping &#8211; Clean up on Deletion function. ON | OFF switch is in the Plugin Framework Settings Box.  </li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added a 260px wide images to the right sidebar for support forum link, Documentation links.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested for full compatibility with WooCommerce Version 2.3.11</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Removed Add-Ons Menu</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Moved plugin menu from WordPress Dashboard admin menu to a sub menu on the WordPress Settings menu</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added Settings link to the plugins listing on plugin.php menu for easy access to plugin</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Check &#8216;request_filesystem_credentials&#8217; function, if it does not exists then require the core php lib file from WP where it is defined</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.3.0 &#8211; 2015/06/05</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added Image Load Threshold with set threshold pixel dynamic setting. Default is 0px</li>
<li>Credit &#8211; Thanks to <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/setting-threshold?replies=3" rel="nofollow">Onisforos and Matt Pain</a> for suggesting and explaining the new Threshold feature</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.2.2 &#8211; 2015/06/03</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Security Hardening. Removed all php file_put_contents functions in the plugin framework and replace with the WP_Filesystem API</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Security Hardening. Removed all php file_get_contents functions in the plugin framework and replace with the WP_Filesystem API</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.2.1 &#8211; 2015/05/26</h4>
<ul>
<li>Fix &#8211; Update url of dynamic stylesheet in uploads folder to the format <code>//domain.com/</code> so it&#8217;s always is correct when loaded as <code>http</code> or <code>https</code></li>
<li>Credit &#8211; Thanks to WordPress member hero12 for bringing the matter <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/topic/css-is-not-loaded-properly-on-https?replies=1" rel="nofollow">to our attention</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.2.0 &#8211; 2015/05/18</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added new extend script to support event when click or tap on tab to load images without having to scroll to initiate load.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested and Tweaked for full compatibility with WordPress Version 4.2.2</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Changed Permission 777 to 755 for style folder inside the uploads folder</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Chmod 644 for dynamic style and .less files from uploads folder</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.1.1 &#8211; 2015/04/21</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Tested and Tweaked for full compatibility with WordPress Version 4.2.0</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Update style of plugin framework. Removed the [data-icon] selector to prevent conflict with other plugins that have font awesome icons</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.1.0 &#8211; 2015/01/23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added support for all WordPress video Embeds including Youtube, Vimeo and HTML5 video</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added support for content that is added by iframe from any source in post and page content and widgets</li>
<li>Feature &#8211; Added ON | OFF option for Noscript parameter for both images and video and iframes &#8211; fallback if user does not have JavaScript support turned on in browser.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Reworked the plugins admin panel for new feature options. Separate settings for Images and Video / iframes</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated all the admin panel text and add new help text.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated the plugins WordPress description with new features.</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated the plugins WordPress screenshot</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Updated the plugins WordPress banner image.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Updated &#8216;a3_lazy_load_enable&#8217; function to edit their image or video attribute to enable a3 lazy load images or videos loaded by 3rd party application.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_image_enable&#8217; function to edit image attribute to enable a3 lazy load to apply images loaded by 3rd party applications.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_video_enable&#8217; function to edit image attribute so a3 lazy load script can apply to the videos, iframe.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Include &#8216;var a3_lazyload_params = {&#8220;apply_images&#8221;:&#8221;1&#8243;,&#8221;apply_videos&#8221;:&#8221;1&#8243;};&#8217; JavaScript variable into frontend that get the option that are set from admin panel. Plugin and Theme developers can use that variable inside own script to check when Lazy Load apply for Image and for Video instead of use &#8216;a3_lazy_load_video_enable&#8217; and &#8216;a3_lazy_load_video_enable&#8217; functions in PHP code</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Remove &#8216;a3_lazy_load_skip_classes&#8217; filter tag, we will replace another filter for separate filters for image and videos</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_skip_images_classes&#8217; filter tag. Developers can add another class css name for images that they don&#8217;t want lazy load applied too.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_skip_videos_classes&#8217; filter tag. Developers can add another class css name for video that they don&#8217;t want lazy load applied too.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added default exclude class &#8216;a3-notlazy&#8217; so developers can easily apply it to videos that they don&#8217;t want Lazy Load to apply to.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_videos&#8217; filter. Plugin and Theme developers can use this filter and parse the content with videos or iframe and the filter will return content with change on videos or iframe that a3 Lazy Load support</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.2 &#8211; 2015/01/20</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Include wp_deregister_script( &#8216;jquery-lazyloadxt&#8217; ) before wp_enqueue_script( &#8216;jquery-lazyloadxt&#8217; ) for compatibility with a3 Portfolio plugin which supports video slides</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Add new parameter $noscript boolen type for &#8216;a3_lazy_load_html&#8217; and &#8216;a3_lazy_load_images&#8217; filters to exclude or include noscript from content return of 3rd party plugins.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Added default exclude class &#8216;a3-notlazy&#8217; so developers can easily apply it to images that they don&#8217;t want Lazy Load to apply to.</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.1 &#8211; 2014/12/23</h4>
<ul>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Applied lazy load for &#8216;wp_get_attachment_image_attributes&#8217; filter tag for WordPress default [gallery] shortcode</li>
<li>Tweak &#8211; Added link to a3 Lazy Load wordpress.org support forum on plugins description that show on plugins menu</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_enable&#8217; function when Enable Lazy Load is set to ON. Plugin and Theme developers can use the function to edit their image attribute so that a3 lazy load script can apply to the images.</li>
<li>Dev &#8211; Defined &#8216;a3_lazy_load_skip_classes&#8217; filter tag. Developers can add another class css name for images that they don&#8217;t want lazy load applied too.</li>
<li>Fix &#8211; Lazy Load does not apply to images added by shortcode, excluding the WordPress default [gallery] shortcode</li>
</ul>
<h4>1.0.0 &#8211; 2014/12/20</h4>
<ul>
<li>First working release</li>
</ul>
