Podcast Publisher";s:4:"slug";s:39:"podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress";s:7:"version";s:6:"2.7.17";s:6:"author";s:40:"<a href="http://podlove.org">Podlove</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:39:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/eteubert";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.4";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.4";s:6:"rating";i:90;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:28;i:4;i:1;i:3;i:1;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:3;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:33;s:15:"support_threads";i:2;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:1;s:10:"downloaded";i:120098;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2018-11-05 7:46am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2012-06-26";s:8:"homepage";s:28:"http://publisher.podlove.org";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:3419:"<p>We built the Podlove Podcast Publisher because existing solutions are stuck in the past, complex and unwieldy. The Publisher helps you save time, worry less and provides a cutting edge listening experience for your audience.</p>
<p>Official Site: <a href="http://publisher.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">publisher.podlove.org</a></p>
<h4>Video Tutorial: Getting started with Podlove Publisher</h4>
<span class="embed-youtube" style="text-align:center; display: block;"><iframe class='youtube-player' type='text/html' width='640' height='390' src='https://www.youtube.com/embed/Hmrm-jUe6u4?version=3&#038;rel=1&#038;fs=1&#038;autohide=2&#038;showsearch=0&#038;showinfo=1&#038;iv_load_policy=1&#038;wmode=transparent' allowfullscreen='true' style='border:0;'></iframe></span>
<h4>Compatible Feeds</h4>
<p>The Publisher makes it easy to create highly expressive, efficient and super compatible podcast feeds with fine grained control over client behavior (e.g. GUID control to replace faulty episodes and for clients to reload) supporting all important meta data.</p>
<h4>Multi-Format Publishing</h4>
<p>The Publisher also makes multi-format publishing &#8211; embracing all modern and legacy audio and video codecs &#8211; a snap. By adopting simple file name conventions, the plugin allows the podcaster to provide individual feeds for certain use cases or audiences without adding work for the podcaster during the publishing process.</p>
<h4>Optimized Web Player</h4>
<p>The Publisher also comes with integrated with the Podlove Web Player plugin (which you do not need to install separately) and fully support its advanced options including multiple audio (MP4 AAC, MP3, Vorbis, Opus) and video (MP4 H.264, WebM, Theora) format support for web browsers. This Web Player is fully HTML5 compatible (but provides Flash fallback for ancient environments) and is ready for all touch based clients too.</p>
<h4>Chapter Support</h4>
<p>The Publisher also makes it easy to publish chapter information in the player to make access to structured episodes even easier. Full support for linking directly to any part of your podcast on the web with instant playback included.</p>
<h4>Flexible Templates</h4>
<p>To round it all up, a flexible template system enables you to published Podcasts in a defined fashion and change the style at any time without having to touch your individual postings later on.</p>
<p>And this is just the beginning. We have a rich roadmap that will bring even more interesting features: integration with helpful services, much improved timeline metadata support (show notes) and much more.</p>
<h4>Further Reading</h4>
<ul>
<li><a href="http://publisher.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">Podlove Publisher</a></li>
<li><a href="http://podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">Podlove Project</a></li>
<li><a href="https://community.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">Podlove Community</a></li>
<li><a href="http://docs.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">Documentation</a></li>
<li><a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues" rel="nofollow">Bug Tracker</a></li>
<li><a href="http://podlove.org/donations/" rel="nofollow">Donate</a></li>
</ul>
<p>Development of the plugin is an open process. The current version is available <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher" rel="nofollow">on GitHub</a> Feel free to contribute and to fix errors or send improvements via GitHub.</p>
<p>Requires PHP 5.4+</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:410:"<ol>
<li>Download the Podlove Publisher Plugin to your desktop.</li>
<li>If downloaded as a zip archive, extract the Plugin folder to your desktop.</li>
<li>With your FTP program, upload the Plugin folder to the wp-content/plugins folder in your WordPress directory online.</li>
<li>Go to Plugins screen and find the newly uploaded Plugin in the list.</li>
<li>Click Activate Plugin to activate it.</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:2253:"
<h4>Is Podlove Podcast Publisher free?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes! The core features of Podlove Podcast Publisher are and always will be free. <a href="https://publisher.podlove.org/support/" rel="nofollow">Paid Professional Support</a> is available but not necessary to run the plugin.</p>
</p>
<h4>Are there Download Statistics?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes! Podcast Downloads can be tracked and analyzed. You can easily see how many people downloaded you podcast episodes, which clients they used, if they prefer to subscribe to the feed or listen on your website using the web player—and much more.</p>
</p>
<h4>Are there Privacy / GDPR considerations?</h4>
<p>
<p>Podlove Publisher is GDPR compliant and provides prewritten text snippets for your privacy page. See https://docs.podlove.org/podlove-publisher/guides/dsgvo-gdpr.html</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I host my podcast files?</h4>
<p>
<p>Any storage where you have control over the file naming is compatible with Podlove Podcast Publisher. You can manage files using a simple FTP/sFTP or use services like Amazon S3.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where can I ask questions and get support?</h4>
<p>
<p>Free support where questions are answered by the community is available in the <a href="http://community.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">Podlove Community Forum</a>. There is a German community in the <a href="https://sendegate.de/" rel="nofollow">Sendegate</a>. <a href="http://publisher.podlove.org/support" rel="nofollow">Professional Support</a> by the plugin developer is also available.</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I help the project?</h4>
<p>
<p>The continued success of Open Source project relies on the community. There are many ways you can help:</p>
<ul>
<li>If you enjoy the plugin, please <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress/reviews/#new-post" rel="nofollow">leave a review</a>.</li>
<li>You can answer questions of other fellow podcasters in the <a href="https://community.podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">Podlove Community</a>.</li>
<li>You can buy <a href="https://publisher.podlove.org/support/" rel="nofollow">Support</a> to financially support the project.</li>
</ul>
<p>This product includes GeoLite2 data created by MaxMind, available from http://www.maxmind.com.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:17258:"<h4>2.7.17</h4>
<p><strong>Downloads Data Export</strong></p>
<p>Download data per episode can now be exported as JSON and CSV.<br />
On the Analytics page you will now find a simple export interface.<br />
Select the episodes you want in the export or don&#8217;t select any to export them all at once.</p>
<p><strong>WP REST API Support</strong></p>
<p>Backbone for the data export is an implementation of the WP REST API.</p>
<p>Endpoint for the episode custom post type:</p>
<ul>
<li>/wp-json/wp/v2/episodes</li>
</ul>
<p>Custom endpoints for episode analytics:</p>
<ul>
<li>/wp-json/podlove/v1/analytics/episodes/</li>
<li>/wp-json/podlove/v1/analytics/episodes/123</li>
<li>/wp-json/podlove/v1/analytics/episodes/123,82</li>
</ul>
<p>All analytics are available as CSV by adding <code>?format=csv</code> as parameter, for example <code>/wp-json/podlove/v1/analytics/episodes/?format=csv</code></p>
<p>Analytics endpoints require the <code>podlove_read_analytics</code> permission, the same as viewing analytics in the admin.</p>
<p>Please read https://developer.wordpress.org/rest-api/using-the-rest-api/authentication/ if you want to use these endpoints.</p>
<p><strong>Other</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Fix deprecation warning when using multiple categories (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/pull/1009" rel="nofollow">#1009</a>)</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.16</h4>
<ul>
<li>update Podlove Web Player 4</li>
</ul>

<li>Shows: custom language is now used for Podlove Subscribe Button</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.14</h4>
<ul>
<li>update Podlove Web Player 4</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.12/13</h4>
<ul>
<li>use wp_enqueue_script instead of inline JS when calling PWP4, improving compatibility to other plugins (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/1000" rel="nofollow">#1000</a>)</li>
<li>uninstall: be more specific which options are deleted (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/997" rel="nofollow">#997</a>)</li>
<li>new filter <code>podlove_network_module_activate</code> to force-enable network module (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/995" rel="nofollow">#995</a>)</li>
<li>new social services: Mastodon, Fediverse, Friendica (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/987" rel="nofollow">#987</a>, <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/968" rel="nofollow">#968</a>)</li>

<ul>
<li>update Analytics JS frameworks, fixing <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/982" rel="nofollow">#982</a></li>
<li>add download location analytics chart</li>
<li>remove weekday chart</li>
<li>add option to disable average episode display</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.9</h4>
<p>Too much slimming in 2.7.8. Undo.</p>
<h4>2.7.8</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix release workflow</li>
<li>slim down plugin size by removing unnecessary files from release</li>
<li>update Podlove Web Player 4</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.7</h4>
<p>Update 2.7.5 changed the way download tracking works to comply with GDPR. We tried the radical approach and anonymized IPs. As it turns out, this is not viable. Download numbers are skewed by this change and often much lower than they realistically should be. If you saw a drop in downloads since updating to 2.7.5 or 2.7.6, this is the reason.</p>
<p>The good news is that this update changes download tracking again and new download numbers should get back to normal. The bad news is that the data since the GDPR update cannot be fixed/restored because it&#8217;s missing data granularity &#8212; which was the point of the change; just not anitcipating the effect on the actual download numbers.</p>
<p>So what&#8217;s the new tracking approach?</p>
<p>Podlove Publisher now stores the <code>request_id</code> again just like before the update: a hash based on the actual IP address and the user agent. What&#8217;s new is that now once a day, all <code>request_id</code>s older than 24 hours are salted again, making it impossible to restore IPs from them. This 24 hour window is enough to determine download numbers exactly as before the GDPR update.</p>
<p>To be clear, IPs are never stored in plain text. But since IPs could be restored by brute force attack from the temporary unsalted <code>request_id</code> hashes, they have to be treated like plain IPs. The text snippet for your privacy page has been updated in the docs and you should update it on your site: https://docs.podlove.org/podlove-publisher/guides/dsgvo-gdpr.html</p>
<h4>2.7.6</h4>
<p>No changes.</p>
<h4>2.7.5</h4>
<p><strong>Preparation for GDPR/DSGVO</strong></p>
<p>If you are using Podlove Publisher Tracking/Analytics, an update to this version is highly recommended.</p>
<p>Tracking uses a <code>request_id</code> to be able to determine when two requests came from the same user and should be counted as one unique access. This request id used to be a hash of the original IP address and the user agent. This approach however is vulnerable to a brute force attack to get the IP address back from the hash. Here&#8217;s what we are doing about that:</p>
<p>First, we anonymize the IP before generating the hash. So instead of using <code>171.23.11.209</code>, we use <code>171.23.11.0</code>.</p>
<p>Second, you need to deal with the existing <code>request_id</code>s. There is a new &#8220;DSGVO&#8221; section under &#8220;Tools&#8221; with a button that will rehash all existing <code>request_id</code>s with a randomly generated salt. That way it will become unfeasible to determine the original IP address but your analytics will stay the same.</p>
<p>In case you have a lot of downloads (let&#8217;s say much more than 50.000), you may want to do this via command line because that will be <em>much</em> quicker than via the tools section. You need <a href="https://wp-cli.org/" rel="nofollow">wp-cli</a>, then simply call <code>wp eval 'podlove_rehash_tracking_request_ids();'</code>. On a multisite, pass the blog id as a parameter: <code>wp eval 'podlove_rehash_tracking_request_ids(42);'</code>.</p>
<p><strong>Other</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>fix Podlove Subscribe Button language parameter</li>
<li>fix <code>rel="self"</code> link in show feeds</li>
<li>fix Podlove Subscribe Button not delivering show feeds</li>
<li>templates: handle episode.show access when there is no show</li>
<li>templates: allow episode filtering by show, for example: <code>{% for episode in podcast.episodes({show: "example"}) %}</code></li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.4</h4>
<p>No changes, but the previous release is not delivered correctly by WordPress, so this is simply a re-release attempt to fix it.</p>
<h4>2.7.3</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix: geo database updater</li>
<li>update Podlove Web Player 2: remove Flash Fallback</li>
<li>update Podlove Web Player 4</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.2</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix: <code>itunes:image</code> tag in show feeds</li>
<li>fix: &#8220;Debug Tracking&#8221; choosing wrong media files to check availability</li>
<li>enhancement: &#8220;Debug Tracking&#8221; now suggests disabling SSL-peer-verification if URL cannot be resolved and https is used</li>
<li>system report: include active plugins</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.1</h4>
<ul>
<li>fix: PHP warning when the_title filter is called with only one parameter</li>
<li>fix: handle colons in migration tool</li>
<li>fix: PWP4 warning when using shortcode</li>
<li>new service: letterboxd</li>
</ul>
<h4>2.7.0</h4>
<p><strong>New Module: Shows</strong></p>
<p>With shows you can offer feeds to subtopics of your podcast. Here&#8217;s how it works: You create a show and define show meta, similar to a podcast: title, slug, subtitle, summary, image and language. These fields override your podcast settings. All other settings are the same as your podcast.</p>
<p>For each episode, you decide which show it&#8217;s in. Each show has its own set of feeds that listeners can subscribe to. The main feed remains unchanged, containing all episodes from all shows.</p>
<p>The Podlove Subscribe Button can be configured to subscribe to a show by referencing the show slug. Use the shortcode <code>[podlove-subscribe-button show="show-slug"]</code> or the template tag <code>{ podcast.subscribeButton({show: 'show-slug'}) }}</code>.</p>
<p>We do not recommend using Shows and Seasons at the same time.</p>
<p><strong>Updated Metadata for Podcast/Episode/Seasons according to iOS11 Specification</strong></p>
<p>Apple announced an <a href="http://podcasts.apple.com/resources/spec/ApplePodcastsSpecUpdatesiOS11.pdf" rel="nofollow">updated specification for feed elements</a>. These changes enable the Apple Podcasts app to present podcasts in a better way. But since these feed extensions are readable by any podcast client, we expect others to take advantage of these new fields soon. Here is how we implemented the specification:</p>
<ul>
<li>The podcast has a new &#8220;type&#8221; field where you can select between &#8220;episodic&#8221; and &#8220;serial&#8221;, which may affect the order of episodes. The field <code>&lt;itunes:type&gt;episodic&lt;/itunes:type&gt;</code> appears in the feed.</li>
<li>Episodes have a new &#8220;title&#8221; field. It defaults to the episode post title but can be set separately now, allowing you to define different titles for the website and podcast clients. The field <code>&lt;itunes:title&gt;Interview with Somebody Infamous&lt;/itunes:title&gt;</code> will appear in the feed.</li>
<li>Episodes have a new &#8220;type&#8221; field where you can select between &#8220;full&#8221; (default), &#8220;trailer&#8221; and &#8220;bonus&#8221;. This won&#8217;t have any effect in the Publisher but may be used by podcast clients. The field <code>&lt;itunes:episodeType&gt;full&lt;/itunes:episodeType&gt;</code> appears in the feed.</li>
<li>Episodes have a new &#8220;number&#8221; field. If used, <code>&lt;itunes:episode&gt;42&lt;/itunes:episode&gt;</code> will appear in the feed.</li>
<li>Episodes in seasons will have an <code>&lt;itunes:season&gt;2&lt;/itunes:season&gt;</code> field in the feed automatically.</li>
</ul>
<p>We decided to complement these changes by introducing a podcast mnemonic/abbreviation field. Now we can autogenerate blog episode titles, based on the episode number and title, if you like. The mnemonic can be set in podcast settings. The setting to autogenerate blog episode titles is an expert setting in the &#8220;Website&#8221; section.</p>
<p>To help existing podcasts to conform to these new fields we made a &#8220;Title Migration&#8221; module which will greet you with a notice once you update the Publisher. It will try to extract episode numbers and titles from your existing titles, saving you time and effort updating each episode one by one.</p>
<p><strong>Template API Changes</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><code>episode.title</code> now returns the new episode title field, if it is set, but has a fallback to the post title. If you want a specific version, use <code>episode.title.clean</code> or <code>episode.title.blog</code>.</li>
<li>the post title of an episode can still be accessed via <code>episode.post.post_title</code></li>
<li>new accessor: <code>episode.number</code></li>
<li>new accessor: <code>episode.type</code></li>
<li>new accessor: <code>podcast.mnemonic</code></li>
<li>new accessor: <code>podcast.type</code></li>
<li>new accessor: <code>season.mnemonic</code></li>
</ul>
<p><strong>Podlove Web Player 4</strong></p>
<p>The Shortcode <code>[podlove-web-player]</code> accepts several parameters, increasing its versatility.</p>
<p>With <code>post_id</code> you can embed episodes on any page, for example <code>[podlove-web-player post_id="1234"]</code>.</p>
<p>Every <a href="http://docs.podlove.org/podlove-web-player/config.html" rel="nofollow">config parameter available</a> can be overridden using shortcode attributes. The only difference from the linked documentation page is the notation. For nested configs like <code>show.title</code> use underscores (<code>_</code>) instead. For example, display a green player with custom title like this: <code>[podlove-web-player show_title="Special Title" theme_main="#00ff00"]</code></p>
<p>You can now also display a player with <em>live content</em> like this: <code>[podlove-web-player mode="live" audio_0_url="http://mp3.theradio.cc/" audio_0_mimeType="audio/mp3" title="Livestream" link="https://theradio.cc"]</code></p>
<p>You can choose to deliver Podlove Player via Podlove CDN (Content Delivery Network) or via your WordPress server. CDN is the default for new setups but if you are already using Podlove Publisher we continue delivering Podlove Player via your WordPress server unless you explicitly change it.</p>
<p>Podlove Web Player 4 is the new default player.</p>
<p><strong>Other</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>analytics: show download totals for last 24 hours and last 7 days in overview</li>
<li>Podigee Player: add support for transcripts
<ul>
<li>create a Podigee Transcript asset</li>
<li>set this asset in Expert Settings &gt; Web Player</li>
<li>See https://cdn.podigee.com/ppp/samples/transcript.txt for an example transcript</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>Podlove Web Player 4: support contributors</li>
<li>player settings: when no episode or files are available, use a &#8220;Podlove&#8221; demo sound</li>
<li>reduce Podlove Template Cache duration from 1 day to 1 hour for the following change:</li>
<li>new template accessor: <code>{{ episode.total_downloads }}</code></li>
<li>New in &#8220;Global Feed Settings&#8221;: An option for how the episode title should be displayed. It defaults to &#8220;Blog Post Title&#8221;, so that after the iOS 11 title migration, the output does not actually change &#8212; following the principle of least surprise. However, the setting can be changed to &#8220;Episode Title&#8221;, which is the new clean title, or &#8220;Custom Template&#8221;, which is a title template with the same capabilities as the blog post title template.</li>
<li>when using the Podlove Subscribe Button CDN and the CDN is not reachable, fall back to the locally hosted script</li>
<li>fix Geo DB Updater: use our own Podlove CDN as download source</li>
<li>fix quotes in contributor fields</li>
<li>fix WordPress conditionals in episode archives</li>
<li>fix deleting related episodes (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/907" rel="nofollow">#907</a>)</li>
<li>fix network admin bar now does not include broken links if Publisher is not activated network-wide (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/933" rel="nofollow">#933</a>)</li>
<li>fix import getting stuck issue (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/910" rel="nofollow">#910</a>)</li>
<li>Bitlove module: remove all frontend functionality because it has been dysfunctional for a long time </li>
<li>fix Auphonic module showing wrong status message after file upload</li>
<li>fix Audacity chapter import when times contain commas</li>
<li>fix email notification issue where not emails were sent (<a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/issues/938" rel="nofollow">#938</a>)</li>
<li>fix feed redirect issue for HTTP/1.0 clients</li>
<li>fix network module: only activate when the plugin is activated network-wide, not when the plugin in active within a multisite</li>
<li>fix calculation of contribution counts</li>
<li>Fix various issues in the download table display. Until now, new downloads were calculated hourly, which provides a good estimate but often not exact numbers. The calculation could also get stuck, leading to missing data display. From now on, the estimates are still calculated hourly but additionally <em>a full, precise aggregation is done once a day</em>, which should lead to more consistent numbers overall.</li>
<li>enhance email error reporting</li>
<li>enhance open graph module: detects WP SEO plugin and does not output any tags to avoid conflicts</li>
<li>social services: add SlideShare</li>
<li>show warning if upload directory is not fully qualified</li>
<li>remove download section from default template (because it is included in PWP4)</li>
<li>image cache: instead of returning invalid URLs with 0 width and 0 height when something goes wrong, return the source URL instead</li>
<li>episode list: add display option to display episode number as a column<br />
add Liberapay as donation service</li>
<li>display current season in episode form</li>
</ul>
<p>Changes for previous versions can be found in the <a href="https://github.com/podlove/podlove-publisher/blob/master/changelog.txt" rel="nofollow"><code>changelog.txt</code></a>.</p>

ng-plugin-for-wordpress.2.7.8.zip";s:5:"2.7.9";s:88:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress.2.7.9.zip";s:5:"trunk";s:82:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:29:"http://podlove.org/donations/";s:5:"icons";a:3:{s:2:"1x";s:84:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress/assets/icon.svg?rev=1545024";s:2:"2x";s:92:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1545024";s:3:"svg";s:84:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-podcasting-plugin-for-wordpress/assets/icon.svg?rev=1545024";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:9:"languages";s:3:"any";s:8:"category";a:6:{s:7:"gallery";s:4:"more";s:4:"blog";s:4:"more";s:8:"personal";s:4:"more";s:8:"business";s:4:"more";s:5:"eshop";s:4:"more";s:7:"podcast";s:11:"recommended";}s:3:"new";i:1;}s:18:"podlove-web-player";a:29:{s:4:"name";s:18:"Podlove Web Player";s:4:"slug";s:18:"podlove-web-player";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.1.0";s:6:"author";s:46:"<a href="http://podlove.org/">Podlove Team</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:45:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/gerritvanaaken";s:8:"requires";s:5:"3.4.0";s:6:"tested";s:6:"4.6.12";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:60;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:3;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:1;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:3;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:7;s:15:"support_threads";i:1;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:29447;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2016-10-20 2:22pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2012-07-03";s:8:"homepage";s:38:"http://podlove.org/podlove-web-player/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2371:"<p>This is part of the “Podlove” initiative for a better podcasting experience. See <a href="http://podlove.org" rel="nofollow">podlove.org</a> for more information.</p>
<p>There are basically four ways to use the Podlove Web Player:</p>
<h3>1) as a Standalone Player</h3>
<p>You won’t need any of the PHP or WordPress files in this package. Just stick to &#8220;standalone.html&#8221; and see how it’s done there. Maybe you want to build your very own CMS plugin. If so – let us know!</p>
<h3>2) manual WordPress shortcodes</h3>
<p>Use a simple shortcode in your posts and pages, and the Podlove Web Player will appear, playing any media file you want to assign. Basic usage:</p>
<p>[podloveaudio src=&#8221;http://mysite.com/mymedia.mp3&#8243; duration=&#8221;03:33&#8243; title=&#8221;My track&#8221;]</p>
<h3>3) WordPress enclosures</h3>
<p>The WordPress plugin searches for media enclosures in your existing posts and renders a web player automatically. Works like a charme, even for Blubrry PowerPress users.</p>
<h3>4) as part of the Podlove Podcast Publisher</h3>
<p>This player is bundled with the <a href="http://podlove.org/podlove-podcast-publisher" rel="nofollow">“PPP” project</a> and should be automatically rendered, so you don’t have to worry about anything.</p>
<h3>Credits</h3>
<p>The Podlove Web Player is built from the <a href="http://podlove.org/" rel="nofollow">Podlove Team</a>.</p>
<p>It uses sources from <a href="http://mediaelementjs.com/" rel="nofollow">MediaElement.js</a>, <a href="http://jquery.com/" rel="nofollow">jQuery</a> and <a href="http://benalman.com/projects/jquery-hashchange-plugin/" rel="nofollow">jQuery hashchange event</a>.</p>
<p>The used icons are built in as fonts and provided by <a href="http://fortawesome.github.com/Font-Awesome/" rel="nofollow">Font Awesome</a>, <a href="http://zocial.smcllns.com/" rel="nofollow">Zocial</a>, <a href="http://somerandomdude.com/work/iconic/" rel="nofollow">Iconic</a>, <a href="http://aristeides.com/" rel="nofollow">Elusive</a>, <a href="http://designmodo.com/linecons-free/" rel="nofollow">Linecons</a>, <a href="http://www.entypo.com" rel="nofollow">Entypo</a>, <a href="http://www.justbenicestudio.com/studio/websymbols/" rel="nofollow">Web Symbols</a>, <a href="http://thedesignoffice.org/project/modern-pictograms/" rel="nofollow">Modern Pictograms</a>.</p>
";s:12:"installation";s:496:"<ol>
<li>Upload the <code>podlove-web-player</code> folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the <code>Plugins</code> menu in WordPress</li>
<li>Use the <code>[podlovevideo]</code> or <code>[podloveaudio]</code> shortcode in your post or page with the options on the front page</li>
<li>Visit the options page</li>
<li>If you need help, go to the github repo https://github.com/podlove/podlove-web-player and use the issue tracker</li>
</ol>
";s:3:"faq";s:6361:"
<h4>Where can i get help?</h4>
<p>
<p>Definitely not on wordpress.org<br />
If you need help, please go to our github repo<br />
You can find it at https://github.com/podlove/podlove-web-player</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I configure the player’s appearance?</h4>
<p>
<p>Just use the shortcode options that are described on this FAQ page!</p>
</p>
<h4>src</h4>
<p>
<p>This location of any audio or video file, local ore remote:</p>
<pre><code>[podloveaudio src="http://mysite.com/mymedia.mp3"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>type</h4>
<p>
<p>The media type of the resource:</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo src="http://mysite.com/mymedia.m4v" type="video/mp4"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>mp4 / webm / ogg</h4>
<p>
<p>The location of a file with a specific video type:</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo mp4="mymedia.mp4" webm="mymedia.webm" ogg="mymedia.ogv"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>mp4 / mp3 / ogg / opus</h4>
<p>
<p>[podloveaudio mp4=&#8221;mymedia.m4a&#8221; mp3=&#8221;mymedia.mp3&#8243; ogg=&#8221;mymedia.oga&#8221; opus=&#8221;mymedia.opus&#8221;]</p>
</p>
<h4>poster</h4>
<p>
<p>The location of the poster frame for the video (or cover image for the rich audio player):</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo poster="http://mysite.com/mymedia.png"]
[podloveaudio poster="http://mysite.com/mymedia.png"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>width / height</h4>
<p>
<p>The width and/or height of the video (or the audio player):</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo width="640" height="264"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>loop</h4>
<p>
<p>Loops the video or audio when it ends:</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo src="http://mysite.com/mymedia.mp4" loop="true"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>preload</h4>
<p>
<p>Start loading the video as soon as possible, before the user clicks play. This might not work on all browsers.</p>
<pre><code>[podloveaudio preload="true"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>autoplay</h4>
<p>
<p>Start playing the video as soon as it&#8217;s ready. This might not work on all (mobile) devices.</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo autoplay="true"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>fullscreen</h4>
<p>
<p>Disables the fullscreen button for video:</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo fullscreen="false"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>duration</h4>
<p>
<p>Enables display of duration without having to load the media file. Use seconds or timecode as a unit:</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo duration="3522"]
[podloveaudio duration="00:58:42"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>alwaysShowHours</h4>
<p>
<p>Displays the time in 00:00:00 instead of 00:00. Default is &#8220;true&#8221;.</p>
<pre><code>[podloveaudio alwaysShowHours="false"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>alwaysShowControls</h4>
<p>
<p>Defines whether the player control bar is permanently visible. For videos, it might be suitable to fade the controls out when not hovering the video.</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo alwaysShowControls="false"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>volume</h4>
<p>
<p>Disables the volume slider:</p>
<pre><code>[podloveaudio volume="false"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>progress</h4>
<p>
<p>Disables the progress bar:</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo progress="false"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>captions</h4>
<p>
<p>URL to a WebVTT captions file:</p>
<pre><code>[podlovevideo captions="http://mysite.com/mymedia.vtt"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>chapters</h4>
<p>
<p>Takes chapter json string from the defined custom field (the standard WordPress ones) and builds an interactive chapter table. Can be referenced to an external json file, too. Chapters must be written in the following format:</p>
<p>[{<br />
  &#8220;start&#8221;: &#8220;00:00:00&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;title&#8221;: &#8220;foo&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;href&#8221;: &#8220;http://podlove.org&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;image&#8221;:&#8221;&#8221;<br />
},{<br />
  &#8220;start&#8221;: &#8220;00:01:00&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;title&#8221;: &#8220;lorem&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;href&#8221;: &#8220;https://github.com/podlove/&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;image&#8221;:&#8221;samples/coverimage-red.png&#8221;<br />
},{<br />
  &#8220;start&#8221;: &#8220;00:02:30&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;title&#8221;: &#8220;ipsum&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;href&#8221;: &#8220;https://github.com/shownotes/&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;image&#8221;:&#8221;samples/coverimage-green.png&#8221;<br />
},{<br />
  &#8220;start&#8221;: &#8220;00:03:00&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;title&#8221;: &#8220;end&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;href&#8221;: &#8220;&#8221;,<br />
  &#8220;image&#8221;:&#8221;samples/coverimage-blue.png&#8221;<br />
}]</p>
<ul>
<li>&#8220;start&#8221; has to be defined as HH:MM:SS</li>
<li>&#8220;title&#8221; is the name of the chapter</li>
<li>&#8220;href&#8221; is an optional URL</li>
<li>
<p>&#8220;image&#8221; is an optional image URL or relative path</p>
<p>[podloveaudio chapters=&#8221;my_chapter_field&#8221;]<br />
[podloveaudio chapters=&#8221;http://mychapters.com/chapters.json&#8221;]</p>
</li>
</ul>
</p>
<h4>chaptersVisible / timecontrolsVisible / summaryVisible</h4>
<p>
<p>Defines the default visibility status of toggable player modules. Standard value is &#8220;false&#8221;.</p>
<pre><code>[podloveaudio chaptersVisible="true" timecontrolsVisible="false" summaryVisible="false"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>Rich Podlove Web Player player with meta information</h4>
<p>
<p>If you have an audio file and use one of the following attributes, the player will sport a richer visual experience: &#8220;title&#8221;, &#8220;subtitle&#8221;, &#8220;summary&#8221;, &#8220;poster&#8221;, &#8220;permalink&#8221;. Full example:</p>
<pre><code>[podloveaudio mp3="http://mysite.com/mymedia.mp3" ogg="http://mysite.com/mymedia.ogg" title="PWP – First show" subtitle="We talk about this and that" summary="Here goes a summary of the episode which should be about 256 characters long" poster="http://mysite.com/mymedia.jpg" chapters="my_chapter_field" permalink="http://mysite.com/my-first-episode/"]
</code></pre>
</p>
<h4>Podlove Web Player Shortcode in multiple lines</h4>
<p>
<p>Don&#8217;t do it, always write the shortcode in a single line.</p>
</p>
<h4>Deprecated usage</h4>
<p>
<p>Chapters now handed over as JSON, please take a look at the standalone.html. The previous solution will still work, however we recommend to use the new solution, as it offers some more features.<br />
Earlier versions of this plugin could handle alternative shortcodes, too: [audio] and [video]. As of version 1.1, these are deprecated as they conflict with other plugins.</p>
</p>

ugin/podlove-web-player.2.0.17.zip";s:6:"2.0.19";s:68:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.2.0.19.zip";s:5:"2.0.2";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.2.0.2.zip";s:5:"2.0.3";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.2.0.3.zip";s:5:"2.0.4";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.2.0.4.zip";s:5:"2.0.5";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.2.0.5.zip";s:5:"2.0.6";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.2.0.6.zip";s:5:"2.0.7";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.2.0.7.zip";s:5:"2.0.8";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.2.0.8.zip";s:5:"2.0.9";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.2.0.9.zip";s:5:"2.1.0";s:67:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/podlove-web-player.2.1.0.zip";}s:11:"donate_link";s:19:"http://podlove.org/";s:5:"icons";a:3:{s:2:"1x";s:63:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-web-player/assets/icon.svg?rev=1545651";s:2:"2x";s:71:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-web-player/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1545651";s:3:"svg";s:63:"https://ps.w.org/podlove-web-player/assets/icon.svg?rev=1545651";}s:12:"contributors";a:0:{}s:9:"languages";s:3:"any";s:8:"category";a:6:{s:7:"gallery";s:4:"more";s:4:"blog";s:4:"more";s:8:"personal";s:4:"more";s:8:"business";s:4:"more";s:5:"eshop";s:4:"more";s:7:"podcast";s:11:"recommended";}s:3:"new";i:1;}s:24:"podlove-subscribe-button";a:29:{s:4:"name";s:24:"Podlove Subscribe button";s:4:"slug";s:24:"podlove-subscribe-button";s:7:"version";s:5:"1.3.6";s:6:"author";s:40:"<a href="http://podlove.org">Podlove</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:39:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/chemiker";s:8:"requires";s:5:"3.5.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";s:3:"5.3";s:6:"rating";i:100;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:2;i:4;i:0;i:3;i:0;i:2;i:0;i:1;i:0;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:2;s:15:"support_threads";i:0;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:0;s:10:"downloaded";i:10923;s:12:"last_updated";s:22:"2018-10-02 12:55pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2015-04-15";s:8:"homepage";s:61:"http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/podlove-subscribe-button/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2030:"<p>This plugin allows easy inclusion of the Podlove Subscribe Button. Put it in your sidebar with a simple widget or include the button in pages and/or posts with a simple shortcode.</p>
<h3>About the Podlove Subscribe Button</h3>
<p>The Podlove Subscribe Button allows for simple subscription of podcasts in anybody&#8217;s favorite podcast app right from the browser without having to deal with pesky feed URLs and go on a hunt for feed subscription dialogues.</p>
<p>The button knows how to activate the subscription functionality in all popular podcast apps supporting various operating systems including but not limited to iOS, Android, WindowsPhone, OSX, Windows and Linux.</p>
<p>The button is centrally hosted and gets permanently updated when new podcast apps emerge or when new features are added. Using the button ensures your podcast can easily be subscribed to and presents an ever more popular user interface that your audience gets more and more used to.</p>
<h3>About Podlove</h3>
<p>Podlove is an open source initiative to improve the overall podcasting infrastructure and to come up with simple but helpful standards and tools to make publishing and listening to podcast as easy as possible.</p>
<p>Podlove currently provides:</p>
<ul>
<li><a href="https://publisher.podlove.org" rel="nofollow"><strong><em>Podlove Podcast Publisher</em></strong></a> &#8211; a powerful plugin for WordPress for podcasters to publish metadata-rich podcasts </li>
<li><strong><em>Podlove Web Player</em></strong> &#8211; a podcast-optimized HTML5 web player with chapter support</li>
<li><a href="https://subscribe-button.podlove.org" rel="nofollow"><strong><em>Podlove Subscribe Button</em></strong></a> &#8211; a centrally hosted universal podcast subscribe button for the web</li>
</ul>
<h3>Other Resources</h3>
<ul>
<li>Podlove Project: https://podlove.org/</li>
<li>Podlove Community: https://community.podlove.org/</li>
<li>Documentation: https://docs.podlove.org/</li>
<li>Donate: https://podlove.org/donations/</li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:4251:"<h3>Install the plugin</h3>
<ol>
<li>Upload the plugin folder to the <code>/wp-content/plugins/</code> directory</li>
<li>Activate the plugin through the &#8216;Plugins&#8217; menu in WordPress</li>
</ol>
<h3>Configure buttons</h3>
<ol>
<li>Navigate to <code>Settings &gt; Podlove Subscribe Button</code></li>
<li>Fill out all fields, save and grab the shortcode</li>
<li>Add the button to your blog using the shortcode <code>[podlove-subscribe-button id="{{yourButtonID}}"]</code> with your button ID, or use the provided Podlove Subscribe Button Widget</li>
</ol>
<h3>Display the Subscribe Button in your Sidebar using a Widget</h3>
<p>Go to <code>Appearance -&gt; Widgets</code> and drag the &#8220;Podlove Subscribe Button&#8221; widget to your sidebar configuration. Select the pre-configured button from the list and determine which style you want. That&#8217;s it. The button should show up in your sidebar. Optionally add a title and description for your widget.</p>
<p>This is the easiest and recommended way of using this plugin especially if you ony want to display a button for a single podcast. For best visibility choose size &#8220;big&#8221; and format &#8220;cover&#8221; to make your Subscribe Button stand out and easily locatable.</p>
<h3>Include the Subscribe Button in WordPress pages using a Shortcode</h3>
<p>If you want to include a Podlove Subscribe Button in a WordPress page (or a post) just put the shortcode <code>[podlove-subscribe-button]</code> at the desired position in your text. Use the following shortcode parameters to configure it properly:</p>
<ul>
<li><code>button</code> &#8211; the ID of one of your preconfigured buttons</li>
<li><code>size</code> &#8211; one of &#8216;small&#8217;, &#8216;medium&#8217;, &#8216;big&#8217;</li>
<li><code>width</code> &#8211; specify desired button width in CSS compatibles values or &#8216;auto&#8217; automatic width depending on context.</li>
<li><code>color</code> &#8211; specify the color of the button in a CSS compatible format (keyword, rgb-hex, rgb, rgba, hsl, hsla)</li>
<li><code>style</code> &#8211; default is filled, options are &#8216;outline&#8217; and &#8216;frameless&#8217;</li>
<li><code>format</code> &#8211; default is a rectangle, options are &#8216;square&#8217; and &#8216;cover&#8217; (<strong>Note</strong>: &#8216;cover&#8217; has a max size of 300px)</li>
<li><code>hide</code> &#8211; if set to <code>true</code> the button will not be shown (useful if you want to use your own element)</li>
<li><code>buttonid</code> &#8211; you can use this to open the popup from another element on the same page</li>
<li><code>language</code> &#8211; specify the language the texts on the button and popup should be in (currently supports &#8216;de&#8217;, &#8216;en&#8217;, &#8216;eo&#8217;, &#8216;fi&#8217;, &#8216;fr&#8217;, &#8216;nl&#8217;, &#8216;zh&#8217; and &#8216;ja&#8217;)</li>
</ul>
<p>Note that if you do not provide one of the attributes the subscribe button will use the globally set default.</p>
<h3>Shortcode Examples</h3>
<pre><code>[podlove-subscribe-button button="mybutton1" size="big"]
</code></pre>
<p>Displays a large button with the podcast logo on top using data from button configuration with id &#8220;mybutton1&#8221;. All other options will be set to the globally set default values.</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-subscribe-button button="mybutton2" size="medium" width="100pt" language="de"]
</code></pre>
<p>Displays a small button with a width of 100pt using data from button configuration with id &#8220;mybutton2&#8221; in german. All other options will be set to the globally set default values.</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-subscribe-button button="mybutton3" size="big" width="auto" format="cover"]
</code></pre>
<p>Displays a big button with a the podcast cover and automatically adjusted using data from button configuration with id &#8220;mybutton3&#8221;. All other options will be set to the globally set default values.</p>
<pre><code>[podlove-subscribe-button button="mybutton4" format="square" style="frameless"]
</code></pre>
<p>Displays a small, frameless square button with using data from button configuration with id &#8220;mybutton4&#8221;. All other options will be set to the globally set default values.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:1363:"
<h4>I&#8217;m running the Podlove Publisher. Do I need this plugin to display a Subscribe button?</h4>
<p>
<p>Yes and No. If you simply want to display a Subscribe Button for your Podcast you publish with the Podlove Publisher you do not need this plugin as the Publisher itself provides this functionality. If you want to display multiple Subscribe Buttons you can use the Subscribe Button plugin.</p>
</p>
<h4>Where do I create those &#8220;Network-wide&#8221; Buttons?</h4>
<p>
<p>You can find the Panel in the Networks Settings Section</p>
</p>
<h4>Does this plugin actually contain the code for the button?</h4>
<p>
<p>No. This plugin just embeds the code that is needed to display the Podlove Subscribe Button. The button itself is served live from api.podlove.org</p>
</p>
<h4>Do I update the plugin to get support for more clients?</h4>
<p>
<p>No. As the Podlove Subscribe Button is hosted centrally, it gets updated regularly independent from this pugin.</p>
</p>
<h4>I am a podcast app developer and would like my app be listed in the button. What do I need to do?</h4>
<p>
<p>Consult the information provided on <a href="https://podlove.org/podlove-subscribe-button" rel="nofollow">the technical information page</a> at podlove.org on how the button works and what app developers need to support and do in order to get listed in the button.</p>
</p>

egory";a:6:{s:7:"gallery";s:4:"more";s:4:"blog";s:4:"more";s:8:"personal";s:4:"more";s:8:"business";s:4:"more";s:5:"eshop";s:4:"more";s:7:"podcast";s:11:"recommended";}s:3:"new";i:1;}s:12:"antispam-bee";a:29:{s:4:"name";s:12:"Antispam Bee";s:4:"slug";s:12:"antispam-bee";s:7:"version";s:5:"2.9.0";s:6:"author";s:57:"<a href="https://pluginkollektiv.org">pluginkollektiv</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:39:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/stalkerx";s:8:"requires";s:3:"4.5";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.9.8";s:12:"requires_php";b:0;s:6:"rating";i:96;s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;i:134;i:4;i:2;i:3;i:2;i:2;i:1;i:1;i:6;}s:11:"num_ratings";i:145;s:15:"support_threads";i:8;s:24:"support_threads_resolved";i:5;s:10:"downloaded";i:2459714;s:12:"last_updated";s:22:"2018-09-16 12:02pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2009-01-10";s:8:"homepage";s:43:"https://wordpress.org/plugins/antispam-bee/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:2370:"<p>Say Goodbye to comment spam on your WordPress blog or website. <em>Antispam Bee</em> blocks spam comments and trackbacks effectively, without captchas and without sending personal information to third party services. It is free of charge, ad-free and 100% GDPR compliant.</p>
<h3>Feature/Settings Overview</h3>
<ul>
<li>Trust approved commenters.</li>
<li>Trust commenters with a Gravatar.</li>
<li>Consider the comment time.</li>
<li>Allow comments only in a certain language.</li>
<li>Block or allow commenters from certain countries.</li>
<li>Treat BBCode as spam.</li>
<li>Validate the IP address of commenters.</li>
<li>Use regular expressions.</li>
<li>Search local spam database for commenters previously marked as spammers.</li>
<li>Notify admins by e-mail about incoming spam.</li>
<li>Delete existing spam after n days.</li>
<li>Limit approval to comments/pings (will delete other comment types).</li>
<li>Select spam indicators to send comments to deletion directly.</li>
<li>Optionally exclude trackbacks and pingbacks from spam detection.</li>
<li>Optionally spam-check comment forms on archive pages.</li>
<li>Display spam statistics on the dashboard, including daily updates of spam detection rate and a total of blocked spam comments.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Support</h3>
<ul>
<li>Community support via the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/antispam-bee" rel="nofollow">support forums on wordpress.org</a></li>
<li>We don’t handle support via e-mail, Twitter, GitHub issues etc.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Contribute</h3>
<ul>
<li>Active development of this plugin is handled <a href="https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee" rel="nofollow">on GitHub</a>.</li>
<li>Pull requests for documented bugs are highly appreciated.</li>
<li>If you think you’ve found a bug (e.g. you’re experiencing unexpected behavior), please post at the <a href="https://wordpress.org/support/plugin/antispam-bee" rel="nofollow">support forums</a> first.</li>
<li>If you want to help us translate this plugin you can do so <a href="https://translate.wordpress.org/projects/wp-plugins/antispam-bee" rel="nofollow">on WordPress Translate</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Credits</h3>
<ul>
<li>Author: <a href="https://sergejmueller.github.io/" rel="nofollow">Sergej Müller</a></li>
<li>Maintainers: <a href="https://pluginkollektiv.org" rel="nofollow">pluginkollektiv</a></li>
</ul>
";s:12:"installation";s:554:"<ul>
<li>If you don’t know how to install a plugin for WordPress, <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Managing_Plugins#Installing_Plugins" rel="nofollow">here’s how</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Requirements</h3>
<ul>
<li>PHP 5.2.4 or greater</li>
<li>WordPress 3.8 or greater</li>
</ul>
<h3>Settings</h3>
<p>After you have activated <em>Antispam Bee</em> the plugin will block spam comments out of the box. However, you may want to visit <em>Settings → Antispam Bee</em> to configure your custom set of anti-spam options that works best for your site.</p>
";s:3:"faq";s:3109:"
<h4>Installation Instructions</h4>
<p>
<ul>
<li>If you don’t know how to install a plugin for WordPress, <a href="https://codex.wordpress.org/Managing_Plugins#Installing_Plugins" rel="nofollow">here’s how</a>.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Requirements</h3>
<ul>
<li>PHP 5.2.4 or greater</li>
<li>WordPress 3.8 or greater</li>
</ul>
<h3>Settings</h3>
<p>After you have activated <em>Antispam Bee</em> the plugin will block spam comments out of the box. However, you may want to visit <em>Settings → Antispam Bee</em> to configure your custom set of anti-spam options that works best for your site.</p>
</p>
<h4>Does Antispam Bee work with Jetpack, Disqus Comments and other comment plugins?</h4>
<p>
<p>Antispam Bee works best with default WordPress comments. It is not compatible with Jetpack or Disqus Comments as those plugins load the comment form within an iframe. Thus Antispam Bee can not access the comment form directly.<br />
It also won’t work with any AJAX-powered comment forms.</p>
</p>
<h4>Does Antispam Bee store any private user data, and is it compliant with GDPR?</h4>
<p>
<p>Antispam Bee is developed in Europe. You might have heard we can be a bit nitpicky over here when it comes to privacy. The plugin does not save private user data and is 100% compliant with GDPR.</p>
</p>
<h4>Will I have to edit any theme templates to get Antispam Bee to work?</h4>
<p>
<p>No, the plugin works as is. You may want to configure your favorite settings, though.</p>
</p>
<h4>Does Antispam Bee work with shortened IPs?</h4>
<p>
<p>Generally yes. However, commissioning the Antispam Bee plugin for canceled or shortened IP addresses in comment metadata is not recommended. Because the name and the e-mail address of the comments are not unique, an IP address is the only reliable measure. The more complete the stored IP addresses, the more reliable the assignment or detection of spam.</p>
</p>
<h4>How can I submit undetected spam?</h4>
<p>
<p>If the antispam plugin has passed some spam comments, these comments can be reported for analysis. A <a href="http://goo.gl/forms/ITzVHXkLVL" rel="nofollow">Google table</a> was created for this purpose.</p>
</p>
<h4>Antispam Bee with Varnish?</h4>
<p>
<p>If WordPress is operated with Apache + Varnish, the actual IP address of the visitors does not appear in WordPress. Accordingly the Antispam-Plugin lacks the base for the correct functionality. An adaptation in the Varnish configuration file /etc/varnish/default.vcl provides a remedy and forwards the original (not from Apache) IP address in the HTTP header X-Forwarded-For:<br />
    if (req.restarts == 0) {<br />
        set req.http.X-Forwarded-For = client.ip;<br />
    }</p>
</p>
<h4>Are there some paid services or limitations?</h4>
<p>
<p>No, Antispam Bee is free forever, for both private and commercial projects. You can use it on as many sites as you want. There is no limitation to the number of sites you use the plugin on.</p>
<p>A complete documentation is available in the <a href="https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/wiki" rel="nofollow">GitHub repository Wiki</a>.</p>
</p>

";s:9:"changelog";s:5750:"<h3>2.9.0</h3>
<ul>
<li>Introduction of coding standards.</li>
<li>Switch to franc language detection API for the language check.</li>
<li>Do not longer overwrite the IP address WordPress saves with the comment by using <code>pre_comment_user_ip</code>.</li>
<li>Do not show &#8220;Trust commenters with a Gravatar&#8221; if the &#8220;Show Gravatar&#8221; option is not set.</li>
<li>Skip the checks, when I ping myself.</li>
<li>Fixes some wrong usages of the translation functions.</li>
<li>Use the regular expressions check also for trackbacks.</li>
<li>Add option to delete Antispam Bee related data when plugin gets deleted via the admin interface.</li>
<li>Save a hashed + salted IP for every comment</li>
<li>New check for incoming Trackbacks.</li>
<li>Introduction of behat tests.</li>
<li>Updates the used JavaScript library for the statistics widget.</li>
<li>Bugfix in the &#8220;Comment form used outside of posts&#8221; option.</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.8.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>PHP 5.3 compatibility</li>
<li>Bugfix where a spam trackback produced a fatal error</li>
<li>For more details see https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/milestone/8?closed=1</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.8.0</h3>
<ul>
<li>Removed stopforumspam.com to avoid potential GDPR violation</li>
<li>Improves IP handling to comply with GDPR</li>
<li>Improves PHP7.2 compatibility</li>
<li>Fixes small bug on mobile views</li>
<li>Allow more than one language in language check</li>
<li>Minor interface improvements</li>
<li>Remove old russian and Dutch translation files</li>
<li>For more details see https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/milestone/4?closed=1</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.7.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fixes an incompatibility with Chrome autofill</li>
<li>Fixes some incompatibilities with other plugins/themes where the comment field was left empty</li>
<li>Support for RTL</li>
<li>Solve some translation/language issues</li>
<li>A new filter to add languages to the language check</li>
<li>For more details see https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/milestone/6?closed=1</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.7.0</h3>
<ul>
<li>Country check is back again (thanks to Sergej Müller for his amazing work and the service page)</li>
<li>Improved Honeypot</li>
<li>Language check through Google Translate API is back again (thanks to Simon Kraft of https://moenus.net/ for offering to cover the costs)</li>
<li>More default Regexes</li>
<li>Unit Test Framework</li>
<li>Accessibility and GUI improvements</li>
<li>An <a href="https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/wiki" rel="nofollow">english documentation</a> is now available, too. Some corrections in the german documentation.</li>
<li>Some bugfixes &#8211; Among other things for WPML compatibility</li>
<li>For more details see https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee/milestone/3?closed=1</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.9</h3>
<ul>
<li>Updates donation links throughout the plugin</li>
<li>Fixes an error were JavaScript on the dashboard was erroneously being enqueued</li>
<li>Ensures compatibility with the latest WordPress version</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.8</h3>
<ul>
<li>added a POT file</li>
<li>updated German translation, added formal version</li>
<li>updated plugin text domain to include a dash instead of an underscore</li>
<li>updated, translated + formatted README.md</li>
<li>updated expired link URLs in plugin and languages files</li>
<li>updated <a href="https://gist.github.com/glueckpress/f058c0ab973d45a72720" rel="nofollow">plugin authors</a></li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.7</h3>
<ul>
<li>Removal of functions <em>Block comments from specific countries</em> and <em>Allow comments only in certain language</em> for financial reasons &#8211; <a href="https://plus.google.com/u/0/+SergejMüller/posts/ZyquhoYjUyF" rel="nofollow">more information</a> (only german)</li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.6</h3>
<ul>
<li>Switch to the official Google Translation API &#8211; <a href="https://plus.google.com/u/0/+SergejMüller/posts/ZyquhoYjUyF" rel="nofollow">more information</a> (only german)</li>
<li><em>Release time investment (Development &amp; QA): 2.5 h</em></li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.5</h3>
<ul>
<li>Fix: Return parameters on <code>dashboard_glance_items</code> callback / thx <a href="https://twitter.com/toscho" rel="nofollow">@toscho</a></li>
<li>New function: Trust commenters with a Gravatar / thx <a href="https://twitter.com/glueckpress" rel="nofollow">@glueckpress</a></li>
<li>Additional plausibility checks and filters</li>
<li><em>Release time investment (Development &amp; QA): 12 h</em></li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.4</h3>
<ul>
<li>Consideration of the comment time (Spam if a comment was written in less than 5 seconds) &#8211; <a href="https://plus.google.com/+SergejMüller/posts/73EbP6F1BgC" rel="nofollow">more information on Google+</a> (only german)</li>
<li><em>Release time investment (Development &amp; QA): 6.25 h</em></li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.3</h3>
<ul>
<li>Sorting for the Antispam Bee column in the spam comments overview</li>
<li>Code refactoring around the use of REQUEST_URI</li>
<li><em>Release time investment (Development &amp; QA): 2.75 h</em></li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.2</h3>
<ul>
<li>Improving detection of fake IPs</li>
<li><em>Release time investment (Development &amp; QA): 11 h</em></li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.1</h3>
<ul>
<li>Code refactoring of options management</li>
<li>Support for <code>HTTP_FORWARDED_FOR</code> header</li>
<li><em>Release time investment (Development &amp; QA): 8.5 h</em></li>
</ul>
<h3>2.6.0</h3>
<ul>
<li>Optimizations for WordPress 3.8</li>
<li>Clear invalid UTF-8 characters in comment fields</li>
<li>Spam reason as a column in the table with spam comments</li>
</ul>
<p>For the complete changelog, check out our <a href="https://github.com/pluginkollektiv/antispam-bee" rel="nofollow">GitHub repository</a>.</p>
